fields.title: Health
fields.description: Our ‘Health and wellbeing' cause supports movements raising awareness of physical and mental health conditions, promoting improved health care and wellbeing and bringing services and medicines to underserved communities.

fields.title: Safety
fields.description: Our 'Safe and inclusive communities' cause supports movements aiming to ensure that everyone can feel safe and included in their homes and communities. This ranges from providing people with shelter and helping protect them from harm, to building stronger and more inclusive communities, where everyone can thrive.and communities. This ranges from providing people with shelter, helping protect them from harm and building stronger and more inclusive communities, where everyone can thrive.

fields.title: Education
fields.description: Our ‘Education and citizenship' cause supports movements aiming to advance quality and accessible education for all learners, including the skills and knowledge needed to become proactive citizens. This includes raising awareness of inequalities in education, supporting teachers and mentors, promoting the use of relevant tools and ways of learning, and fostering global and local citizenship.

fields.title: Poverty
fields.description: Our ‘Poverty and economic opportunity' cause supports movements tackling poverty in its various forms and improving access to economic opportunities. This includes ensuring access to basic necessities (such as food, water and electricity), but also to decent employment and to financial independence and support.

fields.title: Environment
fields.description: Our ‘Environment' cause promotes different ways to protect our planet, from the conservation of natural ecosystems to the respect of animal welfare. This includes supporting movements tackling climate change, safeguarding biodiversity and defending animal rights.

fields.title: Equality
fields.description: Our ‘Equality and human rights' cause supports a wide range of movements tackling discrimination, campaigning to end human rights abuses and driving change to create more equal and inclusive societies.

fields.title: Donate to WaterAid
fields.what_description: Organise a fundraising event for WaterAid. From a sponsored walk or litter-pick, to a bake-off or milestone celebration, our Fundraising Toolkit can help make your event a success.
fields.why_description: Together, we can beat plastic pollution, deliver climate action and support green livelihoods where they are most needed.

fields.title: Take 7 actions to change the History curriculum
fields.what_description: Follow Runnymede’s suggestion of seven simple acts you can do in order to change the history curriculum to educate on the Black British experience, Colonialism and our histories of migration.
fields.why_description: Education is essential to reduce racial discrimination. These actions can help to make sure that Britain's young people learn more about Black British histories and gain a broader understanding and knowledge of the British empire’s history of migration and colonialism.

fields.title: Donate to NEA
fields.what_description: National Energy Action (NEA) - the national fuel poverty charity, work to ensure that everyone in England, Wales and Northern Ireland is warm and safe at home.
fields.why_description: More than 6.7 million people are now struggling to heat and power their home, donate to National Energy Action and help us fight fuel poverty.

fields.title: Donate to ACORN
fields.what_description: Chip in to fund ACORN: a movement that will transform the UK forever
fields.why_description: Help those suffering with the cost of living crisis

fields.title: Donate to turn2us
fields.what_description: Turn2us is a national charity that helps people in financial hardship to gain access to welfare benefits, charitable grants and support services
fields.why_description: A donation helps families struggling with rising costs to afford basics like food and shelter.

fields.title: Encourage local schools to sign up for free period products
fields.what_description: Support Free Periods' mission and promote the scheme to provide free period products in schools across the UK. Simply use the template letter provided to write to your local schools or college.
fields.why_description: Although the Government is offering free period products to all English schools and colleges, take up has been disappointedly low with only 40% of eligible institutions having signed up for the scheme at the end of 2020. But Free Periods are raising awareness of the scheme and encouraging schools to opt in and prevent the scheme from being revoked altogether.

fields.title: Sign a petition to stop supermarkets calling period products “feminine hygiene”
fields.what_description: Sign a petiton asking supermarkets to change their signposting in-store and online from ‘feminine hygiene’ or ‘sanitary products', to ‘period products’ or ‘menstrual products'.
fields.why_description: The use of the terms ‘sanitary products’ or ‘feminine hygiene products’ suggests there is something unsanitary or unhygienic about having a period when this is not the case. Avoiding terms like ‘period’ and ‘menstruation’, as though they are shameful, upholds the very real stigma around this natural bodily function. As well as this, the word ‘feminine’ assumes that all people who have periods are feminine, but this is not the case – trans men and non-binary people can have periods too, as well as the many trans women and cis women who don’t have periods at all.

fields.title: Advocate for clean community energy
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to the Minister of State for Business, Energy, and Clean Growth to take climate action and support clean community energy.
fields.why_description: Organised by People for Power, this campaign focuses on empowering community energy groups to start up and sell their clean electricity to locals through The Local Electricity Bill. This Bill would mean more investment in local services, greater energy security, more local skilled jobs, and a boost for clean energy generation across the UK.

fields.title: Raise your voice for people and the planet
fields.what_description: The climate breakdown is putting everyone’s present and future at risk. And those who have contributed the least to the problem are the most exposed. It’s not fair! It’s time for all of us to assert our rights, demand climate justice, and a dignified way of life, for all of us.
fields.why_description: The climate breakdown is putting everyone’s present and future at risk. And those who have contributed the least to the problem are the most exposed. It’s not fair! It’s time for all of us to assert our rights, demand climate justice, and a dignified way of life, for all of us.

fields.title: Sign a climate pledge
fields.what_description: Sign Climate Neutral Now's pledge to reduce your personal greenhouse gas emissions.
fields.why_description: By signing the Climate Pledge, you're sending a message to the decision-makers, to companies, and to all levels of society to implement ambitious policies and practices that prevent the harmful effects of climate change. Signing can secure the living conditions of mankind, as promised in the Paris Climate Change Agreement.

fields.title: Donate a Periods Matter pack to a school
fields.what_description: Sex Ed Matters create campaign-infused sex ed toolkits about consent, periods, gender, and more. Donate a period education pack to a low-income state school to help support teachers with teaching resources including booklets, activities, and posters.
fields.why_description: The toolkit have /been designed to ensure everyone has empowering period education, the confidence to speak up against period stigma, and the awareness to order free period products available.

fields.title: Send a personalised postcard to a loved one or stranger in need
fields.what_description: Send a postcard from the Support Your Sisters collection and ALL profits from your purchase will go to our partners at Simamanadada.org who provide young girls in Kenya with period products and skills training.
fields.why_description: Did you know that girls in Kenya can lose nearly 6 months of their high school education simply because they get their periods and don’t have access to menstrual pads? Men can even lure these young girls into sleeping with them in exchange for such basic necessities. If you want to change this reality, take action by joining our cause!

fields.title: Donate £10 to CliniQ
fields.what_description: CliniQ is a London-based Community Interest Company providing wellbeing and health services to Trans and Non-Binary people.
fields.why_description: This £10 would pay for a room for counselling.

fields.title: Share your period stories and challenge the stigma
fields.what_description: Share your funny, awkward or memorable period stories tagging #FreePeriodStories and ask your friends to do the same, or go to #FreePeriodStories, to watch the stories collected so far.
fields.why_description: We are taught from a very young age to hide our periods, to treat menstruation as a secret because it’s gross and unnatural. It’s no wonder that when we start our periods, we often find ourselves traumatised, bewildered, and isolated. But Free Periods are challenging the stigma by sharing people's stories.

fields.title: Use the Period Friendly Scale for your place of work
fields.what_description: Assess how period-friendly your organisation is using No More Taboo’s Period Friendly Scale and email the results to periodfriendly@nomoretaboo.org. You can then download a poster and marker to show you are a period-friendly organisation.
fields.why_description: 1 in 7 people are menstruating at any one time. Many of these will feel shame and embarrassment. Just the action of completing the initial assessment will open up new conversations about menstruation and help to create a more inclusive working environment.

fields.title: Watch the packaging free webinar
fields.what_description: RegisterThe zero waste webinar will be exploring the findings from a survey looking at the rise of packaging-free shops in Europe on what this means for waste reduction levels.
fields.why_description: It is important for citizens to rethink their consumption patterns and methods to generate less waste, and this involves being reflective over what products to buy. For instance, going to shops that offer packaging-free products and refilling stations. It is also important that people have key knowledge to have conversations about zero waste with other people, to spread as much awareness.

fields.title: Become an eco-cycle volunteer
fields.what_description: Become an eco-cycle volunteer. Eco-Leaders are taught Zero Waste practices, like properly sorting recycle and compost material so they can teach their family, friends, co-workers and neighbors. They get the word out about why these issues are important!
fields.why_description: Join over 1,000 Eco-Leader volunteers! We provide tools to help you bring Zero Waste practices to where you live, work, and play.

fields.title: Reduce your use of plastic
fields.what_description: Refuse single-use plastic; refill and reuse containers; stop using glitter; don't buy bottled water. All of these small actions have a huge impact on our plastic consumption.
fields.why_description: Scientists are predicting that there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish by 2050. It is imperative that we reduce our plastic waste by doing every small action we can.

fields.title: Volunteer with St. Mungo's
fields.what_description: Discover the opportunities to volunteer with St Mungo's across the UK.
fields.why_description: St Mungo's are always looking for volunteers to help them in the fight to end homelessness. Commit to as little as 1 hour per week in a range of different locations across the country.

fields.title: Tell your MP to back a new law to protect forests and people
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to ask your MP to take the Good Business Matters Pledge
fields.why_description: Help demand real commitment to protecting the environment, communities and workers.

fields.title: Tell Sainsbury's to stop selling farmed seafood
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to tell Sainsbury's to come clean and stop selling farmed seafood raised on wild caught fish.
fields.why_description: Sainsbury's seafood isn't sustainable. The farmed salmon are fed fish taken from oceans half a world away. All major UK supermarkets were caught selling farmed fish linked to the collapse of wild fish populations in Asia and Africa.

fields.title: Get Coca-Cola to stop producing plastic bottles
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to tell Coca-Cola to take meaningful action to tackle the mountain of plastic that it's created.
fields.why_description: Nobody asked for the three million tonnes of plastic that Coke admits to producing every year — nor for the harm it has done to our oceans and rivers. This petition will force Coca-Cola to consider new, ambitious targets to re-use and recycle the bottles they produce.

fields.title: Donate to MARINElife
fields.what_description: Make a donation to MARINElife via their online form. You can make a one-off or monthly payment, and decide how much you want to donate.
fields.why_description: No donation is too small. Your money will help this organisation to continue their research into the conservation of marine wildlife and their habitats.

fields.title: Donate to the Ocean Conservation Trust
fields.what_description: Make a one-off or monthly donation for a minimum of £3 via this online form.
fields.why_description: All donations, regardless of amount, help this organisation to carry out research and find solutions to protect our oceans.

fields.title: Show how you're breaking White Silence
fields.what_description: Using this tool from the Black Lives Matter UK campaign, share how you plan to deal with racist remarks and acts of discrimination in your everyday life — or how you have already done so.
fields.why_description: Be a member of the new Revolution, one that aims to break white silence and mental chains of racism. By showing that you're willing to speak out, you can stop the unjust, unbalanced fight of Black people, and inspire others.

fields.title: Discover a student's rights when staying in halls
fields.what_description: Learn from Citizens Advice about the rights of students living in student halls or university accommodation.
fields.why_description: As a student, it's important to know your key rights and responsibilities as an "occupier with basic protection." Understanding these rights can help you stand up for students in university accommodation. Knowledge is power!

fields.title: Ditch the glitter
fields.what_description: Discover a range of bio-degradable glitters that you can purchase - so you can sparkle guilt-free!
fields.why_description: Glitter is especially lethal to our oceans as it's made from microplastics that eventually end up in our food chains when plankton and shellfish ingest them.

fields.title: Purchase a beeswax wrap
fields.what_description: Purchase beeswax wraps to keep your food fresh as an alternative to cling film.
fields.why_description: Made using 100% cotton, pine resin, jojoba oil, and local beeswax, they are 100% natural and environmentally friendly, allowing no nasties to leach into your food whilst it's stored. They're reusable, compostable, and come in fun patterns too!

fields.title: Fundraise for ocean conservation
fields.what_description: Fundraise for the Ocean Conservation Trust in any way you enjoy the most — be it an ocean-themed bake sale, or doing an ocean swim. You can speak to a team member to transfer your funds, or donate directly on their online page.
fields.why_description: Your fundraising will help this organisation to educate people on the importance of our oceans, protect marine wildlife, and find solutions for future conservation.

fields.title: Volunteer for Sea Shepherd UK
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Sea Shepherd by completing their online application form. You can volunteer across a range of roles, including outreach and fundraising, as well as visiting schools and universities to educate students on the importance of our oceans.
fields.why_description: Sea Shepherds' success is all down to their volunteering network,  helping to shape UK campaigns, fundraising, and outreach.

fields.title: Sign this open letter to stop women being locked with their abusers
fields.what_description: Sign this open letter to ask the government to take immediate action in providing support for women experiencing domestic abuse. You will provide your name and email address.
fields.why_description: This open letter was set up to protect women from their abusers by giving immediate support, and get priority to these cases in court, provide emergency funding for refuges.

fields.title: Donate to AVA
fields.what_description: There are a number of ways that you can support AVA in its work towards ending violence against women and girls. Even if you can't donate yourself today, find out how you can join schemes that will donate to them on your behalf while doing your other shopping — all without costing you a penny.
fields.why_description: Against Violence and Abuse (or AVA) is a leading UK charity committed to ending gender-based violence and abuse through their learning resources, consultancy, research, and prevention work.

fields.title: Watch a Chickenshed production
fields.what_description: Chickenshed is a theatre company for everyone. It aims to create wonder out of chaos and help move towards a society where everyone can flourish
fields.why_description: Supporting organisations that create an environment where everyone can thrive is a crucial step in moving towards a more equal and inclusive society

fields.title: Join the Women's Aid #DeserveToBeHeard campaign
fields.what_description: Join the #DeserveToBeHeard campaign from Women's Aid and pledge to #HearHer. Read their survivor stories to gain insight into other people's powerful experiences of suffering, and sign up to receive their monthly newsletter to stay up-to-date and find out how you can help.
fields.why_description: Women's Aid's survivor platform is an empowering space for women to creatively share their own experiences in the format they choose. This campaign aims to highlight the devastating impact of domestic abuse on the mental health of women and their children — for we are stronger together and speak louder as one.

fields.title: Donate to MS Society
fields.what_description: Donate to MS Society, a multiple sclerosis charity organisation.
fields.why_description: Donations to MS Society helps support the charity in the advocacy work they do for those living with multiple sclerosis.

fields.title: Lockdown, lifelines and the long haul ahead: The impact of Covid-19 on food banks in the Trussell Trust network
fields.what_description: Read this report by the Trussell Trust to find out more about the impact of Covid-19 on food banks in the Trussell Trust network
fields.why_description: When the coronavirus pandemic struck, we had already been experiencing year-on-year rises in the number of people unable to afford food and consequently forced to use food banks across the country. Now, our research finds that the devastating effects of Covid-19 have led to thousands of new people needing to use a food bank in our network for the first time. This is not right. Read the article to find out more.

fields.title: Discover stories from those who escaped domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Read real-life stories from victims who have escaped domestic abuse. Then, share the stories with your friends and family, and help to make domestic abuse more universally understood.
fields.why_description: By sharing these stories, you will help others to understand how people experience domestic abuse, as well as potentially help them to recognise patterns in their own or others' relationships.

fields.title: Attend a free webinar on gender-based violence
fields.what_description: AVA (Against Violence and Abuse) offers a range of ways for you to educate yourself on gender-based violence. Sign up to one of their free, online training sessions.
fields.why_description: AVA is an independent UK-based charity. They are market leaders in training on gender-based violence and abuse, striving to keep all women and girls safe.

fields.title: Round up your purchases and donate to charity
fields.what_description: Download the Momentum app and set up a personalised giving rule so that every time you do a chosen activity, such as buying a cup of coffee, the amount will round up and the difference gets donated to a WASH charity.
fields.why_description: This raises money for high-impact WASH charities who are working on the ground to improve access to WASH facilities in poorer countries.

fields.title: Donate to ILGA
fields.what_description: Donate to ILGA World to ensure they are provided with the necessary resources to organise activist training and conferences.
fields.why_description: Your donations will help ILGA World to support human rights defenders around the world and to raise awareness of LGBTQIA+ human rights violations at international forums, including the UN Human Rights Council.

fields.title: Add your preferred pronouns to email and social media
fields.what_description: Add your preferred pronouns (she/her, he/him, they/them) to your email signature and any social media bios you may have. This link will take you to some examples of how you can incorporate your preferred pronouns.
fields.why_description: This normalises discussions around gender, which is a conversation that benefits everyone. It demonstrates that you care about individual preferences, and is a simple solution to accidental misgendering.

fields.title: Sign up to the OutRight newsletter
fields.what_description: Sign up to receive updates about global LGBTQIA+ issues. You may also receive invitations to events which you can attend to support these issues.
fields.why_description: Awareness provides you with the opportunity to take action and support our work advancing the human rights of LGBTQIA+ people — wherever and whenever possible.

fields.title: Donate for clean water and better sanitation across Uganda
fields.what_description: Donate what you can (with a minimum of £5) to Busoga to help bring clean, safe water, and hygiene and sanitation to communities across Uganda. Set up a regular direct debit or send a one-off payment.
fields.why_description: Support a high-impact WASH charity. Your donation will mean they can continue doing their amazing work to increase awareness and improve access to WASH facilities in Uganda.

fields.title: Donate to keep women and children safe
fields.what_description: Support Refuge by donating to their causes. You can choose the amount, however small, and whether you would like to donate monthly or as a one-off payment.
fields.why_description: Refuge supports thousands of women and children who turn to them when they’re trying to escape domestic abuse. Help them be there for every woman and child who needs them by donating today.

fields.title: Become a Women's Aid campaign champion
fields.what_description: Sign up to become a Women's Aid campaign champion. When you sign up, they'll email you all the information you need to get involved including resources, campaign updates and campaigning actions you can take forward.
fields.why_description: Every campaign that Women's Aid runs has actions for their campaign champions. Depending on how much time you have to give, you may be asked to sign a petition, send a tweet, set up a meeting with your MP to raise awareness, or secure local media coverage.

fields.title: Become a supporter of #EndChildFoodPoverty
fields.what_description: Join the #EndChildFoodPoverty movement to receive the newsletter and stay up to date with the latest developments and find out how you can help.
fields.why_description: We live in the 6th richest economy in the world. No child should go hungry in the UK, and the #EndChildFoodPoverty campaign helps to provide emergency services to help people who may be experiencing food insecurity.

fields.title: Email landlords and estate agents in Sevenoaks
fields.what_description: Use this template to email to your landlord or estate agent to see if they have any properties available for the refugee family of 4 due to arrive in Sevenoaks in Janurary 2021, which will be arranged by Sevenoaks Welcomes Refugees.
fields.why_description: The family will only be allowed to settle in the UK if a property is found for them in Sevenoaks, therefore it is important that a property is found.

fields.title: Buy tea to support NEMI Teas and SolidariTee
fields.what_description: Buy Fairtrade tea from NEMI Teas. Use the code SOLIDARITEE15 and 15% of the profit will go straight to SoldariTee supporting refugees. If you prefer coffee, on the other hand, you can also purchase coffee from Jericho Coffee Traders at https://www.jerichocoffeetraders.com/ using the code JCTXSOLIDARITEE and they will also give 15% of the profit to SoldariTee.
fields.why_description: NEMI Teas is a social enterprise that provides employment to refugees, providing them with local work experience and job readiness skills to enter the UK workforce, and helping them to integrate into broader society. SolidariTee is a charity that offers grants to legal aid NGOs to assist Europe’s most vulnerable, reducing the risk of unjust deportations and helping families reunite.

fields.title: Get your company to partner with Tent
fields.what_description: The Tent Partnership for Refugees is a global network of over 100 businesses supporting refugees. Companies that join Tent have the opportunity to learn more about the refugee crisis, share their efforts across the network, and gain access to relevant resources and events. There is no fee or expected financial contribution to join the Tent Partnership — just fill the form to learn more about how your company can become a member, or share it with your employer, along with the online guide.
fields.why_description: Despite the fact that leading businesses have already experienced the many benefits of hiring refugees, including higher retention rates, increased diversity, and a strengthened brand and reputation, many employers remain reluctant to hire refugees. You can make a difference by granting your company access to actionable information, and help to reduce unemployment among refugees.

fields.title: We demand #Asaferway petition
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to demand that people are able to make claims at the UK border points in northern France, and for identification and accelerated relocation for the most at-risk to make their asylum claims, with all the necessary safeguards in place.
fields.why_description: In the UK, petitions with 10,000 signatures or more get a response from the government and are almost always debated in parliament, so every signature really does make a difference and each vote counts. By signing this petition, you will be showing that there is public support to create legal ways to seek asylum in the UK.

fields.title: Listen to Right2Food
fields.what_description: Listen to this podcast to hear stories from the frontline of food poverty
fields.why_description: Hearing the experiences of families facing food insecurity first hand will help deepen your understanding of the reasons why children get caught in food poverty, and by understanding the root causes we can demand change from our government and institutions.

fields.title: Provision of WIFI in asylum seekers accomodation
fields.what_description: "The Mears Housing Group, an outsourcing company working in housing management and home care, are the UK’s biggest refugee landlord,  People seeking Asylum in the UK, who live in these homes, are now under 'lockdown' due to Covid-19. There is not wireless internet provided in Mears Housing for residents, leaving them disconnected from the outside world, and unable to access medical information, or online resources for home schooling. They are not allowed to work, so would not be able to pay for a WiFi connection. Being locked down in poor housing is also creating a high risk of mental health problems from social isolation.  Sign this petition to demand Mears provide free WiFi in all of their housing , so that residents can contact support workers, family in other countries, access medical information, education and entertainment."
fields.why_description: By signing this petition, you’re contributing to show that there is public support towards this issue. Having this essential service is vital to ensure the rights and well-being of asylum seekers and to facilitate their successful resettlement. Each vote counts and brings the petition closer to its goal.

fields.title: Support Doctors of the World
fields.what_description: Show your support for the work Doctors of the World do, providing healthcare to refugees and asylum seekers who are denied GP attention. Donate, take part in a challenge, or use one of their partner companies.
fields.why_description: The global refugee crisis presents an enormous challenge for healthcare provision, and supporting vulnerable refugees and migrants is at the heart of Doctors of the World's work. Migrants should have access to high-quality healthcare at every stage of their journey, regardless of their nationality, immigration status, or reason for leaving their country.  Help to empower refugees and migrants to access health services in the UK and abroad, advocate for national health systems to be more flexible and inclusive, and educate health professionals about how to engage effectively with migrant communities.

fields.title: Join Europe Must Act's creative collective
fields.what_description: Are you a creative and want to put your work to the services of refugees and asylum seekers? Europe Must Act is looking for painters, musicians, designers, photographers, and more to become founder members of their creative collective. Send them a message at onboardme@europemustact.org with the subject: "EMA Creativity Collective"
fields.why_description: Contribute to new ways to raise awareness and contribute to refugees' wellbeing with your creative skills.

fields.title: Send a letter to your MP regarding mental health after Coronavirus
fields.what_description: Send their local MP a postcard with the five tests MIND is asking the government to meet to make sure mental health is a priority after the peak of the pandemic
fields.why_description: Prioritising mental health has never been more critical. Many are experiencing problems for the first time and those of us who were already struggling are finding things even harder. The health and social care services are and will continue to be under pressure like never before. The devasting loss of life, the impact of lockdown, and the inevitable recession will have deep and lasting consequences on all lives.

fields.title: Talk to your employer about mental health support at work
fields.what_description: Read this article and discuss its importance with your employer. Encourage them to look at what they are doing to help support the mental health of those in their employment.
fields.why_description: The workplace can be one of the biggest drivers of mental health issues: at least one in six workers experiences a common mental health problem, such as anxiety or depression. It is therefore essential to ensure it is an environment in which people are able to talk openly and receive help when they need it.

fields.title: Write a welcome letter for an arriving refugee
fields.what_description: Write a letter that will become the heart of a welcome pack for refugees resettled in Scotland.
fields.why_description: Settling into a new community can be a hugely daunting experience, but you can help a refugee to feel included with your kind words of welcome.

fields.title: Send messages of hope to newly-arrived refugees
fields.what_description: Communicate a sense of strength and togetherness with an uplifting message for an Afghanistan refugee who's recently arrived in the UK. All skill levels accepted!
fields.why_description: Thousands of Afghan refugees are far from home in an unfamiliar place, worried about their loved ones and facing an uncertain future. In these challenging circumstances a message of hope and kindness from you can make a difference. No message of solidarity is trivial. Personalised messages can lift a person's spirit and make them feel seen.

fields.title: Donate period products to Freedom4Girls
fields.what_description: Donate in-date disposable or reusable menstrual products to a nearby Freedom4Girls donation station. If you're based in Leeds or another area of West Yorkshire, there are a number of donation stations in your area. For everyone else, get in touch with the charity directly to see how you can help with either products or monetary donations.
fields.why_description: Freedom4Girls needs donations and period products now more than ever to support those who struggle to afford or access sanitary wear.

fields.title: Sign Beat's petition to increase eating disorder training for Medical Students
fields.what_description: We need every doctor, including our GPs, to have the knowledge and skills to identify and support someone with an eating disorder. We're continuing our work with medical schools to support them to cover these complex illnesses fully in their curriculum, but we need your help to spread the message to GPs. In collaboration with Health Education England, we’ve developed a free course that equips all UK GP surgeries with the knowledge to spot the signs of an eating disorder. Tell your GP surgery about the course today!
fields.why_description: On average, UK undergraduate medical students receive less than two hours of teaching on eating disorders throughout their entire medical degree. Furthermore, 20% of medical schools do not include eating disorders at all in their teaching. With such limited teaching, key signs and symptoms may be missed and treatment delayed.

fields.title: Campaign for refugee rights with Safe Passage
fields.what_description: Safe Passage is a UK-based charity that helps child refugees access legal routes to safety. Contribute to this work through petitions, writing private and public letters, and organising supporter actions, to make politicians aware of what needs to be done to help lone child refugees in Europe. Sign up to get email updates about their work and how to get involved, and you can also find current campaigns to join on their website.
fields.why_description: When doors are being closed to refugees around the world, it is more important than ever to speak out. Every year thousands of child refugees arrive in Europe; almost half of them are unaccompanied and are thus at risk of being abused and trafficked. However, many of these children have a legal right to travel safely to a place of sanctuary. Safe Passage has helped over 1,800 child refugees. With proper support, you can help them to find safety and start rebuilding their lives.

fields.title: Take part in a cookery class run by a refugee
fields.what_description: Sign up for a cookery class run by a refugee where you'll get a chance to learn from talented cooks from around the globe. Discover dishes from Gambia, Iran, Syria, Ethiopia, Cuba, and more.
fields.why_description: These classes from Migrateful provide refugees with qualification and an income, creating the ideal conditions not just for learning English and building confidence, but also for promoting contact and cultural exchange with the wider community.

fields.title: Become a Crisis Volunteer with Shout
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Shout to help people who are going through a mental health crisis. Supported by Clinical Supervisors, you will work as part of their free, anonymous 24/7 text messaging platform.
fields.why_description: Shout provides support to anyone, anywhere and at any time who may be experiencing a challenging time with their mental health. As a volunteer, you could take someone in distress to a calmer moment, empowering them to take their next steps towards feeling better.

fields.title: Ask the government to take decisive climate action
fields.what_description: Please ask the UK government to take urgent climate action. And be the green and fair country we ought to be.
fields.why_description: Antarctica and Greenland’s ice is being lost 6 times faster than it was 30 years ago. That rate of ice melt is deadly for the wildlife that inhabits our frozen planet. And it’s a warning sign for all life on Earth. Including us. Because the clock is ticking on our chance to stop climate breakdown.

fields.title: Fill in an unpaid work calculator
fields.what_description: Add up the number of hours you spend working unpaid each week so the government can see the value of your work on a regular, recurring basis.
fields.why_description: Young women’s unpaid work keeps families afloat, provides job opportunities for others, and drives economic growth. Without it, society would fall apart, and it's important that we never negate these hours as unimportant.

fields.title: Take a quiz on unconscious bias in the workplace
fields.what_description: Take this quiz to find out whether you know the facts about unconscious bias that takes place in the workplace.
fields.why_description: Implicit bias is arguably the most significant psychological understanding of our times. Educate yourself on the complexities of unconscious bias by going through examples and addressing your own biases..

fields.title: Donate to the Future Fawcett programme
fields.what_description: Donate to the Future Fawcett programme that works to challenge traditional gendered caring roles and the undervaluing of care.
fields.why_description: Through this outreach programme, the Fawcett Society aims to educate young women and girls, and by donating, you can support their efforts in the campaign for gender equality.

fields.title: Share the work of Heads Together
fields.what_description: Take part in a campaign by Heads Together. Share your own film or story showing the difference that talking about mental health can make, and give others the confidence to open up too.
fields.why_description: It's important that we start speaking up about mental health, and so we have to create an environment of support and understanding. By sharing our stories, we can help to break the stigma surrounding mental health and give others the confidence to speak up.

fields.title: Donate to Feeding Britain
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to Feeding Britain, either as a one-off payment or regular monthly direct debit, to help work towards the goal that we live in a UK where no-one goes hungry.
fields.why_description: By supporting Feeding Britain, you are contributing to their work with national partners and local governments to take practical action to combat hunger across the UK.

fields.title: Sign this petition to stop unconditional bailouts of airlines
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to ask Rishi Sunak MP to stop unconditional bailouts of airlines. This petition, launched in the UK for Stay Grounded and Possible is part of an international effort to stop the aviation sector returning to business as usual.
fields.why_description: This will help to make sure that bailouts do not allow the aviation sector to return to business as usual after Covid-19. Demand that any public money used to bailout airlines is given on the condition that workers and the climate are put first.

fields.title: Watch a video on the real value of unpaid work
fields.what_description: UN Women expert Shahra Razavi reveals the true value of working unpaid, and how we can reduce the burden on women by tackling entrenched stereotypes.
fields.why_description: Around the world, women do the vast majority of the unpaid work, including child care, cooking, cleaning, and farming, all of which is essential for households and economies to function and yet less valued..

fields.title: Join efforts to stop Heathrow expansion
fields.what_description: A petition to ask Transport Secretary Grant Shapps to stop a third runway at Heathrow. An important part of encouraging a shift towards greener forms of travel after COVID-19.
fields.why_description: Heathrow airport is already the single largest emitter of carbon in the UK and a third runway would contribute an additional 6 million tonnes of carbon into the atmosphere every year.

fields.title: Ask businesses to incorporate a green recovery in their own plans
fields.what_description: Email, call, or talk to three businesses that you support to ask them to incorporate greener practices as we emerge from the lockdown. This could include reducing waste, switching to a greener energy supplier, or supporting flexible working arrangements.
fields.why_description: As consumers, we can vote with our feet. Consumer pressure helps to stimulate grassroots change and can create momentum for wider societal changes.

fields.title: Avoid shopping at supermarkets that are failing to tackle food waste
Take 5 easy steps to reduce waste
Join the Climate Strike Network
fields.what_description: Join the climate strike network.
fields.why_description: Together we can achieve more. By joining a group of youth strikers you become a part of community committed to driving mass systematic change to ensure a liveable future for all.

fields.title: Donate to the Climate Coalition
fields.what_description: Donate to the Climate Coalition, the UK’s largest group of people dedicated to action against climate change.
fields.why_description: Help the Climate Coalition build their movement by asking leaders to put in place the investment and policies needed to reach net zero. Your donation will contribute to the overall success of the initiative, leading to a cleaner and greener future.

fields.title: Ask Grant Shapps MP to cancel the government's £27 billion investment in roads
Ask George Eustice MP to fast-track the Deposit Return Scheme for drinks containers
Ask your local council to put heat pumps under parks
Attend a Climate Interactive Webinar
Join We Don't Have Time, a social network focused on climate solutions
Ask your employer to reduce waste in the workplace
fields.what_description: Ask your employer to reduce waste in the workplace by reducing, reusing, and recycling. Find inspiration from guides produced by the North London Waste Authority: http://wiseuptowaste.org.uk/businesses/wasting-less/
fields.why_description: Waste reduction is just as vital for organisations as it is for individuals. It can help companies to save money, has positive impact on the environment and may even give you a market advantage and enhance your reputation.

fields.title: Ask your MP to support green recovery
fields.what_description: Find your MP's contact details and send an email asking them to support green recovery.
fields.why_description: Contacting your local MPs is a great way to show widespread public support for green recovery. Put your opinion in front of government — your words can make a difference.

fields.title: Join the 4-Day Week campaign
fields.what_description: The 4-Day Week campaign advocates for a reduced working week in the belief that it will help our society, democracy, economy, and environment. Sign up to hear more about their activities and events, and to discover how you can help the campaign progress.
fields.why_description: As well as its wider societal and economic benefits, a 4-day week could be hugely beneficial for our environment, as it would mean less commuting, less time sat in traffic, and a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

fields.title: Get to know your local recycling points
fields.what_description: Read up on what you can recycle from home, and where you can drop off everything else. Look up a particular item or material, and find out how you can make sure it ends up in the right place.
fields.why_description: Not every council follows the same rules and accepts the same items in its recycling. Make sure you're up to date on how your local collection works to ensure you're putting the right rubbish in the right place.

fields.title: Change the way you browse online
fields.what_description: Ecosia is a web search engine that uses the revenue generated from your search habits to plant trees. You can help create forests simply by changing the way you browse online.
fields.why_description: We spend so much of our lives on the internet, so why not take this easy opportunity to make your online activity a little greener?

fields.title: Tell supermarkets to cut their plactic packaging
fields.what_description: Add your name to the petition and tell UK supermarkets to ditch throwaway plastic.
fields.why_description: UK supermarkets currently generate 900,000 tonnes of plastic packaging every year. By ditcing plastic packaging, supermarkets have the power to lead the way in dramatically reducing the amount of single-use plastic produced.

fields.title: Use Ecosia at your workplace
Green Industrial Strategy explained
What is a circular economy?
Donate zero waste cities
fields.what_description: Donate to Zero Waste Europe. This link will take you to a form where you can decide how much money you would like to donate.
fields.why_description: our donation helps Plastic Pollution Coalition continue their work toward a world free of plastic pollution. Plastic Pollution Coalition is a growing global alliance of individuals, organizations, businesses, and policymakers working towards a world free of plastic pollution and its toxic impacts on humans, animals, waterways, oceans, and the environment.

fields.title: https://www.climateactionnortheast.org.uk/easy-zero-waste-tips/
fields.what_description: Buy an item offered by 4ocean, including their branded bracelets, water bottles and flasks.
fields.why_description: Single-use plastic items are so common that it’s easy not to notice them. For instance, plastic bottles of water or soft drink; the plastic straws served in our drinks; the plastic bags we have to buy at stores; the plastic packaging of nearly product in the supermarket. Once you see all this stuff for what it truly is — plastic pollution — it’s simple to just reduce.

fields.title: Pledge to stride and ride
fields.what_description: Join the movement to promote alternative forms of travel that produce no emissions at all — walking, jogging, cycling, skating, scooting, blading, rolling, wheeling, and even skipping!
fields.why_description: By swapping cars and public transport for active journeys, we can show our support for an improved infrastructure for cyclists and pedestrians, and reduce carbon emissions at the same time.

fields.title: Subscribe to the Plastic Pollution Coalition
fields.what_description: Subscribe to this monthly newsletter to hear from the Plastic Pollution Coalition. Hear about their monthly webinars, current petitions, and how you can donate to support the cause.
fields.why_description: Single-use plastic items are so common that it’s easy not to notice them. Once you see it all for what it truly is — pollution — it becomes simpler to reduce. Start by using water bottles instead of plastic bottles, swapping new shopping bags for your own fabric ones, and asking for no straws in drinks.

fields.title: Go zero waste with these tips
fields.what_description: Use these 10 zero waste tips to start your journey on reducing waste. This link will take you to some tips that you can easily incorporate into your lifestyle, with minimal spending.
fields.why_description: These tips are perfect for beginners to get going with waste reduction. 2020 is on track to see a 30% increase in waste compared to 2019, therefore it is important to reduce our waste production now.

fields.title: Purchase zero waste items
fields.what_description: This link will take you to a list of items that you can purchase on your zero waste journey, including kitchen items, bathroom essentials, and even books to discover more about the subject. Find new brands that you never knew were sustainable and invest in a few with long-life items for your home.
fields.why_description: Of the 6.3 billion tons of plastic waste produced between 1950 and 2015, only 9% was recycled. Therefore, it is important that we switch to alternative non-plastic products to reduce waste and create a more sustainable future.

fields.title: Join a local Friends of the Earth group
fields.what_description: Join volunteers helping to protect your local environment. You can find your local Friends of the Earth group through the links below.
fields.why_description: Take active part in driving change and become part of the world's largest grassroots environmental network. Campaign for sustainable and just societies, and environmental protection.

fields.title: Sign up for Hope for Justice's monthly update
fields.what_description: Sign up for monthly update emails from Hope for Justice with breaking news on rescues, campaigns, and practical ways to help end modern slavery.
fields.why_description: Hope for Justice is a charity aiming to bring an end to modern slavery by preventing exploitation, rescuing victims, restoring lives, and reforming society. By signing up to receive their monthly update, you will find out more about what they do and how you can support.

fields.title: Call on the government to unleash the potential of rooftop solar
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to unleash the potential of rooftop solar
fields.why_description: Installing rooftop solar panels on new buildings and over car parks alone could generate nearly the same amount of power as 10 nuclear power plants. Time is running out to take meaningful action on the climate emergency. But we also have a duty to make the best possible use of our finite land and leave space for wildlife and homegrown food. That’s why we’re calling on the government to set a new and ambitious target for generating clean and affordable electricity from rooftops across the country.

fields.title: Email your MP about the cost of living catastrophe
fields.what_description: Email your MP about the cost of living crisis to remind them of the severity of this situation.
fields.why_description: While the government offers short-term solutions, your support can ensure they are constantly reminded of the true scale and urgency of this catastrophe until they take real action to tackle it.

fields.title: Cost of living crisis: stop homelessness now
fields.what_description: Call on your MP to write to the Housing and Welfare Secretaries of State today.
fields.why_description: People are struggling to survive. Without government action, people will lose their homes. The cost of living crisis is pushing renters to breaking point, and the government is sitting back while rents spiral out of control.  Last year, nearly 200,000 renters were hit with an eye-watering rise of more than £300 a month.

fields.title: How your businsess can help tackle the cost of living crisis
fields.what_description: Make a one off donation, set up a live match fund, or raise awareness among your colleagues who may be keen to organise a fundraise.
fields.why_description: Across the UK, charities and groups are supporting people affected by the cost of living crisis, and your business can help them to make a real difference.

fields.title: Support care workers during the cost of living crisis
fields.what_description: Donate to the Care Workers Charity to help support care workers during the cost of living crisis. Donation amounts are open to whatever you are able to offer.
fields.why_description: The cost of living crisis is severely impacting care workers, and demand for grants is rising as sharply as it did at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic. When petrol prices are at the highest ever recorded, home care workers are more likely to call in sick because they cant afford fuel. When the price of pasta doubles overnight, care workers earning the minimum wage are likely to skip meals or buy fewer fresh vegetables to save money. Help to ensure care workers can feed their families and keep up with rising household bills.

fields.title: Sign up to World Autism Awareness week with the National Autistic Society
fields.what_description: Sign up to World Autism Awareness week to get involved with different fundraising ideas and activities. Have fun whilst creating a better world for autistic people!
fields.why_description: Thank you to everyone who took part in World Autism Acceptance Week 2023.   There is still time to pay in any donations you have raised. Please select 'Pay in funds' under 'Make a donation' in the main banner area. Under 'please tell us about your donation' please select 'World Autism Acceptance Week'.   We are busy making plans for next year, so please register your interest below.  We need you, more than ever, to join us in supporting the 700,000 autistic people in the UK. Every penny raised by you, our amazing supporters, will help deliver our ambitious plans to transform our society into one that truly works for autistic people.

fields.title: Request free school meals for all primary school children
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to ask the government to provide free school meals for all primary school children across England.
fields.why_description: 3.9 million children are living in poverty in the UK — that's about eight children in every classroom. And the cost-of-living crisis is getting worse and more frightening every day. By offering free meals for primary school children, we can help to lessen the pressure on both schools and parents to ensure our next generation are taken care of.

fields.title: Support the #SaveOurServices movement
fields.what_description: Email your MP, as well as your MSP and MS if you live in Scotland or Wales, to tell them you care about council cuts and that you want them to support local services.
fields.why_description: Local government is in crisis. Councils have to spend billions of pounds to keep our communities running and protect the most vulnerable. Yet after years of constant cuts, local services are now stretched to breaking point.

fields.title: Get involved with one of the UK’s biggest unions
fields.what_description: Join 1.3 million other people in the UK and get involved by campaigning, mentoring, supporting branches in need, and more.
fields.why_description: Being a UNISON workplace rep gives you the opportunity to: make a positive difference to people’s work lives, learn new skills and meet new people, help create a fairer society.

fields.title: Donate to vulnerable communities
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to vulnerable communities in the UK during the cost of living crisis.
fields.why_description: Nearly seven million people are said to be going hungry in the UK, including two million children, which is an increase of 2 million since the COVID-19 pandemic.

fields.title: Sign for a cost of living support package for students
fields.what_description: Sign up and call on the UK government to develop a tailored cost of living support package for students on the brink.
fields.why_description: The government announced £15 million extra for hardship funding in universities to help students with the cost of living, but there's so much more that they can do, so the NUS Spring Budget submission makes five key recommendations to the government.

fields.title: Sign the petition for budget to boost Universal Credit
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to persuade the UK government to announce an emergency budget that increases Universal Credit for those in need.
fields.why_description: The government must act now to stop millions of people going hungry and falling into poverty. If we come together as a social movement demanding immediate action, we can push our prime minister to protect vulnerable households when they need it most.

fields.title: Donate to the Cambridge Autism Centre of Excellence
fields.what_description: Set up a regular or one off donation to the Cambridge National Research Trust to support their cutting-edge research into autism.
fields.why_description: The Autism Centre of Excellence at Cambridge has been established as a science-led campaigning charity working closely with Cambridge University’s Autism Research Centre. Our aim is to remove barriers stigma for autistic people. We commission breakthrough science, campaigns and partnerships to scale interventions, tools and adaptations to: Improve inclusion, acceptance, respect, and human rights of autistic people. Improve support for autistic people in education, employment, health, wellbeing, and criminal justice. Reduce avoidable deaths caused by suicide, epilepsy or other health conditions. Reduce avoidable hardship in life caused by inequality, exclusion, isolation or maltreatment.

fields.title: Provide 800,000 children in need with free school meals
fields.what_description: Add your name to this petition to tell the UK government to extend free school meals to the 800,000 children who need them more than ever.
fields.why_description: Every child deserves access to healthy, nutritious food, but sadly, this isn’t our reality. During lockdown, the young people at Bite Back 2030 — a youth-led movement to ensure all children have access to healthy, nutritious food — started a petition calling for free school meals to be provided during the school holidays. And it worked! Over 400,000 people added their names and helped to raise attention to the issue.

fields.title: Download the Freecycle+ app
fields.what_description: If you have an iPhone, download the Freecycle+ app through the App Store and browse through the things people are giving away for free in your neighbourhood.
fields.why_description: Rather than buying everything new, it's easy to give away your unwanted but reusable items to people in your local community, and to find free things that other people are giving away — no strings attached. It's all about reusing, and keeping good stuff out of landfills.

fields.title: Donate to Autism Aware UK
fields.what_description: Donate to to Autism Aware UK, a family-run charity raising awareness of autism whilst providing information and support to those whose lives are touched by autism.
fields.why_description: Autism Aware UK is a small, family run charity. Even a small donation is likely to have a big impact on their work in raising awareness whilst providing information and support for other families with autistic children.

fields.title: Donate to help prevent suicide
fields.what_description: Donate to enable more calls to people who need help. Just £8 from you could help save a life.
fields.why_description: The Campaign Against Living Miserably (CALM) are taking a stand against suicide. That means standing against feeling shit, standing up to stereotypes, and standing together to show that life is always worth living.125 lives are lost every week to suicide, and 75% of all UK suicides are male, but CALM exist to change this.

fields.title: 15 things to do if you are feeling lonely
fields.what_description: Tips and advice to help you cope with feelings of loneliness and isolation. Written with care, for you, by young people.
fields.why_description: Whatever it is that makes you feel lonely, and whatever loneliness means to you – know that we are here with you and want to help.

fields.title: Volunteer  at the No.1 Befriending Agency
fields.what_description: Volunteer to support as a befriender, peer support or digital champion.
fields.why_description: The No.1 Befriending Agency was formed in September 2016 by a group of professionals who, when working as carers for older adults, frequently experienced that the people they cared for longed for meaningful interaction in addition to the simple mechanical acts of care they received. Older people are sadly especially vulnerable to feeling lonely, as they often have a very limited number of social interactions in a week, mostly due to mobility issues. In order to tackle this loneliness and isolation, we created a befriending service where trained volunteers visit isolated older people and spend some time with them to have a wee chatter alongside a cup of tea.

fields.title: Become a campaigner for Mind
fields.what_description: Mind's campaigners work to get a better deal for people with mental health problems. Become a Mind campaigner today, and you'll be supported to speak out and take action.
fields.why_description: Stand up and speak out on the real issues that affect people with mental health problems every day. Because we mustn't give up until everyone experiencing a mental health problem gets support and respect.

fields.title: Read up on food waste facts
fields.what_description: Learn about the social and environmental impact of food waste
fields.why_description: 1.5 million adults in London struggle to afford to eat every day, 400,000 children are at risk of missing the next meal. Meanwhile, our food industry generates almost 2 million tonnes of good, edible surplus food each year.

fields.title: Loneliness and vulnerability toolkit
fields.what_description: If you are keen to help tackle loneliness in your neighbourhood, go through this range of free materials that you can use to reach people and raise awareness on the services available to them.
fields.why_description: Neighbourhood Watch's mission is to support and enable individuals and communities to be connected, active, and safe, as this can help to increase wellbeing and minimise crime.

fields.title: Share your stories online
fields.what_description: With Lonely Not Alone, discover some resources to help you get involved on social media or IRL, and share your personal story.
fields.why_description: Loneliness is something that happened to us; it isn’t shameful or embarrassing, and it isn’t forever. There was a before, and there will be an after. Saying we’re lonely may feel like a small step, but it takes a lot of courage, and by sharing our stories, we can take that step together. However hard it feels, we keep burning bright, and when an opportunity to share our story or to support someone going through a hard time appears, we take that one small step.

fields.title: Become a campaigner for the Royal British Legion
fields.what_description: Join the Royal British Legion community today to receive updates on their campaigns and how you can get involved.
fields.why_description: The RBL campaigns look to improve the lives of those in the Armed Forces to make sure their voices are heard.

fields.title: How can I manage loneliness?
fields.what_description: Read this article from Mind to discover practical tips on managing feelings of loneliness
fields.why_description: Feeling lonely isn't a mental health problem in itself, but the two are strongly linked. Having a mental health problem can increase your chance of feeling lonely.

fields.title: Donate to the campaign to end loneliness
fields.what_description: Donate to Living Streets to join their movement to help end loneliness
fields.why_description: People of all ages need connections that matter. They have been experts in the field of loneliness and connection since 2011 and our vision is that everyone can live a life free from chronic loneliness. We bring communities together to share research, evidence, and practice to make a difference to people’s lives.

fields.title: Organic vs. Free-range - what's the difference?
fields.what_description: Learn about the difference between free-range and organic eggs
fields.why_description: Trying to decide which type of egg is most ethical can be confusing so learn to choose the right product for your needs!

fields.title: Get the Good Fish Guide app
fields.what_description: Next time you go to buy fish in the supermarket, look it up and check that it comes from well-managed, sustainable stocks or farms.
fields.why_description: Unsustainably sourced fish, or overfishing, has a big negative impact on ocean biodiversity, depleting them of fish and other marine creatures entangled in the fishing nets as bycatch. The Good Fish Guide app helps you to check which fish come from sustainable sources, and even suggests restaurants which follow the environmental guidelines.

fields.title: The Impact of Overfishing, in Statistics
fields.what_description: Learn about the impact of overfishing in numbers though this infographic
fields.why_description: The global seafood industry contributes $870 billion to the worldwide economy and in the US alone supports over 1 million jobs. Howver, 10-12 million metric tons of fish are lost anually due to spoilage. Find out more about the impact of overfishing on the oceans as well as the communities whose livelyhoods depend on fishing.

fields.title: Give money to MARINElife
fields.what_description: Make a donation to MARINElife via their online form. You can make a one-off or monthly payment, and decide how much you want to donate.
fields.why_description: No donation is too small. Your money will help this organisation to continue their research into the conservation of marine wildlife and their habitats.

fields.title: Take a stand on Amazon fires
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to stop Tesco from buying from companies owned by JBS - the world's biggest industrial producer of meat and one of the biggest drivers of destruction of the Amazon rainforest.
fields.why_description: The Amazon and other forests are being slashed and burned, and replaced with cattle farms and soya plantations to produce meat. This brutal system is accelerating climate change, harming Indigenous people, and destroying our natural world.

fields.title: Download the STOP app
fields.what_description: Download the STOP app, a tool to report suspicions of human trafficking, enabling people across the world to join the fight against modern slavery. It can be downloaded by anyone with access to a smartphone.
fields.why_description: All information reported to the app is fed directly into the STOP THE TRAFFIK's secure database. The insights are then analysed and developed into informative reports, which are then shared with the appropriate authorities, organisations, and communities to enable a targeted response to prevent and combat human trafficking.

fields.title: Take Stop the Traffik's 'Spot the Signs' quiz
fields.what_description: Can you #SpotTheSigns? Challenge yourself to learn all the signs of human traffiking and take this quiz to prove your knowledge.
fields.why_description: By learning how to #SpotTheSigns and who to contact if you see something that doesn’t look right, you can help prevent exploitation from happening within your community. While many signs are covert and not always easy to recognise, there are a number of key indicators that are common across all types of exploitation.

fields.title: Tell Rishi Sunak to act and stop the famine in East Africa
fields.what_description: Sign this petition from Action Against Hunger to send a message to the British Prime Minister to act now and stop the famine in East Africa
fields.why_description: Families in East Africa are enduring the worst drought on record, with 50 million people facing-life threatening hunger and malnutrition. The UK government has promised to support the vulnerable, but we must stand to ensure they live up to their word.

fields.title: Write to your MP about the East African hunger crisis
fields.what_description: Share Bijay's story with your MP and draw their attention to the devastating hunger crisis in East Africa.
fields.why_description: Women like Bijay are facing the full force of both climate change and rising food prices. If we don't fight for UK funding, more women will struggle to provide for their children.

fields.title: Find a restaurant near you taking part in Love Food Give Food
fields.what_description: Visit a restaurant near you that's taking part in Action Against Hunger's Love Food Give Food campaign. By eating in the restaurant and requesting to add just £1 to your bill, you will be contributing to raise funds for their vital work. Just £1 can provide a mother with a day’s worth of life-saving food to treat a malnourished child.
fields.why_description: There are 11 million children around the world at risk of life-threatening hunger. Love Food Give Food brings the food and hospitality industry and their customers together to take action against hunger. Through our shared love of food, we can fight the hunger crisis and help vulnerable communities to build a brighter future.

fields.title: Donate to the UN's World Food Programme
fields.what_description: Donate either monthly or as a one-off payment to the World Food Programme, set up by the United Nations in their bid to end world hunger.
fields.why_description: There’s enough food in our world to feed everyone, and yet 828 million people go to bed hungry every night. The UN WFP believes that no mother or father should struggle to feed their child, and so every donation to them provides nutritious food for hungry children and families across the globe.

fields.title: Sign the petition to end starvation as a weapon of war
fields.what_description: Sign this petition from Action Against Hunger to tell Rishi Sunak and the UK government that you will not stand by while people are driven to starvation.
fields.why_description: Conflict is the leading cause of hunger and it's on the rise. Right now, the lives of half a million children are at risk from extreme hunger in conflict zones across the world, and when fields are destroyed, crops are stolen, wells are poisoned, and markets are bombed, people starve. The UK Government have made a promise to ensure vulnerable people can access food during conflict and end starvation as a weapon of war — but we've got to hold them accountable.

fields.title: Play Action Against Hunger's weekly lottery
fields.what_description: Join Action Against Hunger's lottery for just £1 per week, and each week, you’ll have the chance to win £25,000, along with other great cash prizes.
fields.why_description: The weekly lottery is a fun, exciting way that you can support an important cause and help fight hunger, so that all children can grow up to be healthy, happy, and strong. Playing their lottery for just one month could pay for 12 doses of therapeutic milk to help very young babies recover from life-threatening hunger. Playing for a year could help pay for a life-saving, 6-week treatment programme for one child.

fields.title: Sign the petition and get free transport for students
fields.what_description: Sign this petition from the National Union of Students and join the campaign for free transport for students and apprentices across the UK.
fields.why_description: Half of UK students and apprentices use public or personal transport to get to their place of study, but the cost of fares and petrol has become increasingly prohibitive. A 2023 NUS survey of more than 3,500 students found that 32% have skipped meals and 1 in 5 have missed classes due to the cost of travel. As always, it’s the students from disadvantaged backgrounds who are being hit the hardest, missing out on vital teaching time, harming their grades and limiting their opportunities.

fields.title: Find out what support is available to you as a student
fields.what_description: Find out more about the support students can get with tuition fees, course costs and living expenses.
fields.why_description: Knowing about the help and support available to students in the form of student grants, bursaries and loans from the Government is important to help spread the word that university education should be available to all.

fields.title: Join the People’s Assembly
fields.what_description: For the first time, you can join the People’s Assembly as a member and be part of creating the biggest, strongest, boldest movement for change.
fields.why_description: Changing to a membership system will help People's Assembly move to another level of mobilisation, meaning that all your voices and many more will be heard, loud and clear, on the streets and in the corridors of power. The People’s Assembly is all about you: your activism, your campaigns, your demonstrations, and your events.

fields.title: Email your MP to stop homelessness
fields.what_description: Call on your MP to write to the Housing and Welfare Secretaries of State today.
fields.why_description: In 2022, nearly 200,000 renters were hit with an eye-watering rise of more than £300 a month. People are struggling to survive, and without government action, people will lose their homes as the cost of living crisis is pushing renters to breaking point.

fields.title: Choose fish and seafood with the Good Fish Guide
fields.what_description: This app from the Marine Conservation Society helps you to select fish sustainably. It tells you which fish from which locations are in good supply — and which should be avoided at all cost.
fields.why_description: Today, 90% of world fish stocks are fully or over-exploited from fishing. With this app, you're able to search for your favourite fish or seafood, avoid certain breeds that are being exploited, and instead make new, ocean-friendly choices.

fields.title: Press freedom incidents in the USA
fields.what_description: Explore this database of press freedom incidents in the United States — everything from arrests of journalists and the seizure of their equipment, to assaults and interrogations at the U.S. border.
fields.why_description: Journalists and media reporters are putting their lives at risk to tell people's stories and share the truth of the news with the rest of the world, and yet so many of us remain unaware that this is going on. In order to protect our right to free speech, we must first understand the scope of the issue, before we can begin to take action against it.

fields.title: Donate to Red Cross
fields.what_description: Donate whatever you can today to Red Cross and support their international team across Libya as they provide people with first aid, search and rescue help, evacuation, and essential provisions.
fields.why_description: With thousands feared dead, the Libyan Red Crescent is helping deliver vital aid to survivors in the flooded areas, supporting with rescue efforts. The country is in desperate need of donations to help support its people in this time of crisis.

fields.title: Donate to Unicef
fields.what_description: Donate to Unicef as they help provide support to those in need across Libya. £39 could be life-changing for a family in danger and it provides them with an emergency water and hygiene kit.
fields.why_description: 300,000 children have been affected across the country, and that number is rising. Unicef's priority is to ensure children and families have access to clean water, medical supplies, family tracing and reunification, and psychosocial support in the aftermath of such devastating floods.

fields.title: Become a member of Reporters without Borders
fields.what_description: Sign up to become a member of Reporters Without Borders (RSF). To do this, you will need to make an initial donation of minimum 10 euros for students, or 30 euros for a regular membership. Thereafter, you will be able to participate in their activities, and lend support in demonstrations.
fields.why_description: RSF provides information about the media freedom situation worldwide. By becoming a member, it simply states that you are committed to their goals and are financially supportive of the organisation. You will receive information every month about the latest attacks on press freedom, and will be offered the opportunity to partake in activities and lend support in campaigns.

fields.title: Read about press freedom in the UK
fields.what_description: Read the article on how press freedom is violated in the UK, and how COVID-19 has exacerbated this.
fields.why_description: It is vital to ensure that free media exists to expose hypocrisy, corruption, wrongdoing, and abuse of power. This article will educate you and increase your awareness on how press freedom is restricted.

fields.title: Organise a charity fundraiser
fields.what_description: Whether you choose to run 10km, shave your head, or host a bake sale, organise a fundraiser and encourage your friends and family to donate money to help support those in urgent need across Libya.
fields.why_description: Although you may not feel that your small donation is enough, advocating for the cause and encouraging those around you to donate can make a big difference in the end. According to Penny Appeal, £50 can provide one month of food, £100 could offer clean drinking water, and £150 could mean crucial medical supplies reaching those in need.

fields.title: Post on social media about the Maui Strong Foundation
fields.what_description: Showing your support for those affected by the Hawaii wildfires is not only about donating yourself, but encouraging others to help too. The Maui Strong Fund has created a communications toolkit to provide you with sample language, a social media help, and more, so that you can share with your friends and family.
fields.why_description: The Maui Strong Fund is providing financial resources to support the immediate and long-term recovery needs for the people and places affected by the devastating Maui wildfires, so spreading the word about their work is crucial for them to succeed and help the people of Hawaii.

fields.title: Donate and support those impacted by the Hawaii wildfires
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to Red Cross as they seek to help people affected by the wildfires in Hawaii.
fields.why_description: Donating is one of the most effective ways to help those facing crisis to get the support they urgently need – whoever and wherever they are.

fields.title: Discover alternatives to plastic
fields.what_description: Read this guide of quick tricks to reduce your plastic consumption.
fields.why_description: The UK government thankfully introduced a ban on plastic straws and cotton buds in October 2020, but there's still tonnes of pointless plastic in everyday items such as toothbrushes, coffee cups, and even tea bags. We need to be more aware of when we're using plastic, and find alternatives that we can introduce into our daily lives.

fields.title: Play the Eco-Cycle Sorting Game
fields.what_description: Learn about zero waste in a fun way with this Eco-Cycle Zero Waste Sorting game. Sort materials correctly and win fun items to build your own digital park.
fields.why_description: Discover which items go in which recycling bin, and educate yourself on the finer details.

fields.title: Donate to education support to help teachers in need.
fields.what_description: Make a donation. Help us be there for teachers facing a crisis.
fields.why_description: Your support will help provide our 24/7 FREE and confidential helpline, or help provide a financial grant to someone in need.

fields.title: How to support staff wellbeing in schools
fields.what_description: Good staff wellbeing is essential for cultivating a mentally healthy school, for retaining and motivating staff and for promoting pupil wellbeing and attainment.
fields.why_description: As education staff juggle a multitude of different tasks and demands, it is important that everyone is given the right emotional and practical support so that they can, in turn, support their pupils.
