In addition to having a positive impact on colleagues and pupils, staff wellbeing can improve performance and job satisfaction, which can lead to reduced staff turnover. It can also help to reduce absence (both short and long term), increase productivity and promote staff engagement.

fields.title: Steps teachers can take to look after their mental health
fields.what_description: Advice on how teachers can look after their mental health
fields.why_description: We work towards good mental health for all; as everyone knows, prevention is better than cure. Everything we do is focused on protecting people's mental health.Our work involves rigorous research and practical projects to identify what's most helpful, public information that empowers people to look after their mental health and influencing work to move policies in the right direction. We know that some communities are at higher risk of mental health problems due to the social, economic, and environmental circumstances they find themselves in. Much of our work challenges these mental health inequalities by helping those at the greatest risk.

fields.title: Support for teachers in need.
fields.what_description: Teacher wellbeing has never been challenged more. Here are some resources that provide support.
fields.why_description: We are fundraising so schools can bring in urgent, interim mental health provisions.

fields.title: E-mail your counsellor to get teachers pay up
fields.what_description: UNISON is calling for for pay to rise by 2% above inflation, to help members cope with the cost-of-living crisis. Local councillors can voice their support for this pay rise, raising the issue directly with local government employers and demanding that they provide the pay rise school and council workers so desperately need. We need to come together and rise up to get pay up. Please email your councillor and convince them to use their influence to support hard-working staff, delivering vital local services.
fields.why_description: Local government staff provide a range of vital services, keeping our communities safe, clean and accessible, yet there is often little or no recognition for the hard work that goes on in these vital public services. With the cost-of-living skyrocketing to new highs every day, it’s time to rise up and demand decent pay for council and school staff. With inflation at an all-time high, more is needed in pay packets to account for increases in the cost of food, housing and heating.

fields.title: Quiz yourself on plastic pollution
fields.what_description: Find out how much you really know about the threats that our planet faces from plastic pollution.
fields.why_description: The waste humans generate has been detrimental to our environment for quite some time now, and we can no longer deal with it in a sustainable way. It isn't just causing a change in climate, but affecting our wildlife, damaging our environment, and even impacting public health.

fields.title: Apply for financial grants for teachers, teaching assistants and otehr staff in education.
fields.what_description: We offer a financial grants service for teachers, teaching assistants, supply and support staff, lecturers and retired staff. We know the cost of living crisis is having a big impact on many people working in education. Our team is processing an unprecedented number of applications from staff who are struggling.
fields.why_description: Everyone needs help occasionally. Our friendly, experienced team is here to support you.

fields.title: Wellbeing Tools for Teachers
fields.what_description: From easy-to-use toolkits and checklists to in-depth advice and support, we’ve produced resources on issues such as stress, workload, mental health, abusive behaviour and more...
fields.why_description: NASUWT members can get support, advice and information on employment-related issues.

fields.title: Discover the #OurRightsNow cost of living hub
fields.what_description: Browse the Just Fair hub built to raise awareness of the cost of living crisis. You can discover more about campaigning, donating, and showing your support online.
fields.why_description: The cost of living crisis is a human rights issue as it continues to increase inequality and suffering. The UK can be better but we have to act and hold our government accountable.

fields.title: Help Teach First hire trainee teachers
fields.what_description: Work with us to hire trainees who’ll make the biggest impact on your school and pupils – and a lasting difference in education. Together we’ll develop leaders who can unlock every pupil’s potential.
fields.why_description: Hiring teachers with us means you won’t have to deal with job ads or recruitment agencies. Our rigorous selection process ensures we find teachers who are the right fit for your school. What’s more, we’ll always make sure trainees are well prepared and in place at the beginning of the school year. You won’t have to bring in supply teachers and your pupils can start building relationships with new staff straight away. We’re experts at discovering potential and developing great teachers through our two-year Training Programme – rated ‘Outstanding’ by Ofsted.

fields.title: Sign the Pay Up! Save our Schools Petition
fields.what_description: We urge the Education Secretary, Chancellor and Prime Minister to get round the table with teaching unions now, and give you the pay deal you deserve, so you can get back to doing what you do best: giving our next generation the education that they deserve.
fields.why_description: We all know that picket lines aren't where any teacher wants to be. They want to be in classrooms, teaching our children. But teachers’ pay is falling way behind inflation, school buildings across the country are crumbling, the numbers of qualified teachers is falling, and some teachers are suffering from burnout and leaving the profession in droves. They have no other option. We know teachers across the country haven’t taken this decision lightly. They aren’t to blame for the crisis in education, the Government has caused this mess. And the Government are the only ones who can sort this out. If enough of us throw our weight behind a huge open letter, together we can show that parents, grandparents - all of us - are on the side of teachers. It could be enough to make the Education Secretary, the Chancellor and the Prime Minister get round the table and give teachers the pay deal they deserve, and get the strikes called off.

fields.title: Share the news that schools and colleges in England are eligible for free period products
fields.what_description: Share the news that all state-maintained schools and colleges in England are eligible for free period products under a new scheme launched by the Department for Education. If you don't have twitter, share on your other socials!
fields.why_description: Every state-funded school and college in England can order free period products for their students. Disappointingly, take-up has been low, with less than 40% of eligible institutions having signed up so far. Share to raise awareness of the scheme and encourage schools and colleges to opt-in.

fields.title: Make a pledge to change the way you talk about periods
fields.what_description: Make a pledge to tackle period shame and stigma by talking openly about periods, so that no one feels embarrassed talking about them.
fields.why_description: Language is very important in contributing to and tackling the stigma and shame around periods. Using language like 'sanitary' or 'hygiene' when we talk about periods implies that they are dirty, or something to be embarrassed about - they’re not! Sign up to this pledge to make a positive commitment for change.

fields.title: Sign a petition to make all menstrual products plastic-free
fields.what_description: Sign a petition calling on manufacturers and supermarkets to make all menstrual products free from plastic, including tampons, applicators, pads, wrappers, and packaging.
fields.why_description: Conventional, disposable period products contain up to 90% plastic. The production of the plastic and the improper disposal of these products is causing increased pollution and filling up landfills, so it is crucial that we make a change to inflict minimum environmental damage.

fields.title: Donate to the Morocco earthquake emergency appeal
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to Islamic Relief as they urgently seek to take care of those affected by the earthquake in Morocco at the start of September.
fields.why_description: With over 3,000 people confirmed dead and 360,000 affected, the people of Morocco need your help to find food, shelter, and medical support.

fields.title: Donate to Unicef to support Morocco's children
fields.what_description: Give what you can to Unicef as they support Morocco after the devastating earthquake. £32 can provide a healthcare worker with a first aid kit, while £39 gives a family emergency water and hygiene support.
fields.why_description: Unicef's Children's Emergency Fund allows them to reach children and families in crisis, fast, to help those who have lost their homes and are in urgent need of shelter, safe water, and medical care

fields.title: Fundraise or crowdfund for Morocco
fields.what_description: Even if you yourself are unable to donate in support of those suffering in Morocco after the earthquake in September, then you can instead take charge of pooling funds from your friends and family.
fields.why_description: By organising a way that you can encourage those around you to donate even the smallest amounts to this urgent cause, you can pull together larger amounts to support the charities that are on the ground in Morocco.

fields.title: Find out how you can help victims of the Hawaii wildfires
fields.what_description: Volunteers and aid groups have mobilised to help those affected by the Hawaiian wildfires disaster. Learn how you can help through donations to a range of different support groups.
fields.why_description: With hundreds dead and some still missing, Hawaii needs our help to support the families whose lives have been shattered by the devastation of August's wildfires. Every penny donated can help to provide not only food and shelter, but begin the process of rebuilding their beloved island.

fields.title: Read "Not Every Disability Is Visible"
fields.what_description: Read the article "Not Every Disability Is Visible."
fields.why_description: This article gives a brief overview about invisible disabilities, which will provide a good basic understanding of the issue central to this campaign.

fields.title: Take on a challenge event.
fields.what_description: Get involved! Run, trek, swim, cycle... take on a challenge to raise funds for some of the poorest communities around the world to gain access to clean water.
fields.why_description: Support Just a Drop to Transform people's lives by taking part in this event to provide sustainable safe water, sanitation and hygiene projects to communities.

fields.title: Donate long life food, tinned food as well as toiletries and other essential items to the head office of the You Trust in Portsmouth.
fields.what_description: Donate long life food, tinned food as well as toiletries and other essential items to the head office of the You Trust in Portsmouth.
fields.why_description: These donations are for survivors of domestic abuse and people who have had to flee their homes. The donations help them initially get them back on their feet before they can find a new home. The address of the head office in Portsmouth is: South Wing, Admiral House, 43 High Street, Fareham, Hants PO16 7BQ

fields.title: Donate to Stop the Traffik
fields.what_description: Donate to Stop the Traffick to fund thier important efforts to stop human trafficking.
fields.why_description: Stop the Traffick is committed to ending human trafficking and modern slavery through intelligence-led prevention. Your donations help them to do this in a number of ways.

fields.title: Join the Build Back Better virtual rally
fields.what_description: Drop a pin outside the Houses of Parliament and let the government know that we need to build back better.
fields.why_description: We might not be able to take to the streets right now, but we can still make our voices heard. Show support for a Green Recovery today.

fields.title: Read Books2All blogs on educational inequality
fields.what_description: Read Books2All blogs on educational inequality

fields.title: Donate to Fibromyalgia Action UK
fields.what_description: Donate to Fibromyalgia Action UK.
fields.why_description: Donations to Fibromyalgia UK helps support the charity in the advocacy work they do for those living with fibromyalgia.

fields.title: Listen to the podcast on how to stop viral misinformation
fields.what_description: Listen to this podcast on how to stop viral misinformation and learn how to identify fake news and false reporting.
fields.why_description: This video will help us practice better 'information hygiene', by ensuring that misinformation does not go viral.

fields.title: Shop at Sustrans
fields.what_description: Sustrans are the experts on the National Cycle Network and they've mapped every inch of it. Browse their full range of maps, guides and accessories in their Sustrans shop.
fields.why_description: Every purchase supports their work to make it easier for people to walk and cycle.

fields.title: Join Beat's Eating Disorders Research team
fields.what_description: If you have personal experience of an eating disorder as a sufferer, carer, or professional, consider taking part in a research project aimed at better understanding these conditions.
fields.why_description: Further research is essential to help us end the pain and suffering of eating disorders. With your own experiences you can help professionals to continue learning more about these complex mental health conditions.

fields.title: Share this rehousing social post
fields.what_description:
"Share the following message on social media and email: URGENT APPEAL
Can you help?
The government resettlement scheme for refugees is due to restart in the coming weeks. We have a refugee family of four who will hopefully be arriving in Sevenoaks in Jan 2021, only IF we can find a suitable property. We need your help to find a 3 bed property in the Sevenoaks District Council area ASAP. Tonbridge, Tunbridge Wells, or Maidstone areas may also be possible.
If you have an available property or know any landlords interested in the scheme, please do get in touch directly with Doug Ellish at Sevenoaks Welcomes Refugees on ellish.doug@gmail.com.
Have a look at our FAQ page for landlords and learn more about the compensation and assistance landlords are entitled to under the scheme:
https://www.sevenoakswelcomesrefugees.org/get.../landlords
Please share this post with your friends!"
fields.why_description: The family will only be allowed to settle in the UK if a property is found for them in Sevenoaks, therefore it is important that a property is found.

fields.title: Sign Young Mind's petition to limit the long-term impacts of the coronavirus pandemic on young people’s mental health
fields.what_description: Sign a petition calling on the government to take urgent action to make sure that, as we emerge from the pandemic, all young people can get the help they need when they need it.
fields.why_description: 83% of young people have said the coronavirus pandemic has made their mental health worse. A quarter of young people who were accessing mental health support before the crisis are no longer receiving it. Action is urgently needed to prevent young people's mental health needs from escalating further.

fields.title: Watch a story of support for young refugees and asylum seekers in the UK
fields.what_description: Learn the story of Zakaria, a young refugee who arrived alone in the UK. Thanks to Young Roots, an organisation based in London, he got back on his feet, learnt English, found friends and a community to belong to.
fields.why_description: Learning about the impact of the solutions is as important as understanding the issues. Through this learning material you'll undertsand how organisations are changing the lives of young refugees, showing how far your support to them can go.

fields.title: Take part in 'Miles for Mermaids'
fields.what_description: Enter a race and run, jog, walk, or cycle 5km, upload a picture of your achievement and you'll get sent a medal, and £5 of each £14 entry will go to Mermaids UK.
fields.why_description: This event supports the charity Mermaids, who provide assistance and support to gender diverse and transgender youth.

fields.title: Donate to UK Youth
fields.what_description: Donate to UK Youth to help support their aim of ensuring all young people are equipped to thrive and empowered to contribute at every stage of their lives.
fields.why_description: Your donation will help UK Youth continue their work to ensure that the youth sector is strengthened, supported, and delivers high-quality outcomes.

fields.title: Learn about the stories of people in Ukraine
fields.what_description: Read about the human stories of people who are living through the conflict in Ukraine.
fields.why_description: We must not forget the people who are the heart of this crisis, therefore it is important to read about those who are affected on the ground.

fields.title: Write to your MP to urge the government to implement the Global Resettlement Scheme
fields.what_description:
This link will open a pre-drafted email that you can personalise and send to your MP. Don't forget to find and add your MPs email address here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP.  
Remember to add any personal motivations to support refugee resettlement: personal requests, even if very short, are more likely to have an answer than copied templates. Let your voice be heard!
fields.why_description: The Government's 5-year Syrian Vulnerable Resettlement Scheme expires this year. While the government has made plans for this to develop into a Global Resettlement Scheme, there are concerns that they may not go ahead with them. This would affect thousands of refugees, and could increase their risk of harm if they are not rehomed safely.

fields.title: Call on your local independent companies to use accessible toilet signage
fields.what_description: Call on your local independent companies to use accessible toilet signage.
fields.why_description: This page has a list of resources that you can download and share with local businesses or your office in order to raise awareness on non-visible disabilities such as Crohn's disease and Ulcerative Colitis.

fields.title: Connect with other young women
fields.what_description: Sign up to various facebook groups and free events to connect with more young women.
fields.why_description: You can meet other young women who have similar experiences to you, take part in discussions and surveys, enter competitions, find out about opportunities like events, training or volunteering and share useful links and tips with the group.

fields.title: Volunteer at local food bank or charity with Fareshare
fields.what_description: Help with serving food, stacking shelves or driving food to different locations.
fields.why_description: Fareshare redistribute surplus food to charities that turn it into meals. 933,178 people per week are supported by these charity members.

fields.title: Volunteer in London for the Felix Project
fields.what_description: The felix project are looking for volunteers at 4 locations in London. Volunteer as a driver/co-driver, in the warehouse, or on walking/cycling routes where you’ll collect food leftover at the end of the day from cafes, delis, and bakeries and deliver this to charities helping the homeless and other vulnerable groups in Central London.
fields.why_description: Volunteering at The Felix Project is a great way to fight food waste and hunger in London and give back to your local community. It's also a fun way to keep fit, practise mindfulness and meet different kinds of people. Plus, any food that they are not able to distribute is free for volunteers to take home (but you do so at your own risk!).

fields.title: Join ocean clean-ups
fields.what_description: Arrange your own beach clean by picking up all the rubbish and plastic that you find.
fields.why_description: Over five trillion pieces of plastic currently litters the ocean shoes. A simple act can help protect coastlines and marine wildlife.

fields.title: Send an eco-friendly e-card
fields.what_description: Instead of heading to the shop for a card, simply choose a design, personalise your message, and send now or schedule for later online.
fields.why_description: Perfect for every occasion and easy to send, e-cards will help protect the planet by reducing the volume of waste that ends up in our oceans.

fields.title: Sign the petition to criminalise threats to share intimate images
fields.what_description: Sign this petition by Refuge urging the Government to change the law and make threatening to share intimate images illegal.  Currently, sharing an intimate or sexual image or film without consent is a crime; yet threatening to do so is not. This leaves millions of people living in fear. A straight-forward change to the law could provide much needed additional protection for survivors of domestic abuse.
fields.why_description: 1 in 7 young women (18 to 34) have experienced threats to share intimate images. This form of abuse can have an enormous impact on mental health and emotional wellbeing - shockingly, 1 in 10 women who had experienced threats to share their images felt suicidal as a result (Refuge). A simple change in the law could help prevent this.

fields.title: How nature can protect us from pandemics
fields.what_description: Watch this 1-minute video by the UN Environment Programme to learn how we can create a future in which both people and nature can thrive.
fields.why_description: It is vital for each of us to spread awareness so that more people can join the battle towards a more sustainable future. The challenges we will be facing in the nearest future need unprecedented solutions and urgent action. But how do we do it?

fields.title: Start or join a Community Sponsorship Group
fields.what_description: Community Sponsorship empowers people across the UK to welcome refugees into their local communities and support them as they rebuild their lives in safety. Find out more about joining a Community Sponsorship Group and find groups near you on the Sponsor Refugees website using the link below or email communitysponsorship@citizensuk.org
fields.why_description: Community Sponsorship is a big responsibility, but it has been recognized as one of the most effective ways for refugees to successfully resettle and be included in their new communities.

fields.title: Read 'Who are the victims of domestic abuse?'
fields.what_description: Read this quick fact sheet about who is most at risk of domestic abuse.
fields.why_description: Anyone can be a victim of domestic abuse, but some people – particularly women – are more likely to be victims.  Numerous factors make certain people more likely to be affected by domestic abuse than others, including age, income, ethnicity, religious background and level of ability. Understanding why these disparities exist can help us to tackle their root causes and advocate for policies that protect everyone.

fields.title: Volunteer with a humanitarian charity in Europe
fields.what_description: Indigo Volunteers connects volunteers with their humanitarian partner organisations working  in the context of the Balkan and European migratory routes. Volunteering opportunities have recently reopened with several charities providing vital support to refugees, asylum seekers and other migrants in Europe.
fields.why_description: When you volunteer through Indigo Volunteers you are supporting small, grassroots organisations who really need your help and expertise. Volunteering with these organisations gives you the opportunity to make a huge difference to the lives of some of the world's most vulnerable people.

fields.title: Switch to Ecosia as your internet browser at home and at your workplace
fields.what_description: Ecosia is a web search engine that uses the revenue generated from your search habits to plant trees. You can help create forests as an indirect result of your searching.  Start using Ecosia as your search tool today, and find out more about how your work place could use Ecosia using the link below.
fields.why_description: Why not take this easy opportunity to make your online activity a little greener? Ecosia servers run on 100% renewable energy and every search request removes 1kg of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. So far Ecosia has planted more than 100 million trees!

fields.title: Learn about LGBTQ+ rights in the US
fields.what_description: Test your knowledge on LGBT anti-discrimination laws in the United States.
fields.why_description: Legal protection from discrimination is still a struggle for LGBTQ+ people in the United States, and it is important that more people are becoming aware of this situation.

fields.title: Volunteer with NIDAS
fields.what_description: NIDAS offers a comprehensive training programme and many volunteering opportunities to allow you to support people affected by domestic abuse.
fields.why_description: By volunteering, you can play a crucial role in supporting people affected by domestic abuse.

fields.title: Rescue unsold meals with Karma App
fields.what_description: Download the Karma app and rescue unsold meals.
fields.why_description: One third of all food produced is thrown away annually, resulting in 1.3 billion tonnes of waste worldwide. Karma connects surplus food from retailers to consumers for a lower price, reducing food waste. Win-win!

fields.title: Write to your MP to #Invest2EndAbuse
fields.what_description: Support SafeLives in urging the UK Government to  include a full statutory duty on local authorities to provide both accommodation-based and community-based services for adult and child victims, as well as perpetrators of abuse. You can write your own message or use the template available on the SafeLives website.
fields.why_description: Two women a week die at the hands of their partners or ex-partners, and one in five children experience domestic abuse growing up. Currently, these people face a postcode lottery for support – this needs to change.

fields.title: Take the white privilege test
fields.what_description: Adapted from Peggy McIntosh’s ‘White Privilege: Unpacking the Invisible Knapsack,’ this exercise helps both white people and people of colour explore the presence of white privilege in British society.
fields.why_description: When we talk about racism, we tend to focus on the presence of discrimination for people of colour rather than the way in which racist structures benefit white people. This tool helps to highlight examples of white privilege that can otherwise go unnoticed.

fields.title: Organise a material aid collection for refugees in Northern France
fields.what_description: Why not ask your friends, family, colleagues and neighbours if they have anything they could donate to refugees living in Northern France? You can collect the donations, or advertise a day where people in your community can drop off donations at a pre-specified location. You can then give the donations to one of Collective Aid's supporting groups across the UK and Benelux who can deliver the donations directly to the charity's warehouse.  Check out the list of donation requirements via the link below, including tents, sleeping bags, blankets and men's trainers. Then to get started, email the Collective Aid donations coordinator at calaisdonations@collectiveaidngo.org
fields.why_description: In 2019 Collective Aid sent a team to Northern France to take over the largest material aid operation in the region from Help Refugees and L’Auberge des Migrants. The charity supports a population that currently stands around 1,500 people with essential and life-saving aid

fields.title: Read at least 3 pieces of anti-racism literature
fields.what_description: Want to learn more but not sure where to look? The Anti-Racist Educator's list of non-fiction, poetry, and fiction is a great place to start. Choose at least three pieces of literature to work through in your own time. Once you're done, pass them on to a friend!
fields.why_description: Unlearning racism is a slow and ongoing process. By reading more on the topic, you can deepen your understanding and benefit from a wider range of perspectives.

fields.title: Watch 'Why talk toilets?'
fields.what_description: Watch this short WaterAid video to find out more about access to decent toilets and the impacts of poor sanitation facilities.
fields.why_description: Access to decent sanitation facilties is essential for almost every aspect of life. By learning more about the issue we will be in a stronger position to advocate for universal access to WASH and to take effective action.

fields.title: Learn a new language taught by a refugee
fields.what_description: Interested in learning a new language?  NaTakallam offers award-winning, high-quality language learning programs delivered by refugees, for all levels of Arabic, French, Persian and Spanish, as well as professional translation services to individuals and organizations worldwide. Book yourself a session or a set of sessions to get started!
fields.why_description: Only 30% of refugees live in countries with the full legal right to work (UNHCR). NaTakallam connects refugees and displaced people to income opportunities in the language sector as online language tutors, translators, and cultural exchange instructors, helping people provide for themsleves and their families.

fields.title: 5 ways transport could change after Covid-19
fields.what_description: Read the Friends of the Earth article on 5 ways transport could change after COVID-19. How can we make the transportation and travel greener and accessible for all?
fields.why_description: Building back better and introducing greener solutions will pose many challenges to our lives. One of the most important aspects we must reconsider is travelling and transportation. We need a plan and thoughtful solutions regarding the sustainable transportation, its safety, and long-lasting positive effects.

fields.title: Sheffield City Council, stop using Glyphosate
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to Sheffield City Council to stop using Glyphosate.
fields.why_description: Glyphosate-based herbicides such as RoundUp and Touchdown pose a real risk to the public, our environment and horticultural workers. Roundup kills beneficial insects. Argentinian studies suggest that glyphosate use leads to a decline in honeybee activity, which pollinate three quarters of the world’s crops.

fields.title: Become a member of the Anti-Slavery movement
fields.what_description: Become a member of the movement by donating a one off payment or more regularly to support Anti-Slavery in continuing to free more people from slavery every year.
fields.why_description: If you share their belief and determination, join Anti-Slavery today. You'll be joining a long line of abolitionists who have never given up hope that all people can live their lives in freedom.

fields.title: Watch a video about how climate change impacts water supplies
fields.what_description: The climate is changing and will continue to change, affecting societies mainly through water. This short United Nations (UN) video highlights the need to start combining climate change adaptation and mitigation through water, improving the provision of water supply and sanitation services and combating both the causes and impacts of climate change, including disaster risk reduction.
fields.why_description: We cannot address climate change without considering water. We need to start incorporating climate change into our water management planning so that those most vulnerable can withstand the impacts of climate change and become resilient.

fields.title: Read this article about how periods affect girls’ education in the developing world
fields.what_description: Read this article to understand how periods can have detrimental affects on  girls’ education,  limiting future opportunities and affecting self-confidence in girls at a crucial point in their lives.
fields.why_description: The beginning of menstruation is a significant factor that is often ignored and undoubtedly affects secondary enrollment rates for girls in the developing world. In a 2011 study, many girls in Kenya stated that they preferred to experience their periods at home and viewed menstruation as “the most significant social stressor and barrier to schooling.” According to the 2015 United Nations Children’s Fund, one in ten girls in Africa miss school days during her period, and some of those girls drop out entirely. More needs to be done to ensure girls are not being deprived of their right to education because of something as basic and human as menstrual health.

fields.title: Buy a gift from WaterAid Shop for Life
fields.what_description: Next time you're shopping for a gift for someone, why not select something from the WaterAid Shop for Life? You can choose from a wide range of charity gift cards, which can then be personalised and sent as a printed card or e-card, whilst the money will go straight to supporting WaterAid's vital work.
fields.why_description: In the last year alone, WaterAid reached ~1.36 million people with clean water and decent toilets, and over 2 million people with good hygiene. They need support from people like you to keep driving change on this scale.

fields.title: Watch a video about refuges in the UK
fields.what_description: Watch this short introductory video made by the charity Refuge about how refuges are maintained in the UK, and how they provide shelter and wider support to women and children who have experienced domestic abuse.
fields.why_description: This video will give you a better understanding of the vital services that domestic abuse charities provide to survivors.

fields.title: Watch 'The Marathon Walker'
fields.what_description: Watch this short video by Water for Africa which tells the story of Sibatou Sanneh, a woman from Gambia, who travelled to Paris with the charity to walk in the marathon carrying 20kg of water on her head, a distance women walk in Africa every day to fetch water for their families. The full 26 minute video depicting this story can be found in the learning centre.
fields.why_description: This is a great example of the work charities are doing to raise awareness about the WASH crisis and the distances women have to walk to collect water in some parts of the world.

fields.title: Read about the types of domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Domestic abuse is not always physical. Read this short article by Stop Domestic Abuse to better understand the various forms of domestic abuse, such as financial, sexual and emotional abuse.
fields.why_description: Better understanding the various forms that domestic abuse can take will put you in a better position to protect yourself and others from any kind of abuse.

fields.title: Watch a video about WASH in health care facilities
fields.what_description: Watch this short World Health Organization (WHO) video to hear from people all around the world who are committed to improving WASH in healthcare facilities.
fields.why_description: In health care facilities, a lack of water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) is especially devastating. In maternity settings, the situation is often worse, putting mothers and babies at risk of deadly infections. The unacceptable yet motivating data on the lack of WASH in health care means that now is the time to act in order to save and improve lives. If you cannot ensure a good quality of care in a health care facility, where else? WHO and UNICEF are coordinating global efforts, working with partners to support countries to provide quality care. The World Health Assembly resolution on WASH in health care was approved in 2019, the revolution starts now, with you!

fields.title: Sign the petition for all unaccompanied refugee children to have a guardian
fields.what_description: Support this youth-led petition run by The Children's Society charity asking for unaccompanied and separated children in England and Wales to be given a guardian to support them.
fields.why_description: Thousands of unaccompanied and separated children live in the UK without their parents. Many have endured incredibly difficult journeys and find arriving in a new country overwhelming.  Scotland and Northern Ireland provide separated children with a guardian to support them and help them start rebuilding their lives, but England and Wales do not.

fields.title: Download the Good Fish Guide app
fields.what_description: Next time you go to buy fish in the supermarket, look it up and check that it comes from well-managed, sustainable stocks or farms.
fields.why_description: Unsustainably sourced fish, or overfishing, has a big negative impact on ocean biodiversity, depleting them of fish and other marine creatures entangled in the fishing nets as bycatch. The Good Fish Guide app helps you to check which fish come from sustainable sources, and even suggests restaurants which follow the environmental guidelines.

fields.title: Sign the petition to stop refugees being made homeless during the pandemic
fields.what_description: The Government has postponed evictions for social and private tenants until August 23rd, yet is set to resume evictions of refugees housed in temporary accommodation. Hundreds of refugees now fear imminent homelessness.  Sign Refugee Council's petition calling for a consistent Government approach to housing and public health that ends discrimination against refugees and the introduction of a realistic timetable for resuming of evictions to reduce anxiety and ensure refugees have time to find suitable, alternative accommodation.
fields.why_description: Evictions are distressing for anyone at the best of times. Resuming evictions during the pandemic puts refugees at increased risk of homelessness, of contracting COVID-19, and of transmitting the virus in the community. These evictions are particularly concerning when reports have shown that BAME individuals, which includes many refugees, are at a higher risk of becoming seriously ill or dying from the virus.

fields.title: Donate the money you would have spent on buying drinks to a WASH charity for a week
fields.what_description: Not ready to visit the pubs yet? Choose a charity such as Afrinspire and donate the amount of money you would usually spend on buying drinks for a week to them.
fields.why_description: This action directly raises money for charities who are working on the ground to improve access to WASH facilities in low- and middle-income countries. Afrinspire, for example, supports local partner organisations across East Africa working at the grassroots level to tackle the root causes of poverty.

fields.title: Find out how to support someone affected by domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Read this short SafeLives guide about how to support someone who is affected by domestic abuse or who you think might be at risk.
fields.why_description: Lockdown is difficult for everyone. For those living with an abusive partner or family member, it is dangerous, traumatic and relentless. Opportunities to get support are more limited than ever so offering support becomes even more valuable.

fields.title: Contribute to Anti-Slavery
fields.what_description: Donate to help free adults and children from slavery today and protect people from exploitation tomorrow.
fields.why_description: Anti-slavery work together with local organisations to secure the freedom of those affected by slavery and press for effective implementation of laws against slavery. This contribution would enable them to work all around the world to prevent modern day slavery within supply chains that produce our daily essentials.

fields.title: Watch 'Fighting the Power: Britain after George Floyd' on BBC iPlayer
fields.what_description: In this documentary, the BBC charts the wave of anti-racism protests that swept the UK after the death of George Floyd as the UK was forced to confront structural racism within its own borders. Once you've watched the documentary, share it with your friends to spread awareness.
fields.why_description: Learn more about actions and current movements taking place across the United Kingdom and consider how willing the UK is to take on and challenge its history of racial discrimination and colonisation.

fields.title: Faster, further and fairer on the climate and nature crisis
fields.what_description: What will the world look like after the pandemic? It is a crucial moment to decide. Watch this video by the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR) to learn how the UK needs to act ‘faster, further and fairer’ to combat climate and nature crisis and rebuild the economy.
fields.why_description: To tackle the challenges that come along with both the climate crisis and the global recession, the UK government should focus on a green recovery. There is a pressing need to strike a new economic balance and to do so with respect towards the environmental goals.

fields.title: Support clean community energy
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to the Minister of State for Business, Energy and Clean Growth to take climate action and support clean community energy. Organised by People for Power, the campaign focuses on empowering community energy groups to start up and sell their clean electricity to locals through The Local Electricity Bill.
fields.why_description: The Local Electricity Bill would mean more investment in local services, more energy security, more local skilled jobs and a boost for clean energy generation across the UK.

fields.title: Share a Media Fredom Fact on social media
fields.what_description: Share one of our facts that we have provided you with on social media.
fields.why_description: Sharing facts on press freedom ensures that you are spreading awareness on the issues we are facing with press freedom, and you are playing an important role in educating your friends and family.

fields.title: Watch Wahida's journey across the Mediterranean
fields.what_description: Wahida and her two sons made the treacherous journey across the Mediterranean Sea - a journey that claims thousands of lives every year - in a dinghy. She came to find protection for her family from persecution in Iran. Watch this short video by the International Rescue Committee (IRC) and share their story.
fields.why_description: By better undertanding why people are forced to flee their homes and the kind of journeys they often endure to reach Europe, you can become a better ambassador for making safe and legal routes to safety accessible to refugees and asylum seekers.

fields.title: Spread the word about how to recognise domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Share this short women's aid guide about how to spot signs of domestic abuse with your friends, family and wider social network.
fields.why_description: Many people experience domestic abuse without recognising it as such. Helping raise awareness about what constitutes as abuse is crucial for helping people identify and stop cases of abuse.

fields.title: Watch the 'Most Shocking Second a Day Video'
fields.what_description: How does the life of a child change with war? Watch this short SaveTheChildren clip to get an insight.
fields.why_description: It can be very hard for people who have never experienced war, persecution or natural disasters to imagine what it must like to be forced to flee your own home. But just because it isn't happening here, doesn't mean it's not happening. Maybe take a minute now, and try to imagine what it would be like for you and your family to flee your home. Better understanding the terrible situations that make people like you and I 'asylum seekers' or 'refugees' can help us emphathise with them, better understand their decisions and inspire us to do more to support their welfare and resettlement.

fields.title: Send a message of solidarity to a young refugee
fields.what_description: Let a young refugee know they are not alone by sending them a postcard or letter. You could include a drawing or a painting, a poem or a piece of advice. A question, or a thought. Visit the refugee support network (rsn) website using the link below to find out more, prepare your message and then email rsn a photo, or post the message if you feel it's safe to do so.
fields.why_description: For many, especially those who have recently arrived in the UK, the changes associated with the pandemic present a real risk of triggering recent traumas related to separation and lock-down. Charities like refugee support network need your help to reassure young refugees and asylum seekers, and to let them know they are not alone.

fields.title: Pledge to 'Stride and Ride'
fields.what_description: Join the Possible movement to promote alternative forms of travel that produce no emissions at all - walking, jogging, cycling, skating, scooting, blading, rolling, wheeling, or even skipping!
fields.why_description: By swapping cars and public transport for active journeys, we can keep ourselves and those around us safe and well during the pandemic. It's also a great way to show public support for improved infrastructure for cyclists and pedestrians.

fields.title: Ask Rishi Sunak to stop unconditional bailouts of airlines
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to ask Rishi Sunak MP to stop unconditional bailouts of airlines. This petition, launched in the UK by Stay Grounded and Possible, is part of an international effort to stop the aviation sector returning to business as usual.
fields.why_description: Make sure that bailouts do not allow the aviation sector to return to business as usual after Covid-19 has been defeated. Demand that any public money used to bailout airlines is given on the condition that workers and the climate are put first.

fields.title: Watch a video about the global trends in forced displacement
fields.what_description: How many displaced people are there in the world? Where do they come from? What kind of solutions can we find? Watch this video to find out.
fields.why_description: Learn a few key facts and concepts to better understand forced displacement.

fields.title: Read a quick summary about asylum in the UK
fields.what_description: Read the answers to 10 of the most common questions about asylum in the UK.
fields.why_description: Asylum practices vary from one country to another. These 10 items will give you an overview of what it means to be a refugee in the UK. Get informed and challenge potential misconceptions.

fields.title: Challenge your friends to spot the signs of fake news
fields.what_description: Share one of our learning materials we have provided you with on how to spot fake news with your peers.
fields.why_description: By helping increase awareness on how to spot fake news, you are educating us on the distinction between fake news and real news.

fields.title: Watch Hassan Akkad's story: "My journey to Europe"
fields.what_description: Hassan Akkad shares his personal story of fleeing his home and job as an English teacher in Damascus, Syria to journey to Europe. Learn about his experience turning the camera on himself in the documentary Exodus to record this life-risking journey that thousands of refugees have made. Through is BAFTA-winning documentary, he has provided a voice for many unheard refugee stories.
fields.why_description: By better undertanding the journey that refugees goes through, you can become a better ambassador for their cause and spread a message that often remains overlooked.

fields.title: Buy a t-shirt from SolidariTee
fields.what_description: Buy an ethically manufactured £10 t-shirt. All proceeds go towards supporting SolidariTee’s chosen organisations and individuals who provide legal and other forms of sustainable aid to refugees.
fields.why_description: Support the funding of legal aid NGOs to assist Europe’s asylum seekers. In the short term, legal aid minimises the risk of an individual who has a legitimate claim to asylum from being deported unjustly and brings family members, scattered across Europe, back together again. This aid allows refugees to begin prosperous lives beyond camps, and gain rights to education, accommodation and healthcare.

fields.title: Sign up for Freedom of the Press Foundation's newsletter
fields.what_description: Sign up to receive news in relation to press freedom violations.
fields.why_description: Threats to press freedom around the world are at an all-time high. Sign up to stay up to date and take action to protect journalists and whistleblowers everywhere.

fields.title: Discover Mito's experience of modern slavery in the UK
fields.what_description: An estimated 40.3 million people were victims of modern slavery in 2021 — Mito was one of them. She lived as a slave for three years in the UK, before she managed to escape. Watch this video depicting her experience.
fields.why_description: Listening to people's experiences is the first step to raising awareness and tackling modern slavery.

fields.title: Join your local Europe Must Act group
fields.what_description: #CitiesMustAct is a bold new campaign asking the citizens, councils, and mayors of towns and cities across Europe to pledge their support for the immediate relocation of asylum seekers on the Greek islands. Join your local city group to connect with people fighting for refugee rights, or send an email to onboardme@europemustact.org and receive a phone call detailing how you can get your city involved.
fields.why_description: We have to hold politicians to account and stem the tide of populism which has spread dangerous fear rhetoric across Europe. You can advocate for the resettlement of refugees and asylum seekers in your local area, and connect with some amazing people interested in refugee rights.

fields.title: Sign up to be an Agenda Campaigner
fields.what_description: Sign up to be a campaigner and spread the word about #AskAndTakeAction. This campaign is to introduce a duty on public authorities to ensure frontline staff make trained enquiries into domestic abuse.
fields.why_description: We need to introduce a duty on public authorities to ensure frontline staff make trained enquiries into domestic abuse, and our #WomeninMind campaign to ensure mental health services respond to the needs of women.

fields.title: Visit Juliette's family in Madagascar in a 360 interactive experience
fields.what_description: Immerse yourself in this 360 interactive experience where you'll be transported to Juliette's family in Manjakandriana, Madagascar. Juliette has never known clean water. She drinks, washes and cooks with dirty water. This is normal for her, but it shouldn't be. Meet Juliette's family to discover what everyday life is like in their village.
fields.why_description: This is a great way to help understand and engage with the lived realities of people's lives in Madagascar. Let's make access to clean water a reality for communities like theirs in Madagascar.

fields.title: Buy an item from the Choose Love store
fields.what_description: The Choose Love store sells real products for refugees. Every item in their store represents a similar product or service in one of the 120 projects they support around the world. Shop your heart out and they'll send your gift to one of their amazing projects.
fields.why_description: Every item you purchase will help Choose Love protect and support some of the world's most vulnerable people today with everything from lifesaving search and rescue boats to food and legal advice.

fields.title: Watch a video about why access to water is unequal
fields.what_description: Access to WASH is unequal. These effects are felt most by people who are marginalised such as women, children, the elderly, disabled and minorities. Watch this short WaterAid video to find out more.
fields.why_description: Unequal access to WASH locks people in inquality. Understanding the causes to this inequality is vital to providing effective solutions.

fields.title: Buy from the Big Issue
fields.what_description: Buy a product from the Big Issue.
fields.why_description: The Big Issue produces magazines and through this, they help empower people through creating opportunities for employment and stability.

fields.title: Watch the video SDG 6: ambitious but not rocket science
fields.what_description: We live in an era of technological miracles. We are on track to create reusable space rockets, driverless cars, robot workers and artificial intelligence….So, how is it possible that we are off track to ensure that everyone in the world has sustainably managed water and sanitation? Watch this WaterAid video to find out what we are doing to ensure that everyone in the world has sustainably managed water and sanitation by 2030.
fields.why_description: Becoming more educated about the causes and impacts of a lack of access to WASH in LMICs will better prepare you for taking effective action and coming up with sustainable solutions.

fields.title: Sign the #LeaveNoOneBehind petition
fields.what_description: Add your signature to the online petition advocating for the evacuation of overcrowded refugee camps, necessary quarantine and protective measures, access to medical care and access to asylum assistance
fields.why_description: In Lesbos’s Camp Moria alone, over 20,000 people live in a camp built to accommodate only 3,000. It is imperative to raise awareness to address the overcrowding and get people the help they need

fields.title: Calculate your carbon footprint
fields.what_description: Calculate your carbon footprint to find out more about the greenhouse gas emissions that result from your daily life.
fields.why_description: Find out more about your lifestyle's environmental impact in terms of CO2 emissions. Check the carbon footprint of your house, your car, and your holiday flights, and learn more about how to take action to decrease it.

fields.title: Sign a petition to open up properties as refuges for victims of domestic abuse
fields.what_description: By clicking on this link, you will be able to sign a petition that focuses on opening up properties to provide refuges for victims of abuse. You will only have to provide your name and email address.
fields.why_description: This action will help to make use of empty properties as overflow space for refuges, and call for funding for essential equipment.

fields.title: Hear an MP's personal story of domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Women from all walks of life experience domestic abuse, including public figures. Watch this short video from Sky Newsto get insight into what abuse is and how it evolves through the eyes of the MP Rossie Duffield.
fields.why_description: This video sheds light on a personal story of domestic abuse, as well as providing insight into the aims of the 2019-21 Domestic Abuse Bill.

fields.title: Watch a video about being quarantined with an abuser
fields.what_description: This short video from Sky News describes how lockdown has exacerbated domestic abuse in the UK, as many people (primarily women) are stuck with their abusers and have nowhere to go.
fields.why_description: Watch this video to better understand how lockdown has made life even more difficult for many people affected by domestic abuse in the UK.

fields.title: Be shown around Moria by a refugee doctor
fields.what_description: Listen to a story directly from a refugee camp. Sardar is a doctor who fled Syria and now lives in the Moria reception centre on the Greek island of Lesvos. This space was designed for 2,200 people but is now hosting over 18,000. This short video by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) gives you direct insight into the  camp conditions.
fields.why_description: We often hear about refugees in Greece, but do we take the time to learn what life is actually like there? Change starts by getting informed. Learning more about one of the most critical places in Europe for the refugee crisis is key to better understand the situation and why we must act now.

fields.title: Help a woman or child escape domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Choose from a selection of Refuge parcels to help provide vital support to women and children affected by domestic abuse in the UK, starting from just £10.
fields.why_description: Refuge parcels are bundles that women and children urgently need when escaping domestic violence. These bundles range from supporting the operation of helplines, to providing emergency accommodation for women and children who have fled their home.

fields.title: Could the coronavirus crisis spur a green recovery?
fields.what_description: Could the coronavirus crisis spur a green recovery? What is being done already? What else is there to do? Read this short BBC article to find out!
fields.why_description: The pandemic has cut greenhouse gas emissions. For now. We must make sure we reshape the reality and maintain the balance between sustainable development and economic growth. The EU have proposed a Green Recovery Plan. Now it's time for the UK to face the challenge.

fields.title: Find out how to support someone who you think might be affected by domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Read this short women's aid guide to understand how to better identify abuse and what you can say to a survivor in order to validate their experiences and encourage them to seek help.
fields.why_description: The chances are high that you know someone who is experiencing abuse behind closed doors. Unless they are very open about their experiences, it can often be difficult for you to acknowledge the problem directly. However, there are some basic steps that you can take to assist and give support to a friend, family member, colleague, neighbour or anyone you know who confides in you that they are experiencing domestic abuse.

fields.title: Sign a petition to prevent modern day slavery in the UK
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to prevent modern day slavery for workers in Leicester.
fields.why_description: Factories in Leicester have been breaking the government lockdown rules from day 1 and a lot of them have been involved in the furlough scams. These factory workers are paid as little as £2.75/hr working 10 hours a day. We need your help to take this to the House of Commons.

fields.title: Switch to a renewable energy supplier
fields.what_description: Read Conscious Creative's list of the top 5 renewable energy companies in the UK, and consider switching to a renewable energy supplier today.
fields.why_description: To tackle global warming, the energy sector must transition from fossil fuels to alternative power sources, and as renewable energy sources are growing, they are reducing in cost. Stand for the environment and switch to a green provider to make the change happen.

fields.title: Check the reliability of the news sources you use
fields.what_description: Go through the document to check whether the news sources you use might be biased, fake, or clickbait.
fields.why_description: It is important to identify which news sources out there are reliable, and which ones may not be, so that we can change our news consumption habits accordingly.

fields.title: Watch a video about signs of abusive relationships
fields.what_description: People affected by domestic abuse sometimes don't even realise that their partner is abusive. This short video by Fixers UK describes key characteristics of many abusive relationships.
fields.why_description: After watching this short video, you will be able to spot common signs of domestic abuse and better understand how relationships can become abusive over time, putting you in a better position to protect yourself and those around you.

fields.title: Find out more about a 'Green Industrial Strategy'
fields.what_description: What will it take to tackle the climate crisis? Watch this short IPPR (Institute for Public Policy Research) video to hear their ideas.
fields.why_description: The IPPR is the UK's leading progressive think tank. They believe that 2020 must be the year we kick off a decade of decisive action on the climate and nature crises through a Green Industrial Strategy. Industrial strategy should be "mission-based" and there's no mission more critical than getting to carbon neutral. By better understanding the kinds of steps needed to work towards a green recovery, we can put pressure on companies and governments to ensure they make the necessary changes to protect our planet before it's too late.

fields.title: Watch this video by the Soil Association
fields.what_description: This short video demonstrates the positives of organic farming on our soil’s health. Organic farming sustainably grows products without excessive pesticides and rigorous farming techniques to preserve the quality of our soil for future generations.. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: Sustainable farming methods have to be implemented worldwide to prevent degrading our soil.  Learning more about organic farming will enable you to make conscious decisions to create an impact on the environment.

fields.title: Call on the government to keep the Tampon Tax Fund which supports vital female-focused services and charities.
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to ask Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak to keep the Tampon Tax Fund which supports vital female-focused services and charities.
fields.why_description: In 2016, the government launched the ‘Tampon Tax Fund’ which gave all the money that HMRC gained from tampon tax (£15m annually) to female-focused charities. This is a small amount of money for the government to give (0.19% of the annual budget). Yet, it has gone a long way to support underfunded but vital services predominantly for women, who have been disproportionately impacted by the tax on period products. Now that the tampon tax is going to be scrapped from January 2021, we are asking the government to continue giving the equivalent of the Tampon Tax fund to female-focused charities.

fields.title: Join Anti-Slavery's 'End Cotton Crimes' campaign
fields.what_description: Sign Anti-Slavery's petition to stop the exploitation of labour workers in Uzbekistan. The petition aims to put more pressure on their government to reform its forced labour system.
fields.why_description: Every year the governments of Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan, two of the world's largest exporters of cotton, force hundreds of thousands of people out of their regular jobs and send them to cotton fields to toil for weeks in arduous and hazardous conditions. Some have even died in fields from extreme heat and accidents.

fields.title: Join Kwanda, an organisation supporting Black communities
fields.what_description: Kwanda is a non-profit organisation made up of people (or 'villagers') who want to build reliable and empowering systems for Black communities. With a minimum contribution of £1 per month, you can fund projects and have the option to vote on potential new initiatives.
fields.why_description: To change a system currently rigged against Black communities, those affected by discrimination need funding. Kwanda operates in a transparent, democratic way to ensure that funds are well-spent.

fields.title: Make your home more energy-efficient
fields.what_description: Whether you’re a homeowner, private or social renter, student, or you live at home with your parents, there are many things you can do to reduce how much energy you use and how much you spend. Follow the Energy Saving Trust's advice to make your home more energy-efficient. If you're able to make bigger changes, check out their home improvements guide: https://energysavingtrust.org.uk/home-energy-efficiency/home-improvements
fields.why_description: We have to tackle the climate crisis together. Our daily behaviour is responsible for almost half of all carbon emissions, so it's vital that we all take small steps to make a big difference.

fields.title: Say no to cruel and inhumane Illegal Migration Bill
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to ensure victims of slavery in the UK are protected.
fields.why_description: Seeking asylum and protection from trafficking are not crimes. The UK government is trying to scapegoat survivors of slavery and trafficking and casting unjustified doubt on the validity of their trafficking claims. This is a dangerous precedent that puts people at risk.

fields.title: Support a just and green recovery in Scotland
fields.what_description: Sign this Friends of the Earth Scotland petition to encourage the Scottish government to reprogramme the economy so that it works for people and the planet.
fields.why_description: We must now seize the opportunity to promote climate action and social justice. We must build back a better Scotland that focuses on our collective wellbeing, with strong public services and a decent income for all.

fields.title: Call on the Chinese government to free Uyghurs from forced labour
fields.what_description: People belonging to ethnic, cultural, and religious groups in northwestern China, including Uyghurs, Kazakhs, Kyrgyz, and Hui, are currently the target of the largest organized detention of an ethno-religious minority the world has seen since World War II. Since 2017, over one million have been detained. Detainees are made to work under constant surveillance, with assigned minders and no freedom to leave. Their forced labour contributes to the production of goods for numerous multinationals. Sign this petition to stop this from happening.
fields.why_description: This year, reports revealed that the forced labor of Uyghurs has been expanded beyond the Uyghur Region, with at least 80,000 Uyghurs transferred to factories across China where they cannot leave, are constantly surveilled, and must undergo “ideological training” to abandon their religion and culture.

fields.title: Call on foreign businesses and institutions to divest from forced labour in Eritrea
fields.what_description: Call on foreign businesses and institutions to divest from forced labour in Eritrea.
fields.why_description: The Eritrean government’s program of mandatory and indefinite national conscription traps its population in forced labour for long stretches of their adult lives. The system is aided and abetted by numerous international governments and companies. The goal is for all foreign organizations that are complicit in the Eritrean government’s system of forced labour to divest and cease their support and to publicly declare their opposition to forced conscription. This would make it both politically and economically costly for forced conscription to continue and thus incentivise the government to put a stop to it.

fields.title: Donate to Equality Now to help create a just world for women and girls
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to Equality Now to help create a just world for women and girls.
fields.why_description: We know women and girls will experience the COVID-19 crisis differently. Your donation will support our priorities at this time: achieving gender equality in the long-term, monitoring the impact of COVID-19 on women’s and girls’ rights, and working with our networks to find solutions for women and girls whose vulnerabilities are being exacerbated by the pandemic.

fields.title: Read Unseen's article on modern slavery
fields.what_description: Read this article to understand what modern slavery is and the many different forms it can take.
fields.why_description: Raising awareness about the dangers of modern slavery as well as the signs to look out for is vital in trying to overcome and prevent it.

fields.title: Purchase a recipe e-book to support BAME communities affected by COVID-19
fields.what_description: Purchase the recipe book ‘Community Comfort: Recipes from the Diaspora’ to gain access to one hundred recipes from migrant chefs in the UK and support the BAME community with the profits being donated to the Maionzi Fund.
fields.why_description: Purchasing this book not only broadens your horizons and introduces you to food from an array of cultures, it also supports victims of COVID-19 from BAME communities, with the proceeds being donated to the Maiozi Fund.

fields.title: Read this article to learn how to avoid greenwashing
fields.what_description: This article explains greenwashing in relation to multinational corporations who have a large impact on the climate. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: There are multiple food labels and authorities to check whether food is produced sustainably, but it cannot be guaranteed that certain firms are actively abiding by these laws. Learn more on what greenwashing is to be more aware and equip yourself to be a more careful shopper.

fields.title: Donate to Black Lives Matter UK
fields.what_description: Donate to Black Lives Matter UK to help unpaid organisers support Black-led groups and campaign for anti-racist actions across the UK. Black Lives Matter has pledged to make its distribution plans publicly available.
fields.why_description: Donating to Black Lives Matter UK enables the organisation to continue supporting Black-led organisations and anti-racism campaigns throughout the country.

fields.title: Join an Anti-Slavery Student or Community group near you
fields.what_description: Contribute to the energy of student campaigning, fundraising and organising to build the new generation of the anti-slavery movement. Anti-Slavery can provide resources, link you with their nationwide network and provide other general support to help students lead their communities.
fields.why_description: Just this year alone Anti-Slavery's student leaders co-ordinated a letter of solidarity from student's unions from major UK universities representing 75,000 students to the students of Uzbekistan, amongst other amazing achievements.

fields.title: Download any of these modern slavery posters to put up in your community
fields.what_description: Raise awareness for modern slavery within your community by putting up this poster.
fields.why_description: By making this information accessible, you are encouraging people to report any suspicions or concerns, and therefore helping to prevent the spread of modern slavery.

fields.title: Protect students from being excluded because of their hair
fields.what_description: Sign this petition calling for the UK government to amend the 2010 Equality Act to include hair, organised by Emma Dabiri (author of 'Don't Touch My Hair'). As the petition states, 'The exclusion of black and mixed children from British schools is reaching epidemic proportions' due to issues regarding hair styles.
fields.why_description: Currently, the number of exclusions of black and mixed children from British schools is reaching epidemic proportions. Numerous cases have seen pupils excluded for wearing locks, braids, natural afros and relatively every style required to maintain afro hair. In order to address this discrimination, the 2010 Equality Act must be amended to include explicit protection for afro hair and thus prevent children from being excluded on these grounds.

fields.title: Donate to Race Equality First
fields.what_description: Race Equality First are experts in the field of race equality and focus on tackling discrimination, addressing hate crime and promoting the message that race equality is a human right. Your donations contribute to our everyday running costs and overheads to provide support and representation for victims of discrimination, hate crime and harassment.
fields.why_description: With your support, Race Equality First can continue providing educational resources and challenging misconceptions and negative attitudes towards the anti-racism movement.

fields.title: Become a member of Race on the Agenda (ROTA)
fields.what_description: Join ROTA to keep up to date with the social policy issues affecting BAME communities and to have the opportunity to contribute to policy steering groups. Membership is free.
fields.why_description: ROTA is an important contributor to policy research and civic engagement of BAME communities in the United Kingdom. By becoming a member, you can stay informed on current issues, educate yourself and contribute to their work.

fields.title: Volunteer with SINGA
fields.what_description: SINGA is a global community of migrants, refugees and local people dedicated to migration-led innovation and inclusion.  SINGA is in the process of expanding to the UK and is in need of volunteers, particuarly people with communications skills who could manage their website and social media channels.
fields.why_description: SINGA creates spaces where refugees, newcomers and locals can connect as equals - no matter where they come from or what their background - to exchange ideas, share the things they love, and to try something new. Volunteering with SINGA UK gives you the opportunity to become part of the early UK stages of this thriving movement.

fields.title: Sign Mental Health Foundation's petition to put mental health at the heart of what children learn in school
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to put mental health at the heart of what children learn in school with training for all teachers in mental health, access to independent counsellors in every school and at least one hour per week of education on the subject.
fields.why_description: School children are facing a crisis in mental health with fast-rising rates of depression, anxiety and self-harm. Now more than ever, mental health and wellbeing should be at the heart of children’s school experience. Mental health is not extra-curricular.

fields.title: Fundraise for Student Minds
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Student Minds to enable them to carry out vital work spreading awareness around mental health among students and university members.There are lots of ways that you can raise money for Student Minds - from marathons to bake sales to online quizzes.
fields.why_description: By supporting Student Minds you help to develop the knowledge, confidence and skills among students to look after their own mental health, support others, and create change, so that all in higher education can thrive.

fields.title: Adopt an Olive Tree
fields.what_description: Adopt a tree, an animal or an orchard to get fresh food grown for you directly from the farmers and help fight food waste.
fields.why_description: This action enables you to reduce food waste by directly buying from the farmer. It also allows individuals to find farmers who are actively working in a sustainable/environmentally-friendly manner. Gain fresh food directly from the source!

fields.title: Donate to St. Mungos
fields.what_description: Donate money to St. Mungos, an organisation which has been working to tackle homelessness in the UK for the past 50 years.
fields.why_description: St. Mungos does a great variety of work in order to end homelessness, including running campaigns, lobbying policy reforms, as well as directly helping those who are homeless. By donating money to St. Mungos, you are helping to ensure they can keep providing their much needed services.

fields.title: Fundraise for Mind with arts n crafts
fields.what_description: Register for a crafts pack from Mind and kick-start your own fundraising event. For every £60 raised, you could help 10 people via the Mind infoline. Host a workshop, invite friends and family, and request a donation from those taking part.
fields.why_description: Craft can boost your mental wellbeing and connection with others – plus it's a wonderful way to raise awareness and vital funds for Mind.

fields.title: Become a volunteer for Rethink Mental Illness
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Rethink Mental Illness. Choose from one of many ways to get involved, from directly supporting people living with mental illness to working behind the scenes in one of the offices.
fields.why_description: Every year, Rethink Mental Illness helps tens of thousands of people get through crises, live independently and feel that they do not have to face mental illness alone. No matter how much time you can give or where you’re based, your work as a volunteer will help make a difference.

fields.title: Become a volunteer for Beat
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Beat. Choose from one of lots of ways to get involved, from becoming a digital volunteers on the frontline all the way through to becoming an office volunteer supporting the team behind the scenes.
fields.why_description: Every year Beat supports tens of thousands of people and their loved ones on their journeys towards recovery from an eating disorder. This would not be possible without the support of donors and volunteers. Become a volunteer for Beat to help end the pain and suffering caused by eating disorders.

fields.title: Fundraise by organising online craft workshops with Beat
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Beat by organising an online craft workshop. Whether you have a flair for knitting, crochet, embroidery or origami, simply set up a JustGiving page and ask friends and family to make a suggested donation to join your virtual craft class.
fields.why_description: Crafting can be a great way to unwind and practice mindfulness, and every penny raised in the process will help Beat Helpline Advisors to support more people affected by eating disorders at a time when so many are feeling isolated and scared.

fields.title: Fundraise through a virtual run, walk, cycle or swim with Beat
fields.what_description: Virtual sports simply involve a run, walk, cycle or swim in your local area, gym or pool. You can complete the distance over a day, a week or even a month. Just set yourself a target and ask your family and friends to sponsor you!
fields.why_description: Need motivation to move more? By participating in a sponsored sport, you will help those who struggle with eating disorders. Get your family and friends involved and put your trainers (or swimsuit) on!

fields.title: Fundraise with Beat by taking part in a virtual quiz with your family and friends
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Beat by taking part in a virtual quiz with your family and friends. The quizzes are already set up, so all you have to do is pick a time and invite everyone to join you online!
fields.why_description: Since the outbreak of COVID-19, demand for the Beat Helpline has soared by 72% as the structure and support that enables people to fight their eating disorders has been ripped away. At the same time, the cancellation of hundreds of fundraising activities is set to leave Beat hundreds of thousands of pounds short. Have some fun to help Beat provide support to those who need it.

fields.title: Watch this video to learn about commercial overfishing.
fields.what_description: 31% of the world’s fish population are overfished and another 58% are fished at maximum sustainable level. This video explains how the fishing industry has developed over the years where now some species are now becoming extinct . To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
