fields.why_description: Illegal and unregulated fishing constitutes an estimated 11-26 million tonnes (12-28%) of fishing world-wide. How can you make a difference? Learn more about how your fish is sourced and the ways it can be sustainable.

fields.title: Donate to OutRight International
fields.what_description: Give a a one-off secure donation, or arrange to pay monthly.
fields.why_description: Your donations will enable OutRight Action to continue to provide LGBTIQ human rights research and documentation to activists, whilst working on LGBTIQ advocacy and research in six regions of the world.

fields.title: Donate to WasteAid
fields.what_description: Make a positive impact. By giving to WasteAid, you are helping to fight poverty, pollution and climate change.
fields.why_description: Whatever the size of your gift, whether one off, or a regular commitment, it can make a lasting positive impact around the world.

fields.title: Utilise Mind's toolkit for improving mental health in the workplace
fields.what_description: Look on Mind's Mental Health Gateway for advice about improving people's wellbeing in the workplace.
fields.why_description: 1 in 5 people take a day off due to stress, but 90% of these people felt the need to cite a different reason for their absence. It is important that we destigmatise mental health problems and improve the working environment, allowing employees to feel safe and supported.

fields.title: Become a campaigner for Rethink Mental Illness
fields.what_description: Become a campaigner for Rethink Mental Illness, and help to challenge the attitudes of others and to change the lives for people affected by poor mental health.
fields.why_description: Rethink Mental Illness strives for equality, rights, fair treatment, and quality of life for all those affected by mental illness. By becoming a campaigner, you can help to create change, alongside tens of thousands of others.

fields.title: Become a marketing or IT volunteer for Samaritans
fields.what_description: Become a marketing or IT volunteer for Samaritans. Depending on your skills this could involve running a social media campaign, keeping the website updated or writing press releases.
fields.why_description: Every life lost to suicide is a tragedy, and Samaritans’ vision is that fewer people die by suicide. Samaritans need help with various background tasks related to marketing and IT support. Only with volunteers' help can they continue to support those who experience times of distress.

fields.title: Sign a petition to increase mental health research funding
fields.what_description: Sign a petition calling on the government to increase mental health research funding by £70m+ pa so that mental health professionals can provide the best treatment to those in their care.
fields.why_description: Mental health conditions have more impact on children and young people than any other illness, according to the World Health Organisation. Current research funding in the UK, being biased against mental health conditions, urgently needs to be brought into line with its high cost to society. Sign to help stop a mental health crisis developing among the next generation.

fields.title: Donate to the Mental Health Foundation
fields.what_description: Donate to the Mental Health Foundation. From one-off, to payroll giving or shopping online, there are many ways you can donate.
fields.why_description: Prevention is at the heart of what the Mental Health Foundation do. They aim to find and address the sources of mental health problems so that people and communities can thrive, but the Mental Health Foundation rely on donations from the public to continue this life-changing work.

fields.title: Watch this video to learn more about food waste’s footprint
fields.what_description: This video explains the environmental effects of food waste around the world. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: Every year, 28% of the world’s agricultural land grows crops that are wasted. This equals the total land area of China, Mongolia and Kazakhstan. You can make an impact by raising awareness and taking action against your own food waste. Each individual has a part to play.

fields.title: Donate to Student Minds
fields.what_description: Donate to Student Minds and help to enable the charity to carry out its vital work, spreading awareness on mental health among students and university members.
fields.why_description: University students are at particular risk of developing mental health problems with around 29% of students experiencing mental distress, and yet they face specific challenges in accessing appropriate support. By donating to Student Minds, you can help to transform the state of student mental health so that all those in higher education can thrive.

fields.title: Become a volunteer for Sane communication helpline
fields.what_description: Provide support to people in crisis through the volunteer led helpline and the text care service. You do not need to be an expert, Sane welcomes people of all ages and walks of life.
fields.why_description: As a volunteer, you will make a real difference and support people with mental illness, making a compassionate and meaningful connection with them. Moreover, you will learn how to support people in need of help, which can be very valuable in your personal or professional life.

fields.title: Email Robert Jenrick, the housing minister, to protect renters during coronavirus if his temporary eviction ban ends
fields.what_description: Sign the letter to send a template email to Robert Jenrick, the housing secretary, to step in and protect renters before they lose their homes.
fields.why_description: Renters are among the hardest hit by the pandemic gripping the country. Some 1.7 million are worried they will lose their jobs and face the prospect of not being able to pay the rent. Under current laws, they could also lose their home. The government brought in some protections for renters, but Universal Credit won't cover most people's rent – and the current pause on evictions ends on 23 August. Right now, tenants are falling into debt because of coronavirus – and if the government doesn't act now, these renters could be evicted once the ban ends.

fields.title: Buy coffee from Change Please
fields.what_description: Buy coffee beans from Change Please, a social enterprise that trains homeless people to become baristas.
fields.why_description: Change Please uses the profits from the coffee they sell in order to train people experiencing homelessness to be café baristas, which in turn gives them a Living Wage paying job. By purchasing a bag of their beans, you can help support the training they do.

fields.title: Become a listening volunteer for Samaritans
fields.what_description: Become a listening volunteer for Samaritans and help to see people through difficult times. You don't need to have previous experience or qualifications, you only need to be non-judgemental and accepting of others.
fields.why_description: Listening volunteers can change the course of someone’s life by talking to them when they need it most. Someone contacts Samaritans every six seconds, but many calls go unanswered because there are not enough volunteers, so you could help to ensure that nobody is left to struggle on their own.

fields.title: Tell OpenRent to stop discriminating against people on benefits
fields.what_description: Send a pre-written open letter to OpenRent asking it to change its policies to ensure that everyone has access to safe, affordable homes, despite being on benefits or not.
fields.why_description: Even though people have always paid their rent on time, and taken care of their homes, these tenants are being locked out of properties across the UK. This is unlawful discrimination and could lead to people becoming homeless.

fields.title: Watch this video to learn how your diet can help fight climate change
fields.what_description: If we all switched to a Mediterranean diet, it could solve 15% of global warming pollution by 2050. An equivalent of taking out 1 billion cars from the streets. This video explains how beef affects climate change.  To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content
fields.why_description: Food accounts for over a quarter (26%) of global greenhouse gas emissions. Wondering how you can make a difference to climate change with the food on your plate? You don’t necessarily have to cut meat out of your diet completely, small changes can make a big difference.

fields.title: Prevent families from being thrown out into the street
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to ask the government to progress the Renters Reform Bill.
fields.why_description: 172 families are served a Section 21 eviction notice every day. That means 5,223 families a month face homelessness and uncertainty. These families are being let down by the government as they have not yet progressed the Renters Reform Bill which could end unfair evictions, create a national landlord register, and prevent discrimination against renters with children.

fields.title: Donate to Crisis' Home For All coronavirus relief services
fields.what_description: Donate money to Crisis in order to support their coronavirus relief efforts for the homeless.
fields.why_description: During the pandemic, Crisis has been working to help people find safe accommodation as well as preventing homelessness during this time. With your support, Crisis can continue providing these critically needed services.

fields.title: Donate money to Socks&Chocs
fields.what_description: Donate money to Socks&Chocs, a charity which provides socks, chocolate, and other essentials such as sleeping bags to the homeless.
fields.why_description: Socks&Chocs is a non-profit charity which collects essentials for the homeless and distributes the things they collect to the homeless. Donating would help ensure the sustainability of their projects.

fields.title: Sign up to be a Barnardo's campaigner
fields.what_description: Sign up to be a Barnardo's campaigner to help them transform the lives of the most vulnerable children and young people in the UK.
fields.why_description: By signing up to campaign with Barnardo's, you can help them achieve change in a range of ways from sending your MP an email, signing a petition or sharing their campaigns on social media.

fields.title: Fundraise for #HelloYellow
fields.what_description: For World Mental Health Day, #HelloYellow is encouraging schools, offices, community groups, and individuals to wear yellow and raise funds for YoungMinds. Once you sign up, you will receive a fundraising resources kit, including mental health lesson plans and wellbeing activities.
fields.why_description: By taking part in #HelloYellow Day, you are contributing to YoungMinds and the work they do to help young people and their families when it's needed the most. Raise awareness on the importance of mental health, and promote new, healthier practices in your school, workplace, or home.

fields.title: Purchase something from Invisible Cities
fields.what_description: Buy a product from Invisible Cities, a social enterprise that helps people who have experienced homelessness to become tour guides.
fields.why_description: Invisible Cities trains people who have experienced homelessness so that they can earn a stable income. By purchasing a product from them, you are helping to maintain their social enterprise model.

fields.title: Donate just £5 to Shelter
fields.what_description: Donate money to Shelter, a charity that believes in the human right to a home, and support the services they provide to combat homelessness.
fields.why_description: Shelter has been offering free housing advice to the homeless since 1966. They have helped millions of people struggling with bad housing or homelessness through their support and legal services, and your contribution could mean that they are able to continue to help those who need it most.

fields.title: Read this article about palm oil by WWF
fields.what_description: WWF have provided key facts on palm oil production that will give you an overview of the issue. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: Palm oil production has led to deforestation and forest fires in many countries. Nearly 90% percent of the world’s palm oil is grown in the tropical countries of Indonesia and Malaysia, where currently, palm oil plantations under active cultivation cover 16 million acres, an area similar in size to West Virginia . To create this land for palm oil plantation, animal habitats are destroyed and forest fires are created which contributes carbon dioxide towards global warming.

fields.title: Take an online course on the circular economy
fields.what_description: Sign up for an online course to learn more about the circular economy. This list, put together by the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, provides a range of options for all learners.
fields.why_description: Taking part in a course will help you to explore the principles of a circular economy in more depth and learn how to implement them to support sustainable business.

fields.title: Share Shelter's coronavirus and housing advice page
fields.what_description: Share Shelter's coronavirus and housing advice page on your social media to help raise awarness about the services they provide.
fields.why_description: Even if you don’t have a housing issue yourself, someone who follows you on social media might. You can help more people get the support they need by sharing Shelter's coronavirus and housing advice page.

fields.title: Take the Eat Low Carbon quiz
fields.what_description: Do the quiz and test your knowledge of which foods are planet friendlier.
fields.why_description: This resource provides you with information on multiple food choices and how to reduce your carbon consumption. Global warming is a serious issue that could be reduced by collective individual changes to our diet choices.

fields.title: Email your MP to demand them to stand up for homeless youth
fields.what_description: Send a pre-written email to your MP to demand them to stand up for homeless youth.
fields.why_description: Sending a quick email can make a real difference. Just enter your postcode into this clever tool, and it will find your MP’s details to send a pre-written email. Young people are most likely to lose their job during the coronavirus crisis. Yet under-25s receive less Universal Credit to help with food and bills. Without family support, many face hunger and homelessness.

fields.title: Shop from Crisis
fields.what_description: Shop from Crisis shops sell pre-loved clothes, books, homeware and furniture to raise vital funds for Crisis services.
fields.why_description: Funds raised go towards supporting homeless people. Shops also offer training and employment opportunities for homeless people who want to work in the retail industry.

fields.title: Fund someone who is experiencing homelessness
fields.what_description: Support someone who is experiencing or has experienced homelessness reach stability by donating what you can.
fields.why_description: Beam allows you to fund someone who is experiencing homelessness so they can transition into stable careers. Beam has helped 90 people gain independence. By helping fund someone, you will also receive updates on the progress they make.

fields.title: Support Crisis' Scrap the Vagrancy Act Campaign
fields.what_description: Add your voice to the campaign by filling in your details and help stop homlessness being classed as a crime.
fields.why_description: Support the scrapping of the Vagrancy Act, which makes homelessness a crime, further isolating those who are homeless from receiving the help they need.

fields.title: Follow The Advocate's World on Instagram
fields.what_description: The Advocate's World posts informative content about disabilities which will help you learn more and allow you to easily share content with others.
fields.why_description: By following this account you will be supporting disability advocacy as well as learning more about disabilities yourself.

fields.title: Volunteer for Crisis
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Crisis, an NGO helping those affected by homelessness. There are a variety of roles available from ground support to catering to admin duties. Follow the link to find out how you can register your interest.
fields.why_description: By volunteering with Crisis, you can make a real difference to people experiencing homelessness.

fields.title: Purchase socks from Stand4 Socks
fields.what_description: Buy a pair of socks from Stand4 Socks and they will donate a pair of thick, anti bacterial socks to a homeless shelter in return.
fields.why_description: Stand4 Socks produces ethically-made socks which are suitable for the rough conditions that those who experience homelessness may encounter. They have a model of buy one, give one, so when you buy a pair of socks, they donate a pair too.

fields.title: Connect with someone who is homeless
fields.what_description: Download the Greater Change app, which connects you to someone who is homeless, who you can directly help.
fields.why_description: The Greater Change app connects you with someone who is homeless so you can see the real person that your donations are helping. By downloading the app, you will receive updates on the person who is homeless who you are sponsoring.

fields.title: Read about the LGBTQ+ acronym
fields.what_description: Do you know what all the letters in LGBTQ mean? Or what the '+' refers to? This article explains each term for you in full. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: By better understanding the different aspects of the LGBTQ+ community and learning about the appropriate language to use, you can become a better ally to the LGBTQ+ community.

fields.title: Run a Socks&Chocs collection
fields.what_description: Volunteer to do a Socks&Chocs collection.
fields.why_description: By volunteering to run a Socks&Chocs collection, you will personally take it upon yourself to collect socks, chocolate, and other essentials. Donate what you collect to a homeless centre that accepts collections and then say your donation was inspired by Socks&Chocs. The link has a list of places you can find within your city that will accept what you collect.

fields.title: Sign the petition to end inhumane immigration detention in the UK
fields.what_description: The UK locks up thousands of people in immigration detention centres every year. In 2018, 24,748 people were put into detention in the UK. This even includes survivors of torture and sexual abuse, and those with serious medical problems (Amnesty International UK). Basic rights are denied  with no due process and no limit on how long they can be held. Sign Detention Action's petition to oppose these inhumane practices.
fields.why_description: The number of people held in UK immigration removal centres has dropped by more than two thirds during the pandemic (BBC, 2020). As these numbers start to rise again, we must stand together against racism, racist systems and the denial of human rights.

fields.title: Rent a home to a refugee family
fields.what_description: People who have been granted refugees status are given just 28 days to sort their lives out before they have to leave asylum accommodation. For most this proves impossible and many of those without children become homeless. The Private Rented Scheme from the Refugee Council in London works with landlords and refugees who are on a low wage or are in receipt of benefits. Refugee Council offers landlords and tenants a range of support services and financial insurances in order to create sustainable tenancies. If you’re a landlord, you can sign up to rent a home to a refugee family using the link below.
fields.why_description: By signing up to this Private Rented scheme, you can secure housing for a refugee family and ensure a more stable beginning for their new life in the UK.

fields.title: Encourage your employer to partner with Tent
fields.what_description: The Tent Partnership for Refugees is a global network of over 100 businesses supporting refugees. Companies that join Tent have the opportunity to learn more about the refugee crisis, share their efforts across our network, and gain access to relevant resources and events.
fields.why_description: In the UK, It is estimated that 70% of refugees are unemployed. Despite the fact that leading businesses have already experienced the many benefits of hiring refugees, including higher retention rates, increased diversity, and a strengthened brand and reputation, many employers remain reluctant to hire refugees. You can make a difference by giving access to actionable information to your company, increasing the chances of reducing unemployment among refugees.

fields.title: Join the UK Student Climate Network
fields.what_description: The UK Student Climate Network (UKSCN) is a group of mostly under 18s taking to the streets to protest the government’s lack of action on the Climate Crisis. Find your local group and sign up to get involved.
fields.why_description: Together we can achieve more. By joining a group of youth strikers you become a part of community committed to driving mass systematic change to ensure a liveable future for all.

fields.title: Join your local Friends of the Earth group
fields.what_description: Join volunteers helping to protect your local environment. You can find your local Friends of the Earth group through the link below.
fields.why_description: Take an active role in driving change and become part of the world's largest grassroots environmental network. Campaign for sustainable and just societies, and environmental protection.

fields.title: Volunteer for Show Racism the Red Card
fields.what_description: Show Racism the Red Card is the UK's leading anti-racism education charity, established in January 1996 to harness the high-profile nature of footballers as anti-racist role models. Get in touch with one of their teams across the UK for up-to-date information about volunteering opportunities in your area.
fields.why_description: Volunteering is a great way to make your voice heard and make a difference. By getting involved with Show Racism the Red Card, you'll also be able to learn more about the great initiatives in place across the country.

fields.title: Volunteer with IDAS
fields.what_description: Apply to volunteer with IDAS to help support people affected by domestic abuse and sexual violence. All of their volunteering opportunities are based in Sheffield, Barnsley, North Yorkshire or York.
fields.why_description: By volunteering, you can play a crucial role in supporting people affected by domestic abuse.

fields.title: Download and learn how to use the Streetlink app
fields.what_description: Download the Streetlink app and learn how to use it incase you happen to see someone sleeping rough.
fields.why_description: Familarising yourself and learning how to use the app will help to prepare you for when/if you do see someone sleeping rough. The details you provide are sent to the local authority or outreach service for the area in which you have seen the person, to help them find the individual and connect them to support. The aim of Streetlink is to help end rough sleeping.

fields.title: Donate to Kalayaan
fields.what_description: Donate to help Kalayaan support migrant workers in the UK with the necessary advice and support needed to restart their lives.
fields.why_description: Migrant domestic workers often have nowhere to turn as they are isolated in their employers' homes and feel unable to seek support from anywhere else. Just £25 can buy basic food for a migrant worker escaping an abusive employer for a week.

fields.title: Use the Streetlink app if you see a rough sleeper
fields.what_description: If you are concerned about someone over the age of 18 that you have seen sleeping rough in England or Wales, you can use the Streetlink app to send an alert to StreetLink and ensure that they receive support from their local services. If you havent already done so, complete the previous weeks now-u action where you download and learn how to use the Streetlink app.
fields.why_description: The details you provide are sent to the local authority or outreach service for the area in which you have seen the person, to help them find the individual and connect them to support. The aim of Streetlink is to help end rough sleeping.

fields.title: Listen to young people explaining autism
fields.what_description: Watch this 3-minute video by Ambitious about Autism where young people explain what it's like to be autistic
fields.why_description: Although one in 100 people are on the autistic spectrum, many of us have limited understanding of what autism is. Find out more about what it's like to live with autism and how you can support people on the autistic spectrum

fields.title: Make a Facebook fundraiser for London Friend
fields.what_description: On your Facebook set up a fundraiser for London Friend, so you can get friends and family to donate.
fields.why_description: London Friend provide various services and support groups that you can engage with, whilst also offering a lot of information on various other issues.  It is a beneficial way for you to raise issues facing LGBTQ+ amongst the public.

fields.title: Find an organic box in your local area
fields.what_description: Buy a box of organic foods in your local area. Each box provides a variety of foods from fruit and vegetables, to eggs, meat, herbs, and honey.
fields.why_description: As they're offered by organic farmers around the UK, these organic boxes provide a convenient way to support and consume sustainably sourced products. This is a practical way to begin your journey towards more eco-friendly eating decisions that benefit the environment and its wildlife.

fields.title: Donate to MindOut
fields.what_description: Donate to MindOut through their online donation form or, alternatively, sell unwanted items through their eBay charity account.
fields.why_description: Your donations will help to ensure that MindOut can continue to deliver vital mental health services to the LGBTQ+ community. £15 can give someone in suicidal distress an hour of lifesaving crisis support.

fields.title: Sign a petition for safer, more secure social homes
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to build a future for the UK that provides stable homes and strong communities.
fields.why_description: With over 1 million households waiting for social homes, we need to build at least 90,000 social homes a year to end the housing emergency. Last year, just 6,000 were built. Shelter is calling on the government to urgently invest in a new generation of social housing, and they need your support.

fields.title: Save food with Too Good To Go
fields.what_description: Download the Too Good To Go app and help put an end to food waste. Download the app and see which local restaurants, cafes, and shops have food left over at the end of the day and is going to waste — and could be yours for less!
fields.why_description: Each year, one third of food produced in the world goes to waste, and it is responsible for 8% of all greenhouse gas emissions. Too Good To Go are on a mission to change that — so why not join them?

fields.title: Watch 13th on YouTube
fields.what_description: '13th' is Ava DuVernay's award-winning documentary on racial inequality in the USA's prison system. With a combination of interviews and archive footage, it effectively - and chillingly - illustrates the intersection between structural racism and the prison-industrial complex in the USA.
fields.why_description: One of the first steps to fighting racism is educating yourself. This documentary provides an excellent insight into a complex and fundamentally unfair system driven by the USA's history of racism.

fields.title: Abolish the anti-trans law in Hungary
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to abolish the law preventing transgender people in Hungary from getting legal gender recognition.
fields.why_description: Legal gender recognition is a fundamental right and needs to be guaranteed to protect transgender and intersex people from discrimination and violence.

fields.title: Write a letter to someone who is homeless
fields.what_description: Write a small note to show solidarity or draw a masterpiece to help reduce loneliness and isolation during the coronavirus pandemic. If you don't live in Wales, search local homeless charities to see if you can send a letter to someone receiving support there.
fields.why_description: Items can be sent to both frontline workers and service users of the Wallich charity to show support and empathy. There has been a lot of talk about how fortunate we are, to be living in a digital age, video calls at our fingertips and despite many individuals being in isolation, connections between friends, families and work colleagues are becoming stronger. However, for many of our service users, access to the internet or a device isn’t always as simple compared to other households. Help us reduce loneliness when individuals are disconnected from society during isolation. You can make a difference to someone experiencing homelessness in Wales.

fields.title: Buy something from the Albert Kennedy Trust shop
fields.what_description: Buy a range of products from the Albert Kennedy Trust shop. All of their products promote inclusive, motivational messages about the LGBTQ+ community. This link will take you to a summary of all their products they offer.
fields.why_description: LGBTQ+ people are at high risk for homelessness, particularly during the pandemic, as they may be kicked out of their family homes due to intolerance. The products you buy ensure that money will go towards the continuation of support for LGBTQ+ people.

fields.title: Take part in YMCA's fundraising initiative
fields.what_description:
Sleep Easy is a challenge event asking you to spend one night sleeping somewhere other than your bed, all to raise vital funds to help YMCA tackle the root causes of youth homelessness. Getting involved is easy! Sign up on the link below, grab a sleeping bag and sleep somewhere other than your bed – such as your garden, lounge, hallway or other safe space. 

On the night (9th October), there will be a jam-packed online agenda which has something for everyone – a bedtime story for kids, Elvis Presley crooning a few songs, quizzes, and an opportunity to hear from our staff and young people about the work we do and their experiences of youth homelessness. There will also be social media challenges, competitions, and opportunities to connect with your community!
fields.why_description: By tackling the causes of youth homelessness, Sleep Easy not only helps the young people staying in our supported accommodation but also helps prevent further youth homelessness – through family mediation, counselling, housing advice, mentoring, and youth wellbeing projects.

fields.title: Write a letter to a key worker or someone in a care home
fields.what_description: Nominate an NHS key worker you know to receive a personalised letter of thanks or write your own letter to a care home resident using the sample letter and set of guidelines for help.
fields.why_description: There are 5 million key workers in the UK and every single one deserves to be seen. Send a letter of thanks to a key worker you know to tell them how grateful we are for all that they do. We musn't forget that that we are also living in the midst of a loneliness epidemic which the global pandemic has made even worse. You can make someone's day by simply writing a letter to an elderly person in a care home.

fields.title: Ban conversion therapy in the UK
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to ban conversion therapy in the UK, a practice which aims to convert LGBT+ people to their 'correct' gender or sexual orientation.
fields.why_description: The practice has been widely recognised as unethical, harmful and ineffective, and though in 2018 the government said it would bring forward proposals to end the practice, no law has yet been made.

fields.title: Pressure the government to clarify changes to the Gender Recognition and Equalities Act.
fields.what_description: Sign and send a physical letter to Minister for Women and Equalities, Liz Truss, to request clarification on upcoming changes to the Gender Recognition Act and Equalities Act. This link will take you to a template letter, as well as a template cover letter.
fields.why_description: Many are worried that leaked plans of government reform show that they want to prevent transgender people from having access to toilets, changing rooms and gender segregated spaces. They also want to deny healthcare to transgender people under the age of 18.

fields.title: Buy something from Micro Rainbow's Amazon wishlist
fields.what_description: Buy something from the wishlist to support homeless LGBTQ+ people, whose families and governments have rejected them. The link to take you to the Amazon wishlist is at the bottom of the page.
fields.why_description: Micro Rainbow decided to create safe homes where LGBTQ+ asylum seekers can be safe whilst they go through the asylum process. They now operate eleven safe homes. We can provide up to 16,060 bed-nights a year, but they are not enough. With your help we can reach out to more homeless LGBTQ+ people.

fields.title: Read about the Gender Recognition Act in the UK
fields.what_description: The Gender Recognition Act is an essential piece of legislation regarding trans rights in the UK. Read about what it means and why it needs to be updated. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: By learning about the obstacles trans people in the UK face today, you will be better equipped to be an ally for trans people and an advocate for policy change.

fields.title: Support CFAB's campaign with the hashtag #OutOfSightOnOurMind
fields.what_description: Tweet or post about CFBA's campaign using the hashtag #OutOfSightOnOurMind to raise awareness and/or contribute to their post-placement fund that finances welfare visits on children placed internationally.
fields.why_description: After a survey in 2018, CFBA uncovered significant risks to children in international kinship placements, with some local authorities making no further checks on a child placed abroad. CFBA's objective is to ensure the safe transition of a child from one home to another.

fields.title: Sign a petition asking the Home Secretary to give equal protection to all survivors of domestic abuse
fields.what_description: Join Amnesty International and call on the Home Secretary to make sure domestic abuse laws don't discriminate against migrant women.
fields.why_description: The government's proposed domestic abuse laws are not fit for purpose. It was supposed to 'transform our approach to domestic abuse', but in reality it leaves some of the most marginalised women behind, migrant women who are already isolated in society.

fields.title: Test your LGBTQ+ workplace awareness
fields.what_description: Test your LGBT awareness knowledge with our quick quiz.
fields.why_description: In the UK, legally, we're getting closer than ever to equality for LGBT people. However, in the workplace, it's a different story. 43% of gay men report experiencing homophobia in the workplace according to a workplace survey by Gaydar.net. It is important that we increase our LGBT awareness.

fields.title: Advocate for a more sustainable food system
fields.what_description: Donate to Sustain to support their work campaigning for a healthier, more sustainable food system. This can either be a one-off donation or a monthly payment.
fields.why_description: Sustain is an alliance of organisations and communities working together for a better system of food, farming, and fishing, working to improve what we eat and the way it's produced. They campaign towards national policies and grassroots work to increase access to healthy, affordable food, contributing to a better environment, good livelihoods, and a vibrant food culture.

fields.title: Sign the food standards petition
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to ensure that food eaten in the UK is produced to world leading standards.
fields.why_description: Farming throughout the UK has high standards of safety and welfare with an ambition to be net zero in greenhouse gas emissions by 2040. It is important to make sure that the same of all food which is imported to the UK is as safe, traceable and produced to high welfare and environmental standards.

fields.title: Call on supermarkets to tackle food waste in their supply chains
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to call on supermarkets to tackle food waste in their supply chains.
fields.why_description: UK supermarkets and businesses throw out over 7 million tonnes of food annually, before it gets to your shopping basket. Globally, if food waste was a country, it would be the third top carbon emitter after USA and China. Sign the petition to reduce the food waste and save the planet!

fields.title: Share useful resources to help Afghans find entry into nearby countries, if they are struggling to get out of the country.
fields.what_description: Share useful resources on your social media.
fields.why_description: This will help Afghans find entry into nearby countries if they are struggling to get out of the country.

fields.title: Protect trans and intersex peoples' rights in Hungary
fields.what_description: Sign Amnesty International's open letter to call on Hungary's Commissioner for Fundamental Rights to urgently stop the anti-trans law.
fields.why_description: The new law contradicts the Fundamental Law and Hungary's international human rights obligations. Without legal gender recognition, trans and intersex people are subject to discrimination, harassment, and violence every time they use their identity documents in their daily life.

fields.title: Sign a petition to protect our bees.
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to Michael Gove to extend the EU ban on bee-killing pesticides (neonicotinoids).
fields.why_description: Bees are great indicators of a healthy environment. But right now, they're at risk due to climate breakdown and habitat loss. Bees pollinate three quarters of the world’s crops - from the apple in our lunchbox, to the tomatoes on our pizza, we wouldn’t last long without them. Right now there's a temporary ban on bee-killing pesticides, called neonicotinoids, across Europe. Over the next few months Environment Secretary Michael Gove has a chance to protect our bees for good by voting to extend the ban to take more of these pesticides of our fields, and by voting to make the ban permanent.

fields.title: Require supermarkets and restaurants to donate or compost food waste
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to require supermarkets and restaurants to donate or compost food waste.
fields.why_description: The UK supermarkets waste 240,000 tonnes of food a year, despite 14.3 million of its residents living in poverty. Much of this food is wasted before it reaches its best before date when the product has not spoiled but has surpassed its peak quality.

fields.title: Learn about the meaning of zero waste
fields.what_description: Read this short article examining what zero waste means.
fields.why_description: This insightful link demonstrates to you the importance of zero waste, including the importance of reusing and repurposing. This will help in increasing awareness on zero waste.

fields.title: Donate to one of the deforestation appeals.
fields.what_description: Donate to help WWF protect and restore one trillion trees around the world. They campaign to fix our unsustainable food system so that everyone can eat without destroying our planet.
fields.why_description: By helping to protect wildlife from forest fires and campaign for stronger government actions, we can reduce carbon emissions and the impact of deforestation for food consumption. Last summer, we watched the Amazon rainforest burn. It is happening again, right now. But together, we can help put the fires out.

fields.title: Be part of the London Gaymer community
fields.what_description: A safe place for the LGBT gaming community in London and across the UK to connect with like-minded individuals. We hold regular meet ups every month, online tournaments and have an active Discord server where you'll find other gamers to play with.
fields.why_description: An inclusive and friendly environment for LGBTQ+ individuals to meet new people.

fields.title: Donate to Stonewall
fields.what_description: Donate to Stonewall to ensure that they have sufficient funds to continue their amazing work, and to support the LGBT community, whilst also increasing awareness.
fields.why_description: Your donations help Stonewall continue to be a point of call for LGBT people, and to increase awareness and reduce stigma against LGBT people in schools.

fields.title: Make a donation to FareShare
fields.what_description: Donate to FareShare and join the fight to end hunger and tackle food waste.
fields.why_description: Every pound you donate helps provide four meals for people in need across the South West. Donating just £10 per month delivers 480 meals to their charity members. You might fund a child’s breakfast at a Breakfast Club, a hot meal for a homeless person, or a roast dinner for an elderly person’s lunch club. This helps prevent food surplus that contributes towards global warming.

fields.title: Fundraise for FareShare in South West
fields.what_description: Raise money for FareShare South West to raise your voice about hunger and food waste.
fields.why_description: Food wastage's carbon footprint is estimated at 3.3 billion tonnes of CO2 equivalent of GHG released into the atmosphere per year [FAO]. Address the environmental food waste issue by helping FairShare make use of surplus food. Fundraising for FairShare helps them to continue to redistribute surplus food to those most in need in our community.

fields.title: Set up a period product donation station with Freedom4Girls
fields.what_description: Set up a period product donation station with Freedom4Girls. Contact Freedom4Girls and they will provide all the support and advice you need, helping you to find a donation station host, arrange convenient collection days, and identify where the products would best be distributed.
fields.why_description: Freedom4Girls donate a choice of period products for free to the most marginalised and in-need women and girls in our communities. This would not be possible without the support of the public and small businesses.

fields.title: Volunteer with Days for Girls
fields.what_description: Join or create a Days for Girls team in your area. Teams sew and assemble specially-designed, washable menstrual pad kits to be supplied to women and girls in need. Teams can also raise awareness and advocate for menstrual health as a pathway to improved health, education, and livelihood.
fields.why_description: Days for Girls have helped women and girls in need in more than 100 countries. Every kit supplied is hand-sewn by volunteers and by taking part, you will have the chance to connect with like-minded volunteers and contribute to menstrual health efforts across the globe.

fields.title: Download the HappyCow app
fields.what_description: Download the HappyCow app and use it to find plant-based, vegan, or vegetarian restaurants nearby. Search organic institutions anywhere in the world and search thousands of reviews to help find the best places to eat.
fields.why_description: Cutting down on meat and animal-based products is one of the most powerful actions an individual can take to tackle the climate crisis. The HappyCow app comes in handy when you're looking for an alternative restaurant with vegetarian or vegan options, either in your local town or when travelling abroad.

fields.title: Make Sustainably Sourced Palm Oil a Legal Requirement
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to make sustainably sourced palm oil a legal requirement.
fields.why_description: Unsustainably sourced palm oil is one of the leading causes of deforestation of the rainforest in places such as Madagascar and Indonesia. The destruction of the rainforest is a major contributor to global warming and a huge threat to biodiversity.

fields.title: Sign a petition to cut food waste in half
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to cut Europe and the UK's food waste in half.
fields.why_description: We waste a lot of food, contributing to climate deterioration. Instead of generating waste, why not donate food to the ones in need? There are about 55 million people in food poverty in Europe - and the food wasted throughout the continent could feed them over 9 times over.

fields.title: Fundraise for Gender Equality
fields.what_description: Fundraise for gender equality. Follow the link to download your fundraising guide and explore the different fundraising ideas.
fields.why_description: Equality Now tackles the most difficult issues, challenge ingrained cultural assumptions and call out inequality wherever we see it, particularly focusing on ending sex trafficking.

fields.title: Make your town pesticide-free
fields.what_description: Volunteer as a PAN UK campaigner to stop pesticides being used in the town or city where you live.
fields.why_description: The World Health Organisation (WHO) estimates that over 350,000 people die every year from acute pesticide poisoning. This is a serious issue that we could resolve on a local scale by encouraging our cities to take action.

fields.title: Read about trans rights in Hungary
fields.what_description: Read about the legal protections taken away from trans people in Hungary this year. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: By learning about issues facing  LGBTQ+ people in other countries you will have a broader understanding of the need to support LGBTQ+ people not just in the UK but across the world as well.

fields.title: Development banks: Stop investing in industrial animal agriculture
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to stop fueling the climate crisis and new pandemics by investing in industrial livestock.
fields.why_description: Experts project that the livestock sector will account for almost half of the world’s allowable budget for greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and 80% by 2050. Without urgent action, the industry will continue to drive climate breakdown, leading to more extreme heat, droughts, floods and poverty. Deforestation to make space for cattle ranching and to grow soy and maise to feed farmed animals is expected to keep destroying the Amazon and other vital forests.

fields.title: Donate. Save Britain's bees. Get your Bee Saver Kit today
fields.what_description: Donate by purchasing this Bee Saver Kit to ensure that bees are conserved to protect our environment.
fields.why_description: Bees are great indicators of a healthy environment. But right now, they're at risk due to climate breakdown and habitat loss. Bees pollinate much of the food that makes our diets healthy and tasty. Donate to prevent extinction of bees.

fields.title: Share an image from the 'together'. campaign on social media
fields.what_description: This link will take you to some key images that you can share on social media. When you find one that works for you, click on it and copy it to your clipboard. Everytime you share content or messages about the together. campaign, please include our website address (www.togetherlgbt.com) so others can find out how to get involved.
fields.why_description: The main objective of this campaign is to try and change the public narrative around transgender equality to focus on issues of safety and dignity. For this campaign to be successful, we need to spread the message far and wide.

fields.title: Donate to JustLikeUs
fields.what_description: Donate to JustLikeUs through a one off payment, or regular monthly payments.
fields.why_description: JustLikeUs is a LGBT+ charity for young people. Through donations, they can continue to empower young people to be the champions of LGBT+ equality at school and work.

fields.title: Sign the petition to protect LGBTQIA+ people in Poland
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to demand that the Polish government pass laws that would protect LGBTQIA+ people in schools, workplaces, and the public, and to abolish current homophobic and transphobic laws such as the "LGBT-free zones" and the proposed "ban on propagating the LGBT ideology."
fields.why_description: The LGBTQIA+ community in Poland suffers from homophobia and transphobia fuelled by political, religious, and secular leaders. The lack of protective laws leave them scared to live in their own home country.

fields.title: How big is your environmental footprint?
fields.what_description: Do the quiz and find out how big your environmental footprint is!
fields.why_description: Earth is facing a crisis - from climate change to the pollution in our oceans and devastation of our forests. It's up to all of us to fix it. Take your first step with WWF's environmental footprint calculator and see what your impact is!

fields.title: Find an organic home delivery service
fields.what_description: Find local businesses delivering organic produce direct to your front door.
fields.why_description: In order to help reduce greenhouse gases, we need to encourage a shift towards sustainable produce.

fields.title: Sign a petition to shape the future of our countryside
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to make sure there's a clear plan to reduce pesticides and make the countryside a safer place for wildlife.
fields.why_description: The natural world is in serious trouble. Bees, birds, butterflies and other wildlife are in decline due to pesticides. Too much of our countryside is being routinely doused with a cocktail of chemicals. This needs to change!

fields.title: Volunteer with Gendered Intelligence
fields.what_description: Join Gendered Intelligence's volunteering programme, starting off in the Office Admin program and continuing on into specialised programs such as the Ambassador's Network.
fields.why_description: Volunteering will add value to our projects and ensure they meet the needs of our service users. It will also increase our contact with the community we serve by efficiently managing our volunteer pool to expand relevant services.

fields.title: Set up a livestream to fundraise for Mermaids UK
fields.what_description: Tiltify is an online platform letting you easily fundraise through your livestream broadcasts on Twitch, Mixer or YouTube. You can play videogames or just have fun with your friends.
fields.why_description: Transgender and gender diverse young people can feel isolated due to challenges in their daily lives. Many of our children and young people find friends and a sense of community online, so showing your support on your livestream will mean the world to the children and young people we support.

fields.title: Try out these climate-friendly cooking recipes
fields.what_description: Cook a recipe from this New York Times article whilst making a conscious effort to contribute to the environment's wellbeing.
fields.why_description: Food accounts for over a quarter (26%) of global greenhouse gas emissions. These small changes to our recipes will provide healthier and more environmentally friendly meals.

fields.title: Donate to Opening Doors London
fields.what_description: Opening Doors London (ODL) is the biggest charity providing information and support services specifically for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Trans (LGBT+) people over 50 in the UK. You can make a donation of at least £5, up to how much you wish to donate.
fields.why_description: We are a membership organisation providing regular social opportunities across London to help develop networks and communities for LGBT+ people, aged over 50.

fields.title: Find an organic restaurant
fields.what_description: Find a restaurant or cafe near you with an 'Organic Served Here' award, and support businesses that serve sustainably sourced food.
fields.why_description: Restaurants that buy a percentage of their food from certified organic suppliers are helping conserve future farming conditions, sustaining the quality of the soil and preventing pesticides from contaminating the environment.

fields.title: Try out these healthy and sustainable recipes
fields.what_description: Create classic recipes with a twist, and make your food more sustainable.
fields.why_description: Food systems are having a negative impact all over the world; the food we eat shouldn’t cost the Earth – and yet it often does. Reduce the impact of the food you eat by trying out recipes that are more friendly towards the planet. Individual actions can create worldwide change.

fields.title: Calculate your greenhouse gas footprint
fields.what_description: Complete this quiz to calculate the greenhouse gas footprint of your food choices.
fields.why_description: Individual actions matter! By checking the impact of the ingredients you use on a regular basis, you have the power to make deliberate decisions for yourself, and to encourage restaurants to improve their contribution to degrading the environment.

fields.title: Volunteer for the FoodCycle community
fields.what_description: Volunteer at FoodCycle and help make a difference by organising food runs that reduce food surplus waste.
fields.why_description: One-third of all food produced across the globe is lost or wasted . Join FoodCycle in their mission to use this food surplus to feed those who are going hungry. Whilst addressing a social problem and breaking down the barriers of isolation in communities, you can reduce the 8% of total greenhouse gases produced by food waste that ends up in landfills.

fields.title: Volunteer with LGBT Health and Wellbeing
fields.what_description: As a volunteer you can become involved in your local LGBT community in a myriad of ways, including in the development and delivery of social events, our counselling service, our national Helpline, project support, as well as on our Board of Directors
fields.why_description: As a volunteer you can make a difference to the lives of LGBTQ+ people. This is a fantastic way for you to gain new experiences and skills, meet new people and connect with your community.

fields.title: Volunteer with Irise
fields.what_description: Volunteer with Irise and take action to end period shame. You could volunteer as a Social Media Officer, an Irregular Periodical Editor or Content Developer or an Events and Campaigns Volunteer, or you could join the Empower Period TikTok Team. For more details, follow the link.
fields.why_description: Stigma is a barrier to people accessing menstrual products, support and guidance when they need them. It leads to negative feelings about oneself and body and keeps everyone silent about problem. Volunteer with Irise to help dismantle stigma so people can talk about periods, get the support they need and feel confident.

fields.title: Volunteer for ilga
fields.what_description:
You could help us translate our reports, maps and documents (in most cases from English to other languages), and help us disseminate them, for example. Or you could proofread them. But you could also support us as a graphic designer in laying out our publications. Or make your videomaking skills available, and help us shoot video interviews or clips
for online campaigns. And you could also help us monitoring the international press, participate in our online communities, support our researchers with your expertise, or loan your skills to an area of our work.
fields.why_description: Becoming a volunteer with ILGA World is a way to invest them in the global fight to end human right violations against lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and intersex people, while being exposed to the workings of an international non-governmental organisation.

fields.title: Donate to the Kaleidoscope Trust
fields.what_description: Click on the 'Support Us' to join a membership scheme, or to make a one off payment.
fields.why_description: With your help, Kaleidoscope Trust can continue to transform the lives of LGBTQ+ people across the world. Kaleidoscope Trust can continue to work with parliamentarians, government ministers, officials and policymakers to effect real change in the lives of LGBTQ+ communities around the world.

fields.title: Buy something produced by a disabled artist
fields.what_description: The Mighty has curated a short list of disabled artists with online shops as part of a gift guide for the holiday season. Buying from these artists will support their work and could make a really cool gift this holiday season!
fields.why_description: The Mighty has curated a short list of disabled artists with online shops as part of a gift guide for the holiday season. Buying from these artists will support their work and could make a really cool gift this holiday season!

fields.title: Call on the South African governments to provide free sanitary products to low-income students
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to call on the provincial governments of South Africa to live out their pledge to provide free sanitary products to low-income students.
fields.why_description: Millions of South African students miss out on school because of their period each month. The National Treasury has allocated R157 million for free sanitary products for learners from low-income households. It is now up to the provincial governments to spend this money effectively. Sign the petition to ensure that they do.

fields.title: Buy something from the Stonewall shop
fields.what_description: Buy an item of clothing or accessories from the Stonewall shop or, alternatively, click on the donate link to make a donation through: Amazon Smile, one-off/regular donation, increase regular donation, wear your support, become an ambassador, leave a legacy or donate in memoriam.
fields.why_description: Donations have enabled Stonewall to respond to 10,500 info service enquiries, work directly with 750 workplaces in Britain and provide training to 9600 teachers to tackle bullying.

fields.title: Sign a petition for world leaders to prioritise menstrual hygiene for girls' education
fields.what_description: Sign a petition calling on world leaders to support menstrual hygiene management, improving hygiene education, implementing initiatives to fight period taboos, and funding hygiene and sanitation facilities in schools and communities so that girls can manage menstruation in safety and with dignity.
fields.why_description: Without separate toilets at school or adequate knowledge about menstrual hygiene, girls often miss one or more days of school every month. By ensuring girls can access menstrual hygiene resources, education and suitable bathrooms, girls will be better equipped to learn and become independent, empowered contributors to their communities.

fields.title: Download the Giki app
fields.what_description: Download Giki Zero - an app that helps you to understand your carbon footprint, and to find sustainable and healthy products in UK supermarkets. Just scan an item's barcode, see which badges the product wins, and check out the alternatives for new ideas.
fields.why_description: Our individual actions matter! We can all make a difference, one step at a time. Being aware of the emissions and impact on the planet of the food you choose to buy is a crucial starting point to raising your own awareness on matters of sustainability.

fields.title: Donate to Unseen
fields.what_description: Donate to Unseen to support their efforts in providing for vulnerable male, female and child surviors of modern slavery and human trafficking.
fields.why_description: Safe houses provide a place for recovery. This is the first stage on a survivor's long and and difficult journey towards rebuilding their lives. Unseen helps survivors recover their self-esteem, build their confidence and gain key skills vital for their future independence.

fields.title: Donate to the Simama na DADA Initiative
fields.what_description: Donate to the Simama na DADA Initiative to help them provide pads to girls in need across Kenya so that they can stay and fully participate in education.
fields.why_description: Menstruation doesn't pause for pandemics. The current situation is delicate and many young girls are struggling to manage their periods with dignity. Donate to help the Simama na DADA initiative reach more girls during this COVID-19 crisis.

fields.title: Join the Arise Advocacy Network
fields.what_description: Join the Irise Advocacy Network. Either become an Empower Period Agent of Change or join the Empower Period Network and lead your own advocacy project to end period shame within your community, as well as at a national level. For more details, follow the link.
fields.why_description: The Empower Period Project provides young people with the opportunity to lead their own period positive advocacy projects within their communities and contribute to national conversation about periods. Ultimately building a movement of young people who can end period shame and realise period equality for everyone. Join the movement today.

fields.title: Follow No More Taboo’s guide on how to become a more period friendly organisation
fields.what_description: Follow No More Taboo’s guide on how to become a more period friendly organisation. Some very simple changes can make a huge difference to the people who menstruate at your workplace.
fields.why_description: Over 50% of the population have periods, but many feel that it is not easy to say they feel unwell due to their period or change their period product without hiding it out of sight on a run to the bathroom. This needs to change. Everyone should feel comfortable at work when they are on their period.

fields.title: Sign a petition to make period pants 0% VAT
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to make period pants 0% VAT along with disposable menstrual products in the new financial year.
fields.why_description: As of January 2021, there will be no tax on menstrual products, but reusable period pants were failed to be acknowledged as a menstrual product. This will allow disposable period products to be lower priced than sustainable period pants taxed at 20% VAT. Sustainable periods should not be a luxury.

fields.title: Donate basic necessities to a Medaille safe house
fields.what_description: Donate necessities such as razors, toilet roll, sanitary products and towels to residents in a Medaille safe house.
fields.why_description: The Medaille Trust runs nine safe houses in the UK for men, women and families who have escaped modern slavery. In each house, their trained staff help rebuild lives: assisting asylum claims, organising medical treatment, reconnecting victims with their loved ones along with other support.

fields.title: Be a period detective with City to Sea
fields.what_description: If you find plastic-free period products in a retailer, share a picture using #BloodySuccess and tag the supermarket. If you don't, share a picture of you instead using #BloodyShame and tell the supermarket what you were after. For more details, follow the link.
fields.why_description: A major barrier preventing people from switching to plastic-free period products is the lack of availability where they shop. Supermarkets need to offer more plastic-free options. Whoever you are, wherever you live, you deserve to have access to period products that don’t harm your health or the planet.

fields.title: Watch the NUS virtual rally videos
fields.what_description: In December 2020, the National Union of Students held a digital rally to hear from students, officers, and special guests about their thoughts on the current crisis affecting students.
fields.why_description: Hearing first hand from these people can help to raise your awareness of the issues facing students and strengthen the campaign by coming together as a movement.

fields.title: Download Strava to find and record your travel habits
fields.what_description: Download the Strava app and join the millions of others recording their activities, building community, and getting motivated. Use the app to find new walking routes, record your daily cycle trips — and if you like to run, even track those too!
fields.why_description: Strava athletes upload everything from walks around the block to Tour de France stage wins. If you’re out there going for it, you’re one of them. Recording your movements and seeing your friends' is a great way to motivate you to keep going – walking to school, cycling to work, or going for a weekend hike.

fields.title: Volunteer with the Simama na DADA Initiative
fields.what_description: Volunteer with Simama na DADA: a non-profit organisation who aim to empower girls in Kenya through period product provision and mentorship.
fields.why_description: Girls often miss one or more days of school during their periods. The Simama NA DADA Initiative provides over 6,000 pads every month to girls in Kenya to keep them in school. Volunteer to help them reach even more girls.

fields.title: Do a Bloody Good Period's Walk of No Shame
fields.what_description: Do a Bloody Good Period's Walk of No Shame. Rather than hide your period products away next time you need to use one, be open about it instead. Start a conversation and get people sharing their experiences. Follow the link for more details.
fields.why_description: We shouldn't feel like we need to whisper about having periods and stuff tampons up our sleeves or sneak our bags to the loo when it’s ‘that time of the month’. Periods away aren't some kind of shameful secret, they are normal, healthy and essential. Do a Walk of No Shame to help normalise periods.

fields.title: Share the news that 'Tampon Tax' will be scrapped from 2021
fields.what_description: Tampons and other sanitary products currently have 5% VAT added to their price in the UK because EU laws categorise them as ‘non-essential’ items. This will be scrapped from 2021. Follow the link to find the post and share the good news.
fields.why_description: Obviously period products should be available for free, like condoms, but the change is definitely a step in the right direction. Share to celebrate the hard work of the campaigners around the UK and raise awareness of period poverty.

fields.title: Share Free Periods' post about why periods matter
fields.what_description: Share FreePeriods' post about why periods matter and raise awareness of how period taboo impacts on education, work lives, self-esteem and relationships. To find the post just follow the link.
fields.why_description: The period taboo is pervasive, and a huge obstacle in the fight for menstrual equity. We must encourage open and empowering conversation about periods to break the stigma. Share some powerful statistics to highlight why change is needed.

fields.title: Host a screening of Period. End of Sentence.
fields.what_description: Host a screening of documentary film, Period. End of Sentence., to increase awareness of menstrual inequality. Gather a group of friends, colleagues, or family members — virtually or in-person — grab a bowl of popcorn and let the conversation flow.
fields.why_description: Period. End of Sentence. follows the women of Kathikhera as they install a machine and sell their period pads throughout their district. The film aims to inspire people everywhere to think globally and recognise the impact young women can have, and is one of the best ways to start a conversation around menstruation.

fields.title: Read this article to learn why boys should understand menstruation too
fields.what_description: Read this short article to learn why it is imperative for boys to learn about menstruation and understand its effects.
fields.why_description: Periods are now being discussed, unashamedly, in our political and cultural institutions. But we need to make sure that is also happening in our everyday conversations. One in five young women in the UK has experienced bullying about periods. The next generation of boys need to be taught that periods are not taboo. We don’t need euphemisms: menstruation must be a normal topic of conversation for everyone, regardless of their gender.

fields.title: Sponsor a guide dog puppy
fields.what_description: Sponsor a puppy today and support them on their journey to become a fully qualified guide dog, which drastically improves the lives of those who need guide dogs.
fields.why_description: £7.50 could help towards paying for micro chipping for a guide dog puppy, £10.00 could pay towards a cosy snuggle mat for a new-born guide dog puppy, and £15.00 could feed a guide dog puppy for almost three weeks.

fields.title: Make yourself a menstruation bracelet
fields.what_description: Download the bracelet guide to make your own menstruation bracelet, consisting of 28 beads, 5 of which are red (28 = average duration of the cycle; 5 = average days of bleeding). You'll help to establish the menstruation bracelet as a simple yet powerful global symbol for menstruation and Menstrual Health Day.
fields.why_description: Visual symbols have the power to rally people and to act as a catalyst for social change. You can use the bracelet to engage anyone, from local government ofﬁcials to national ministers, from movie stars to social media influencers, and ask them to add their voice to the cause.

fields.title: Join Unseen and PMP Recruitment's 'Be Seen, Be Heard' campaign
fields.what_description: PMP Recruitment is encouraging those taking part in the campaign to wear high visibility jackets (and other equipment) printed with the Helpline number in a bid to increase awareness of forced labour and encourage businesses to unite, support their workforce and report suspected cases.
fields.why_description: Many industries are at risk of being targeted by traffickers, who control groups of workers, usually through threats or physical or mental abuse. PMP decided to raise awareness of this by promoting the Modern Slavery Helpline so that employees, clients and the wider industry know who to turn to if they’re worried about slavery and exploitation in their operations.

fields.title: Use these tips to find out how to reuse glass jars at home
fields.what_description: These tips will show you how you can simply reuse glass jars for items around the house. These include using glass jars to store foods such as soup and sauces, using jars for vases, and even as a cup!
fields.why_description: Reusing glass jars is a great alternative from buying plastic tupperware to store food. It decreases waste produced, and is a great way to reuse and repurpose items.

fields.title: Share the story of your first period with You Humanity
fields.what_description: Share the story of your first menstruation with our partner, You Humanity. Don't be embarrassed. Give every tiny detail.
fields.why_description: Menstruation is often seen as a shameful conversation, even in the 21st century. In the UK, nearly half of girls and young women aged 14-21 are embarrassed by their periods. Share your first menstruation story to help break the stigma.

fields.title: Read about the effects of COVID-19 on the LGBTQ+ community
fields.what_description: Like any minority group, the LGBTQ+ community has suffered disproportionately during the pandemic, whether from homelessness, lack of access to healthcare, or unsafe living situations. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content.
fields.why_description: By better understanding the extra difficulties LGBTQ+ people are facing during the pandemic, you can become a better ally to LGBTQ+ people in your life and a better advocate for LGBTQ+ causes.

fields.title: Follow Bloody Good Period's guide on how to talk about periods
fields.what_description: Read Blood Good Period's summary on what not to say, and what to say instead, about periods, and start changing they way you talk about periods today.
fields.why_description: Straightforward period talk- like calling pads and tampons 'period products'- helps to break down shame and make essential information accessible, to everyone who needs it. Periods are not dirty and unhygienic, and they are not a marker of femininity to everyone, and our language shouldn't suggest otherwise.

fields.title: Read about conversion therapy in the UK
fields.what_description: Learn about what conversion therapy is, and why it is still legal in Britain today. To continue your learning journey on this topic, head to the learning hub for more content
fields.why_description: Through this learning material you will be able to understand the gravity of the  issues facing  LGBTQ+ people in the UK today and what needs to be changed.

fields.title: Become a Guardian with Hope for Justice
fields.what_description: Guardians are a community of monthly givers whose passion and financial commitment is enabling and empowering Hope for Justice's life-changing anti-trafficking projects across the world.
fields.why_description: Guardians enable Hope for Justice to rescue victims around the world, restore lives, reform society and prevent further expolitation.

fields.title: Volunteer for Hope for Justice
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Hope for Justice to help change lives and end slavery.
fields.why_description: Hope for Justice exists to bring an end to modern slavery by preventing exploitation, rescuing victims, restoring lives and reforming society. Around the world, they are growing a movement of abolitionists who believe freedom is worth the fight. Their team works from more than 30 locations across five continents. If you’re looking to make a difference, this is the place for the you.

fields.title: Donate to Migrant Help
fields.what_description: Follow the link to donate what you can to Migrant Help, a charity that exists to protect people affected by displacement and exploitation.
fields.why_description: Your donations make a real difference. They are used to support and empower vulnerable migrants in the UK, helping them to thrive as individuals and recover from their trauma.

fields.title: Sign a petition calling for survivor and migrant access to healthcare during the pandemic
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to protect survivors and migrants from the effects of the pandemic.
fields.why_description: The COVID-19 crisis is laying bare the gaps in protection that exist for modern slavery survivors and at-risk migrants around the world. For those without the legal right to remain in a country, accessing medical help just isn’t possible or comes with the threat of detention and deportation. Signing this petition calls on world governments to adopt measures to grant all modern slavery victims, and those at risk of modern slavery including undocumented migrant workers, refugees and people seeking asylum, access to healthcare and government support – free from the risk of detention or deportation.

fields.title: Start an Equality Now Club
fields.what_description: Stand up for gender equality by starting an Equality Now club at your school. Equality Now deeply believes in the power of youth activism and building partnership. Follow the link below to find out how you can make this possible.
fields.why_description: By starting a club, you are taking the first steps to being part of an organization putting the rights of women and girls at the top of the agenda on a global scale. Your support is extremely valuable to us and the women and girls we are all working for.

fields.title: Volunteer for Stella's Voice
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Stella's Voice in a number of ways to support their efforts in preventing modern slavery.
fields.why_description: Donating to Stella's Voice can help to fund their Girl's Homes which offer a safe place for young women and children who are victims of human trafficking the chance to complete their education, learn life skills and grow in an environment that changes their mindset from 'I am just an orphan' to 'I am worthy of being loved'.

fields.title: Run or walk 20 miles to #StepInsideOut for Hope for Justice
fields.what_description: Hope for Justice is challenging everyone who wants to live in a world free from slavery to join in this years Hope Challenge by running or walking 20 miles but with a twist...your clothes have to be inside out!
fields.why_description: As well as raising awareness, Hope Challenge INSIDE OUT is a great way to raise vital funds to help them see more people rescued and restored from human trafficking. Hope for Justice are asking you to wear your heart on your sleeve, to show the world that you want to make a difference.

fields.title: Sign a petition to stop forced organ harvesting
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to end organ harvesting, an act detrimental to our human rights.
fields.why_description: It is shocking, but human trafficking for the purpose of organ removal and organ trafficking persist around the world, with primary victims being political prisoners, ethnic and religious minorities, and other vulnerable people. Alarmingly, globally only seven countries have passed legislation to combat these horrific crimes. We demand more countries follow suit to stop forced organ harvesting and organ trafficking once and for all.

fields.title: Link your Amazon account to donate to Disability Rights UK
fields.what_description: Link your Amazon account to donate to Disability Rights UK and every time you shop with Amazon, a percentage will be donated to Disability Rights UK at no extra cost to you.
fields.why_description: This will allow you to support disabled people every time you shop, offering an effective and easy way to contribute to a good cause.

fields.title: Call on the UK to end child marriage
fields.what_description: In England and Wales 16- and 17-year olds are currently allowed to marry with parental consent, a legal exception that leaves children vulnerable to parental and familial coercion to enter into a marriage against their will. Sign this petition to raise the legal age of marriage in England and Wales to 18 to better protect children from the risks associated with child marriage.
fields.why_description: Often, a child is unable to recognize a marriage as forced until many years later. Children living in their family homes are vulnerable to being influenced and coerced into accepting a marriage. They may be victims of coercive control. Banning child marriage will help stop putting children in a situation where they have to speak out to be safe. Instead, children will be automatically protected from the risks associated with child marriage through virtue of being under the age 18.

fields.title: Collect and save your stamps for RNIB
fields.what_description: Saving stamps is an easy way to support RNIB at home, work, or in your local community. You can request a collection box for your office reception, school or local community centre.
fields.why_description: Making a small change at no extra cost to you is a great and easy way to support charities working to improve life for disabled people.

fields.title: Volunteer for Black Country Women's Aid
