fields.what_description: Volunteer for the charity Black Country Women's Aid (BCWA) either as a charity tin collector or a community poster distributor. These roles are based around the Birmingham area and is best suited to those who have their own transport and preferably have a good knowledge of the local area. Training and support is provided.
fields.why_description: BCWA is an independent charity which has supported survivors of violence and abuse for over 30 years. They offer a range of community services and refuge for women, children and men who have experienced domestic abuse, rape and sexual violence, stalking, exploitation and modern day slavery. Their sensitive and holistic support helps survivors to escape from violence, cope with trauma and rebuild their lives. By volunterring, you will make a huge contribution to the work of BCWA.

fields.title: Learn about the Modern Slavery Hotline
fields.what_description: Learn about the modern slavery helpine to find out what you can do if you or someone you know is a survivor.
fields.why_description: Through the helpline, potential survivors are able to speak to fully trained call handlers who can help them access relevant services, including Government-funded support through the National Referral Mechanism.

fields.title: Download this toolkit to raise awareness for modern slavery
fields.what_description: Download this toolkit to raise awareness of modern slavery in rural areas.
fields.why_description: Modern slavery is often associated with big cities such as London and Birmingham, but in reality it is just as likely to take place in towns, villages, and remote countryside areas. However, modern slavery in rural areas is under-reported. To help, we have created a rural toolkit, to equip churches and communities in rural areas to respond to modern slavery. The toolkit will enable groups to raise awareness of modern slavery and identify victims, so they can get the support they need.

fields.title: Watch this video about Period Pain
fields.what_description: How do menstruators experience period pain? And how does it feel to have their pain dismissed? In this PERIOD Talk video, menstruators from across the globe tell us what it is like living in pain, and their journey battling the dismissal of said pain by society and medical professionals alike. Let's talk periods!
fields.why_description: Period pain is often dismissed and thought to be something normal which menstruators should just get on with. This video shows that it can be a real hindrance to people who menstruate and therefore more research should be done into the casues of period pain.

fields.title: Download a 'Spot the Signs' poster for your home or workplace
fields.what_description: Download a poster outlining the common signs of human trafficking to raise awareness in your home and/or work space.
fields.why_description: Human trafficking is happening all around us. Victims are often hidden away, but it is possible you will encounter individuals or situations of concern. Knowing how to 'spot the signs' could save lives.

fields.title: Read the infographic: Periods Don't Stop for Pandemics
fields.what_description: Periods don't stop for pandemics. Read this infographic to find out what Covid-19 means for menstrual health and hygiene.
fields.why_description: The current pandemic highlights and further exacerbates the menstruation-related challenges many women and girls face around the world. Once the pandemic is over, it is time for urgent action to address the ongoing global crisis in menstrual health and hygiene.

fields.title: Sign a petition to end slavery in the US prison and detention industry
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to call for major reforms in the US prison industry and stop forced labour.
fields.why_description: Under the 13th Amendment, involuntary servitude remains legal as punishment for a crime. However, even those who are not convicted of crimes – including immigrant detainees – have allegedly been subjected to forced labour behind bars and exploited for profit.

fields.title: Read this article on the environmental reasons to switch to a menstrual cup
fields.what_description: Read this article to find out how you can manage your period in a more environmentally friendly manner.
fields.why_description: Most sanitary pads contain up to 90% plastic, while tampons have at least 6% plastic. The production of plastic and improper disposal of these products is causing increased pollution and filling up landfills. Shockingly, menstrual products are the fifth most common item found on Europe’s beaches, more widespread than single-use coffee cups, cutlery, or straws. There are several more environmentally friendly period products available, such as reusable pads, reusable tampon applicators, period underwear and menstrual cups.

fields.title: Calculate the number of slaves that work for you
fields.what_description: Take this survery to calculate the number of slaves that work to produce the products and services that you use everyday.
fields.why_description: Living in the UK means we are led to believe that modern day slavery only takes place in developing countries where we as individuals can have zero impact. But the fact is that each of us is surrounded by modern day slavery, whether it's the phone we use, the food we eat, or the clothes we wear. This survey will help you to become aware of your decisions before it's too late.

fields.title: Pledge to join the fight for #FREEDOMFORGIRLS
fields.what_description: Join #FREEDOMFORGIRLS and commit to putting an end to modern slavery. Sign the pledge to put a stop to the trafficking of girls, and join the fight to secure Sustainable Development Goal 8.7.
fields.why_description: 71% of modern slavery victims are women and girls. With an estimated 40.3 million people victims of modern slavery and human trafficking, many girls around the world are being treated like a commodity or exploited for someone else’s benefit, unable to leave because of threats, violence, coercion, and abuse of power.

fields.title: Raise donations for Black Country Women's Aid whenever you shop online
fields.what_description: easyfundraising® is the UK’s biggest charity shopping fundraising site. easyfundraising turns your everyday online shopping into free donations for your favourite cause. How? Just start your online shopping first at easyfundraising, then shop as normal. Our retailers will then make a small donation to say “thank you” to a cause of your choice.
fields.why_description: easyfundraising have 4,063 retailers to choose from and so far we've raised over £31 million for thousands of community groups, schools, sports clubs, small and large charities across the UK. Donate to Black Country Women's Aid which supports victims of domestic abuse, sexual violence, child sexual exploitation and human trafficking.

fields.title: Fundraise for ATLEU in the London legal triathlon
fields.what_description: Though the usual walk is not able to go ahead this year due to Covid-19, you can stil take part in a virtual 10k team triathalon by walking/running, cycling or swimming for 10k.
fields.why_description: ATLEU is young charity providing legal representation to victims of trafficking and labour exploitation who assist survivors to obtain safety, recovery and redress. Taking part in this action will help to raise funds for a very valuable cause.

fields.title: Read the article 'why can't victims of trafficking just walk away'
fields.what_description: Read this article by Stop the Traffick on why it is not easy for victims of trafficking to just walk away.
fields.why_description: It seems an obvious question: “Why can’t victims of human trafficking just walk away?” Unfortunately, the reality of this crime makes it incredibly difficult for its victims to escape. Human trafficking is happening all around us with traffickers using a variety of psychologically and physically coercive techniques to trap their victims in plain sight.

fields.title: Join ECPAT's campaign to protect trafficked children
fields.what_description: ECPAT obtained data showing shockingly low numbers of child victims are being given the right to stay in the UK, despite the government's duties to children. This leaves young people at risk of re-trafficking and further harm. Please take a stand by signing the petition below and tweeting your MP.
fields.why_description: The Covid-19 crisis has shown how vital it is to properly support vulnerable people. Amid the pandemic, child victims of trafficking are losing access to essential services and contact, leaving them isolated and at risk of re-trafficking and harm. 5 years ago, the government committed to providing guardians for child victims of trafficking in its Modern Slavery Act. But most child victims are still waiting for this specialist support - needed now more than ever.

fields.title: Donate to Scope
fields.what_description: Scope is an organisation that works to address the needs of disabled people. They are hoping to achieve their goal of Everyday Equality by aiming to change society so that disabled people do not feel inferior and are not treated unfairly or overlooked because of their disabilities.
fields.why_description: By supporting Scope you will help to reach their goal of Everyday Equality for disabled people.

fields.title: Read this article on 'Covid-19 and slavery: the five big impacts'
fields.what_description: Read this article to find out how Covid-19 is exacerbating modern slavery.
fields.why_description: For people who are enslaved or vulnerable to slavery, the economic and social disruption caused by the Covid-19 pandemic is affecting their lives in new and profound ways. As Anti-Slavery International and its partners provide emergency outreach and support across the world – food, water, hygiene materials, education and information – they are observing and documenting the following five coronavirus-related impacts across the world.

fields.title: Learn the difference between an impairment and a disability
fields.what_description: Watch this video to learn about the difference between an impairment and a disability.
fields.why_description: In order to better help the disabled community, it is important to understand the terminology related to disability, including understanding the difference between 'disability' and 'impairment.' Understanding the difference between these terms is central to this campaign.

fields.title: Donate to Disability Rights UK
fields.what_description: Disability Rights UK campaigns for the freedom to live independently and the opportunity to be free of poverty for the 11 million people in Britain with lived experience of disability or health conditions.
fields.why_description: Disabled people already bear the burden of extra costs on their daily life, and the COVID-19 pandemic has exacerbated that. You can directly contribute to the support of disabled people during this time - £20 will run their helpline for an hour, helping up to 4 people.

fields.title: Learn about the Social Model of Disability
fields.what_description: Watch the video to learn about the Social Model of Disability, as explained by disabled people.
fields.why_description: The Social Model of Disability underlies a lot of the understanding of being disabled that disabled people endorse and ascribe to. Learning about it will help frame the experiences of disabled people and better understand how to help make society accessible.

fields.title: Download the Safe Car Wash app
fields.what_description: Download the free app onto your smartphone. Then, when you are using a hand car wash, simply open the app and complete a short survey about the working conditions of the car wash.
fields.why_description: Many hand car washes are legitimate businesses, but some of them are not. Police raids in hand car washes in towns and cities across the UK have unearthed victims living in horrendous conditions. The Safe Car Wash app is a tool that will enable the largest community intelligence gathering exercise ever attempted in the United Kingdom to help put an end to the exploitation of these workers across the country.

fields.title: Donate to RNIB
fields.what_description: Everyday 250 people begin to lose their sight. RNIB has a crucial role to play in creating a world where there are no barriers to people with sight loss. RNIB wants society, communities and individuals to see differently about sight loss, and by donating you will contribute to this essential cause.
fields.why_description: During the pandemic, everyone is living in a very different world. But the pandemic brings particular difficulties for people with sight loss: food shopping, eye care appointments, self-isolating, and social distancing are all especially difficult. By donating, RNIB can continue to be there for people with sight loss, enabling them to get practical advice and emotional support.

fields.title: Volunteer for Guide Dogs UK
fields.what_description: Volunteers can transform the lives of people living with sight loss, whether it is raising our puppies, sighted guiding, collecting funds or cheering on event participants.
fields.why_description: One volunteer said the following: "Because of my volunteering, I feel more confident in dealing with people that I haven’t met before. I feel useful because I’m helping blind and partially sighted people...and I feel happier...it’s just an absolute pleasure to be part of the volunteer team, to help blind and partially sighted people and to contribute to society in this way."

fields.title: Learn 'The Do's and Don't's of Disability'
fields.what_description: Watch the video to learn from a woman with cerebral palsy how you should and shouldn't treat disabled people.
fields.why_description: Learning to reassess and change your own behaviour and the ways in which you interact with disabled people is an important step in becoming a better ally.

fields.title: Join RNID's Campaigns Network
fields.what_description: Join RNID's Campaigns Network and help make society more inclusive for deaf people and those who have hearing loss or tinnitus. There are different ways to get involved – from signing petitions to sharing your experiences.
fields.why_description: Current projects include campaigning to keep hearing aids free on the NHS in England, changing attitudes to deaf people in the workplace, and calling on leading UK retailers to make stores more accessible for people who are deaf or have hearing loss. By connecting with others in your area you can keep up to date with the latest campaigns and find out how you can get involved in making change happen.

fields.title: Volunteer for The Disabilities Trust Group
fields.what_description: Volunteers play a vital role in the day to day operation of The Disability Trust's services. Volunteering activites range from tending to gardens to supporting activities, DIY, community support and cheering at events.
fields.why_description: Not only will volunteering support people with complex disabilities and The Disability Trust staff, it can also help your wellbeing - over 75% of volunteers say that their volunteering improves their mental health and wellbeing.

fields.title: Learn how to treat a person with disabilities
fields.what_description: Watch the video to find out about the proper ways to treat someone with disabilities from people living with disabilities.
fields.why_description: Learning more about disabled people from disabled people is particularly key as it means amplifying their voices and experiences, which are all too often dismissed or left out of important conversations.

fields.title: Volunteer for Sense
fields.what_description: Sense has a variety of different volunteering opportunities available across the UK, face to face and virtual, requiring a range of different skills and with flexible time commitments. From volunteering in a Sense Shop, joining a Sense Holiday, volunteering as a Sense Buddy to giving your time to a Sense Fundraising Group, whatever your experience, skills and interests, Sense has opportunities for you.
fields.why_description: Sense supports deafblind people and those with complex disabilities. By volunteering you will contribute to Sense's aim to make sure that no one, no matter how complex their disabilities, is isolated, left out, or unable to fulfil their potential.

fields.title: Join the RNIB Campaigns Network
fields.what_description: RNIB have a network of over 8,500 campaign supporters who work alongside regional campaigns staff across the UK to challenge inequality for those with sight loss and work towards a more equal and accessible society for all.
fields.why_description: By joining the network you can keep up to date with the latest campaigns and connect with people to make a change together.

fields.title: Sign the petition to make Amazon use plastic-free packaging
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to get Amazon to offer plastic-free packaging with your orders.
fields.why_description: Thousands of the products on Amazon are shipped with plastic wrapping and cushioning materials unnecessarily. It’s unfair that so much plastic is being put into the world when it is avoidable and safe eco options to replace bubble wrap, shrink wrap and styrofoam are available.

fields.title: Join the Zero Waste community
fields.what_description: Join the zero waste community by registering to receive tips and friendly support on reducing your everyday waste. You'll even get a free download of the e-book, A Crash Course in Going Zero Waste.
fields.why_description: Committing to lowering your waste output can be daunting, but start small, get confident, and keep growing! You'll discover great alternatives to everyday items, as well as sustainable companies to follow and important information you should know along the way.

fields.title: Use these tips for recycling
fields.what_description: These simple, easy tips provide you with information on how to recycle. Whilst it might be self-explanatory, different areas have different recycling procedures, and recylcing isn't always something we remember to do. Therefore, these tips will help make you more aware.
fields.why_description: These tips can help us to utilise recycling in meaningful ways. While recycling is important, it is also fundamental that we reuse and repurpose products as an alternative to recycling.

fields.title: Start going zero waste with these tips
fields.what_description: These simple tips provide you with some easy, efficient tips for reducing waste. This even includes how you can swap your shampoo and conditioner to reduce plastic waste.
fields.why_description: Zero waste tips help households, businesses, schools and community groups increase recycling and, subsequently, reduce landfill waste.

fields.title: Make your own facemask
fields.what_description: Use these tips to make your own facemask. Whether you can use a sewing machine, or could reuse an old t-shirt, these tips provide you with a variety of ways to make your own facemask.
fields.why_description: People across the world now have to wear face coverings in certain circumstances when out of the house, to help limit the spread of coronavirus. COVID-19 has triggered an estimated global use of 129 billion face masks and 65 billion gloves every month. It is important that we reduce our consumption of single-plastic facemasks, and make our own alternatives to reduce the plastic pollution.

fields.title: Learn about changing the way we think about disabilities
fields.what_description: Watch 4-time Canadian National Wheelchair Tennis Champion and Paralympian Joe Dembe discuss his journey living with a disability and rethinking the way we view disability.
fields.why_description: It is important to rethink our existing ideas about disability, and Joe Dembe does this by telling his story and talking about how we can empower communities through accessibility.

fields.title: Learn about General Disability Awareness
fields.what_description: Watch the video to learn about etiquette, effective communication, and person-first terminology for disabled people.
fields.why_description: Learning more about disabled people and what to do or not do around them will better equip you to be an effective ally.

fields.title: Make the pledge to stop disability hate crime
fields.what_description: Sign the pledge to call out disability hate crime where you see it, and have conversations with those around you about its impact.
fields.why_description: Disability hate crime is a criminal offence which is perceived by the victim or any other person to be motivated by hostility or prejudice based on a person’s disability or perceived disability. Committing yourself to calling out offensive behaviour is essential to being an ally to disabled people.

fields.title: Sign the UK supermarket plastic-free petition
fields.what_description: Add your name to the petition and tell UK supermarkets to ditch throwaway plastic.
fields.why_description: UK supermarkets currently generate 900,000 tonnes of plastic packaging every year. By ditching plastic packaging, supermarkets have the power to lead the way in dramatically reducing the amount of single-use plastic produced.

fields.title: Follow Hope for Justice on social media
fields.what_description: Follow Hope for Justice on Instagram @hopeforjusticeintl and Twitter @hopeforjustice.
fields.why_description: Hope for Justice is a charity aiming to bring an end to modern slavery by preventing exploitation, rescuing victims, restoring lives, and reforming society. Follow them on social media to find out more about what they do and how you can support them.

fields.title: Reduce, Reuse, Recycle with L'Occitane
fields.what_description: Use this link to find out how you can recycle your L'Occitane products. When purchasing L'Occitane products online, type in RECYCLE in the promotion box. You will then receive a TerraCycle envelope, recyclable of course, where you can fill it with your empty L'Occitane products. Once it is full, please send it back to the address provided, using the free postage service where it will be safely recycled.
fields.why_description: Since January 2019 when the scheme started, 60,700 units of packaging have been collected. This is equivalent to over 1,800 kg of rubbish out of landfills. Therefore, why not contribute to this positive impact?

fields.title: Learn about what really happens to our recycling
fields.what_description: Watch this 8 minute video to get a good insight into what happens to waste and recycling.
fields.why_description: This video will show you the differences between what makes a product recyclable, including the importance of cleaning our products before we recycle them!

fields.title: Sign the petition to pass the Plastic Reduction Act
fields.what_description: Sign this petition urging the California Senate and Assembly to fast-track the approval of the California Circular Economy and Plastic Pollution Reduction Act in 2020. The bill sets the framework for a 75% reduction of all single-use plastic packaging and products sold in California by 2032, with the rest being effectively recyclable or compostable.
fields.why_description: Single-use plastics are wreaking havoc on our neighborhoods and natural environments. The only solution is to shift away from single-use and move toward a thriving culture of reuse. To put this into perspective, landfills are responsible for 20% of methane emissions in the US, and they are not aerated for proper decomposition of natural materials.

fields.title: Donate to Plastic Pollution Coalition
fields.what_description: Donate to Plastic Pollution Coalition. This link will take you to a donation form where you have the option of making a one-off payment, or setting up a monthly payment.
fields.why_description: Your donation helps Plastic Pollution Coalition continue their work toward a world free of plastic pollution. Plastic Pollution Coalition is a growing global alliance of individuals, organizations, businesses, and policymakers working towards a world free of plastic pollution and its toxic impacts on humans, animals, waterways, oceans, and the environment.

fields.title: Learn about how COVID-19 is having an impact on zero waste
fields.what_description: Read this article to learn about how some companies have reverted from their 'zero waste policies' to old habits that contribute to plastic pollution.
fields.why_description: It is estimated that the UK will be disposing of 2.5 million disposable cups because of COVID-19, a rise in takeaway services has also increased non-recyclable takeaway containers, and, of course, PPE includes single-use plastics that cannot be used. By increasing your awareness of how COVID is having an impact on zero waste, you can become more reflexive and aware of how you can help increase zero waste.

fields.title: Buy a product offered by 4ocean
fields.what_description: Buy an item offered by 4ocean, including their branded bracelets, water bottles and flasks.
fields.why_description: Single-use plastic items are so common that it’s easy not to notice them. For instance, plastic bottles of water or soft drink; the plastic straws served in our drinks; the plastic bags we have to buy at stores; the plastic packaging of nearly product in the supermarket. Once you see all this stuff for what it truly is — plastic pollution — it’s simple to just reduce.

fields.title: Use these tips for reducing waste in the kitchen
fields.what_description: Use these tips to find out how you can reduce waste in the kitchen. For example, take reusable cloth shopping bags to the stores instead of plastic bags, and purchase items that can be recycled.
fields.why_description: Want to reduce your waste but don't know where to start? These quick and simple tips will provide you with ways to reduce your waste.

fields.title: Take a quiz on oceans and plastic pollution
fields.what_description: Take this quiz to find out how good your knowledge is on plastic waste, and the impact it is having on our oceans.
fields.why_description: Zero waste can only happen once people are more aware of what zero waste is, how they can help, and what impact it is having on the environment. This quiz is a great way to increase your awareness.

fields.title: Host a refugee child, family or individual in your home
fields.what_description: Host a refugee child, family or individual in your home.
fields.why_description: With over 7,100 host families registered as of April 2018, make yourself proud to make this form of support commonplace in Europe.

fields.title: Download Olio sharing app
fields.what_description: Download the Olio app which will provide you with local shops and neighbours that are giving food and household items away for free — available through the App Store and on Google Play.
fields.why_description: This app has resulted in 6.5 million portions of food being shared, and just under 1 billion litres of water saved. This is a great initiative to help you cut down on your food waste, by giving food and unwanted items away rather than contributing to more waste.

fields.title: Take this quiz to discover your environmental footprint
fields.what_description: Take this questionnaire which will ask you questions about your diet, home and travel arrangements, and lifestyle habits. It will then use your responses to calculate your carbon footprint.
fields.why_description: The planet is in crisis — from climate change to the pollution in our oceans and devastation of our forests — and it's up to all of us to fix it. Understanding where you can reduce your carbon footprint is a good place to start.

fields.title: Recycle with The Body Shop
fields.what_description: When you are next in The Body Shop, bring in your empty beauty products: packaging, bottles, pipettes, pumps, mascaras, even lip glosses. All brands are welcome, not just those from The Body Shop, and your empty products will then be recycled with TerraCycle.
fields.why_description: The beauty industry generates so much plastic that it has become one of the main contributors of it entering landfills. The products you send in to be recycled could be transformed into items such as park benches or even playgrounds!

fields.title: Sign the petition to restart the refugee resettlement scheme
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to make the government extend the refugee resettlement scheme beyond 2020.
fields.why_description: Due to COVID-19 the government temporarily halted the resettlement of refugees in the UK. This scheme is about to end, and it is vital that it continues.

fields.title: Sign up to the camCrag newsletter
fields.what_description: Sign up for the camCRAG monthly newsletters to stay up to date with what the organisation have been up to and what projects they have lined up..
fields.why_description: Cambridge Convoy Refugee Action Group is a team of activists that seek to coordinate the logistics of sending donations and volunteers to help refugees in the Calais area. Signing up to their newsletter will keep you informed on how you might be able to help refugees struggling at the border.

fields.title: Donate to Plastic Free Oceans projects
fields.what_description: Make a one-off or monthly payment to Plastic Free Oceans
fields.why_description: Donations are split 50% to Plastic Free Oceans projects (encouraging schools globally to engage in plastics reduction) and 50% to installing solar power in remote Pacific island schools. Giving kids clean free electricity for a modern education is worthwhile in itself, but the schools, by accepting the system, commit to spend 20 minutes each week picking up plastics.

fields.title: Write to your MP to pledge your support for migrant domestic workers
fields.what_description: Write to your MP using the template provided to show your support for migrant domestic workers.
fields.why_description: We want the Government to reinstate the pre-2012 Overseas Domestic Worker visa in order to enable migrant domestic workers to renew their visas (which are currently capped at 6 months) and to ensure there is a route to settlement (also known as Indefinite Leave to Remain).

fields.title: Sign this petition to reinstate the pre-2012 Overseas Domestic Worker visa
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to reinstate the pre-2012 Overseas Domestic Worker visa with a route to resettlement. For further reading, you can also read Kalayaan's briefing which we presented to the Home Office last year on the current issues faced by workers under the current visa regime http://www.kalayaan.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Briefing-MSSIG-meet-11-September.pdf.
fields.why_description: We want the Government to reinstate the pre-2012 Overseas Domestic Worker visa in order to enable migrant domestic workers to renew their visas (which are currently capped at 6 months) and to ensure there is a route to settlement (also known as Indefinite Leave to Remain).

fields.title: Join the camCRAG Facebook page
fields.what_description: Join the camCRAG Facebook page.
fields.why_description: The camCRAG Facebook group will keep you updated with any fundraising and donation activities that you can get involved with.

fields.title: Buy a product offered by Zero Waste Collective
fields.what_description: Buy some of the products offered by The Zero Waste Collective shop, or suggestions that you can buy from Amazon. These include all-natural dish cloths and tea towels, non-plastic shopping bags.
fields.why_description: Single-use plastic items are so common that it’s easy not to notice them. For instance, plastic bottles of water or soft drink; the plastic straws served in our drinks; the plastic bags we have to buy at stores; the plastic packaging of nearly product in the supermarket. Once you see all this stuff for what it truly is — plastic pollution — it’s simple to just reduce.

fields.title: Recycle old clothes with H&M
fields.what_description: Follow this link to find out how you can recycle old clothes by simply dropping a bag of what you no longer wear into the recycling box at your local H&M store. All textiles are welcome – any brand, any condition – even odd socks, worn-out T-shirts, and old sheets.
fields.why_description: Textiles are sent to the nearest recycling plant where they’re sorted by hand. For every bag of textiles you drop off, you’ll receive a discount card for 15% off your next in-store purchase.

fields.title: Learn about the different recycling symbols
fields.what_description: Explore what the different recycling symbols mean that you regularly see on products.
fields.why_description: By understanding what the different symbols mean, you will be able to identify which products can be recycled, or if certain ones need disposing of in certain places, such as electrical items and glass bottles.

fields.title: Donate to Zero Waste Europe
fields.what_description: Donate to Zero Waste Europe. This link will take you to a form where you can decide how much money you would like to donate.
fields.why_description: Zero Waste Europe empowers communities to rethink their relationship with resources, operating as a knowledge network and as an advocacy group. 100% of your money helps Europe transition to a zero waste community.

fields.title: Sign the petition to save the resettlement scheme
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to make the government extend the refugee resettlement scheme beyond 2020.
fields.why_description: This scheme has offered sanctuary to some of the most vulnerable refugees, including families with disabilities or experiences of torture. The UK has resettled over 16,000 people, and it is vital it continues beyond 2020.

fields.title: Donate to help build an education centre for young refugees
fields.what_description: Refugee Support Network is raising money to transform an old bank in London into an education centre for young refugees.  All donations before the 1st January 2021 will be matched
fields.why_description: RSN is receiving more referrals now than ever before. This education centre will allow them to meet that demand and provide a place of safety, sanctuary and study for young people fleeing persecution and conflict

fields.title: Contact local, regional and national media organisations to alert them to the Sevenoaks resettlement story
fields.what_description: Use the template flyer in the link attached to send to local, regional and national newspapers to see if they can help with finding a home for the refugee family of 4 who are set to arrive in Sevenoaks January 2021, and who will need a 3-bedroom house.
fields.why_description: By sharing the campaign on a wider scope, it will help spread awareness of the situation and increase the chances of a home being found for the family.

fields.title: Transform the lives of a refugee family and transform your community
fields.what_description: Are you one of the many people in Britain who would like to help people fleeing war and persecution? Do you feel you, your friends and neighbours could welcome a refugee family into your community, help them settle and build a new life? If so, Community Sponsorship programme could be for you!
fields.why_description: It is giving ordinary people responsibility for the entire journey that a refugee family goes on from the time they land at an airport in Britain, through to them being completely resettled and integrated.

fields.title: Foster an unaccompanised asylum seeking child
fields.what_description: TACT is looking for foster carers across the UK to specialise in unaccompanied asylum seeking fostering.
fields.why_description: Many young people have been separated from their families, they are extremely distressed and frightened as a result. Fostering young people who are seeking asylum is incredibly rewarding as you will help them settle into their new life in the UK.

fields.title: Support SICK Magazine
fields.what_description: Support SICK Magazine by donating.
fields.why_description: Support SICK Magazine by donating money. Through donating, you get to support the fantastic work SICK does, including providing opportunities and work for those who are chronically ill and disabled.

fields.title: Set up a donation to CamCRAG
fields.what_description: You can donate to camCRAG through text messaging, online or through Facebook.
fields.why_description: CamCRAG rely entirely on the generosity of their supporters to provide the aid they send to Calais, and the funds they use to help refugees. They have no employees, no offices, and minimal administrative costs, therefore you can be sure any money you give goes directly to help those in need.

fields.title: Learn about ways to increase graduate employability during lockdown
fields.what_description: 29% of final year students have lost their jobs and 26% have lost their internships as a result of the pandemic. Learn about other ways students can increase their employability during lockdown when opportunities are scarce.
fields.why_description: Learn about different ways to boost employability during lockdown to help any students in your life that might be struggling with job and opportunity losses.

fields.title: Donate to the UK Disability History Month website
fields.what_description: UK Disability History Month is an annual event which acts as a platform for the disabled community to focus on the history of their struggle for human rights. Donations help keep the website running, which is full of resources for both disabled and non-disabled people to learn about and engage more with disability and topics surrounding the issue.
fields.why_description: UK Disability History Month is an annual event which acts as a platform for the disabled community to focus on the history of their struggle for human rights. Donations help keep the website running, which is full of resources for both disabled and non-disabled people to learn about and engage more with disability and topics surrounding the issue.

fields.title: Donate to IntoUniversity
fields.what_description: Donate to IntoUniversity to support their network of local learning centres for disadvantged students.
fields.why_description: Donating to IntoUniversity will help provide hands-on help to students who need it locally, giving them a quiet and inspiring space to work and receive advice on their futures.

fields.title: Write to your MP explaining the #StudentsDeserveBetter campaign using this template
fields.what_description: Use the template given to write to your MP asking them to publically support the campaign.
fields.why_description: The letter outlines the demands of the campaign and, with political support, will help to bring about a change in policy in favour of student rights.

fields.title: Donate to The Access Project
fields.what_description: Donate to The Access Project in their efforts to support students from disadvantaged backgrounds access top universities, through a unique combination of tuition and in-school mentoring.
fields.why_description: The Access Project believes every young person, regardless of background, should have the opportunity to reach their potential and get into university. Young people from the most disadvantaged backgrounds are almost ten times less likely to go to a top university.

fields.title: Sign the #StudentsDeserveBetter petition
fields.what_description: Sign the NUS petition calling universities, colleges and the government to improve the support currently available to students.
fields.why_description: The petition demands an upholding of basic legal rights, the right to leave accommodation, fair treatment during lockdowns, and an effective strategy for education.

fields.title: Join the #StudentsDeserveBetter campain with NUS
fields.what_description: Join the NUS campaign calling for the government to address the needs of students through the pandemic.
fields.why_description: The campaign demands a recognition of students' basic legal rights, to give students to right to leave without financial detriment, ensure fair treatment during accomodation lockdowns and to provide an effective strategy for education now and for post-covid recovery.

fields.title: Write to your Councillor to support accessible toilet signs
fields.what_description: Write to your Councillor to support accessible toilet signs.
fields.why_description: Using Crohn's and Colitis UK's premade email template, send an email to your local Councillor to demand accessible toilet signs inclusive of those with non-visible disabilities be put up, as well as training staff to raise awareness regarding invisible disabilities. These little steps go a long way in advocating for and protecting the rights of those with non-visible disabilities!

fields.title: Watch "I'm a 22-Year-Old With Fibromyalgia"
fields.what_description: Watch a video about a 22 year old living with fibromyalgia from Health Magazine.
fields.why_description: This video gives a good glimpse into what life is like day-to-day for Bel, who has been living with fibromyalgia since she was a teenager.

fields.title: Fundraise for Action for ME with Savoo
fields.what_description: Join Savoo and fundraise for Action for ME, a chronic fatigue syndrome charity organisation, by going shopping.
fields.why_description: Savoo is a money-saving and online fundraising website. They have over 20,000 discount codes to use. By joining and choosing to support Action for ME, every time you use a discount code, Savoo gives money to the charity.

fields.title: Read "The hidden challenges of invisible disabilities"
fields.what_description: Read the article "The hidden challenges of invisible disabilities" from the BBC.
fields.why_description: This article gives a good overview of some of the challenges faced by people living with invisible disabilities.

fields.title: Listen to "Invisible Disabilities" on Radio 1's Life Hacks podcast
fields.what_description: Listen to  the episode "Invisible Disabilities" on Radio 1's Life Hacks podcast.
fields.why_description: In this episode, Susie, who was diagnosed with a tumour, talks about what life is like living with an invisible disability, including the barriers she faces with people who don't understand or believe her disability.

fields.title: Donate to Crohn's & Colitis UK
fields.what_description: Donate to Crohn's & Colitis UK, a charity organisation for those living with Crohn's disease and Ulcerative Colitis.
fields.why_description: Donations to Crohn's & Colitis UK helps support the charity in the advocacy work they do for those living with Crohn's disease and Ulcerative Colitis.

fields.title: Send an email to ask UK restaurants to install new accessible toilet signage
fields.what_description: Send an email to ask UK restaurants to install new accessible toilet signage using Crohn's and Colitis UK's prepared template.
fields.why_description: The current toilet signage discriminates against those with non-visible disabilities. By taking this action, you are sending the 12 biggest pub chains and restaurants in the UK an email asking for more accessible signage that acknowledges those with non-visible disabilities.

fields.title: Donate to Get Further
fields.what_description: Donate to Get Further, an organisation aiming to transform the experience of students facing challenges in further education, helping them to build their skills and realise their aspirations for education and work.
fields.why_description: Your donation will help students to get back on track with high-quality tuition. Just £25 could give a struggling student one invaluable hour of tuition.

fields.title: Become a donor with Impetus
fields.what_description: Donate to Impetus and support their efforts in fighting for disadvantaged young people in the world of work, school, and beyond.
fields.why_description: Impetus find the best charities to help them become stronger organisations dedicated to changing the lives of young people. They also influence policy makers so that all young people get the support they deserve within education and employment.

fields.title: Donate to RAiISE
fields.what_description: Donate to RAiISE (Raising Awareness of Invisible Illness in Schools & Education).
fields.why_description: Donations to RAiISE helps support the charity in the advocacy work they do for youth living with invisible disabilities.

fields.title: Watch "See my Invisible Disability"
fields.what_description: Watch the "See my Invisible Disability" Video from Fixers UK.
fields.why_description: This video is a discussion with four people living with different non-visible disabilities and gives good insight on what living with their different disabilities is like.

fields.title: Lobby your MP for better care for those with endometriosis
fields.what_description: Lobby your MP for better healthcare for those with endometriosis.
fields.why_description: Endometriosis care has not improved or changed in the last decade and treatment options are still limited. Use this prepared email template by Endometriosis UK to lobby your MP for better endometriosis care.

fields.title: Fundraise for MS Society with Everyclick
fields.what_description: Join Everyclick and help fundraise for MS Society, a multiple sclerosis charity, for free by using their search engine.
fields.why_description: Everyclick is a search engine that provides a free way to raise funds for charities just by using their search engine! By signing up and connecting with MS Society, all of the things you search through Everyclick will raise money for MS Society.

fields.title: Donate to Action for ME
fields.what_description: Donate to Action for ME, a chronic fatigue syndrome charity organisation.
fields.why_description: Donations to Action for ME helps support the charity in the advocacy work they do for those living with chronic fatigue syndrome, or myalgic encelopathy.

fields.title: Buy a product from Action for ME
fields.what_description: Shop at Action for ME's online store to support the organisation, which supports those living with chronic fatigue syndrome.
fields.why_description: By buying an item from Action for ME, you help support the organisation in the work they do to advocate for those with chronic fatigue syndrome.

fields.title: Set up Payroll Giving for Crohn's and Colitis UK
fields.what_description: Set up Payroll Giving to support Crohn's and Colitis UK.
fields.why_description: Payroll Giving allows you to donate through your salary pre-tax, further helping Crohn's & Colitis UK fund important work such as research, advocacy, and support for those who live with Crohn's Disease and Ulcerative Colitis.

fields.title: Donate to Disability Arts Online's Covid Commissions 2021
fields.what_description: Donate to Disability Arts Online's Covid Commissions 2021.
fields.why_description: Disability Arts Online recognises how the disabled artist community has been adversely impacted by COVID-19 as many people in the disabled community have had to shield long-term because of the pandemic. The Covid Commission 2021 aims to fund 30 disabled artists for paid work this year.

fields.title: Buy a SICK Magazine
fields.what_description: Buy a SICK Magazine.
fields.why_description: SICK Magazine is an independent magazine created by chronically ill and disabled people, aiming to elevate the experiences and voices of the community, including those who live with non-visible disabilities. By buying a magazine, you support disabled creators and can learn more about their experiences in their own words.

fields.title: Join in on an event with Impetus
fields.what_description: Browse Impetus' suggested fundraising activities, or think of your own to support their efforts in helping disadvantaged young people. Attend the Transforming Lives Dinner, a half marathon or a sponsored triathlon to name a few.
fields.why_description: By supporting Impetus, you are supporting their work in collaborating with charities that are changing the prospects of disadvantaged children in the world of work, school and beyond.

fields.title: Get advice on student loans
fields.what_description: Learn more from Citizens Advice about who can get a student loan and other important information.
fields.why_description: What financial help you can get depends on the course you study, where you live, and your individual circumstances, so it's important to know all of the information before making any concrete decisions.

fields.title: Find out what Citizens Advice says about student housing council tax
fields.what_description: Get advice on whether or not you should be paying council tax as a student.
fields.why_description: Find out if who qualifies for an exemption to help you and other students who may struggling financially save on bills.

fields.title: Fundraise for Crohn's & Colitis UK
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Crohn's & Colitis UK.
fields.why_description: There are many ways to fundraise for Crohn's & Colitis UK. This page lists all the options you have. The money raised for the organisation will go towards research, advocacy, and support for those who live with Crohn's disease and Ulcerative Colitis.

fields.title: Find out what Citizens Advice says about renting privately as a student
fields.what_description: Get advice about renting from a private landlord if you have an assured shorthold tenancy.
fields.why_description: Knowing your rights is essential when it comes to renting, especially as a cash-strapped student.

fields.title: Fundraise for the Sutton Trust
fields.what_description: Find out how you can become a social mobility champion and help fundraise for the Sutton Trust.
fields.why_description: Your fundraising efforts would help support the Sutton Trust's ambition to fight for the social mobility of young people born into lower socio-economic backgrounds.

fields.title: Sign this petition to enable all students to end university tenancy agreements early
fields.what_description: Sign this petition demanding that the government allow students to end university tenancies early due to the disruption caused by the pandemic.
fields.why_description: Many students are currently tied into expensive agreements for rooms they do not need and would rather not use. Signing this petition will help pressure the government into freeing students from these expensive rental agreements.

fields.title: Become a pro bono volunteer with Impetus
fields.what_description: Apply your professional know-how and commerical thinking to help charities achieve better outcomes, as well as accelerating your personal development.
fields.why_description: Impetus' pro bono network is made up of more that 350 professionals and 40 companies. Pro bono volunteers help charities to coach leadership teams, develop strategic reviews, fundraise and manage finances, and tackle legal issues.

fields.title: Share your skills and knowledge with Action Tutoring
fields.what_description: Action Tutoring are always looking for people who can help with research, graphic design, proofreading, media and campaigns, to help their efforts in supporting disadvantaged pupils.
fields.why_description: By sharing your skills and knowledge, you will be helping Action Tutoring close the education attainment gap, as they continue to support those disadvantaged young people struggling academically during times of absent education due to Covid-19.

fields.title: Volunteer as a tutor for Action Tutoring
fields.what_description: Volunteer as a tutor for Action Tutoring, a charity that partners with primary and secondary schools to deliver tutoring programmes for pupils preparing for their GCSEs and SATs. This can be done in person or online.
fields.why_description: By giving up your time to tutor those pupils who have fallen behind due to school closures, you will be helping disadvantaged young people who do not have the means of acheiving an effective education at home, or pay for a private tutor, achieve the qualifications necessary for them to progress later in life.

fields.title: Explore fundraising options with Action Tutoring
fields.what_description: Browse Action Tutoring's fundraising ideas or think of your own to raise money for the charity providing tutoring for disadvantaged young people. The Hackney Half, an organised quiz, or a sponsored triathlon are just a few ideas.
fields.why_description: As a small charity, Action Tutoring will be grateful for all your fundraising efforts, and use all of your donations to extend their reach and ensure as many young people as possible can get the help they need following the school closures.

fields.title: Join the UK Youth Movement
fields.what_description: Join the UK Youth Movement to help young people build bright futures. By signing up, you'll be granted free access to events, campaigns, training, and more. You'll also be kept up to date if you agree to receive their fortnightly newsletter.
fields.why_description: UK Youth work with other charities to ensure that the youth sector is strengthened, supported, and delivers high-quality outcomes. By joining the movement, you can contribute to this goal.

fields.title: Volunteer with IntoUniversity
fields.what_description: Discover the different ways you can volunteer with IntoUniversity. Whether you're a student yourself or a member of the community, you have the power to change a young person's life by acting as a mentor, offering academic support, or work with one of the older students as they prepare to enter the workplace.
fields.why_description: Volunteers are an integral part of IntoUniversity's operation, and your contribution as a volunteer can help make a huge difference to the life of a disadvantaged young person.

fields.title: Become a tutor with Get Further
fields.what_description: If you are a graduate with a passion for using your subject knowledge to boost prospects for students from disadvantaged backgrounds, you can help to close the gap in education inequality and become a tutor with Get Further.
fields.why_description: Without GCSE English and Maths, young people are at greater risk of dropping out of education by the age of 18. They can struggle to access higher-level qualifications and face limited opportunities for progression in the world of work. By becoming a tutor, you will help students improve their skills, gain key qualifications, and excel in their futures.

fields.title: Donate to Student Minds (Pandemic)
fields.what_description: Donate to Student Minds to help transform the state of student mental health, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.
fields.why_description: Student Minds have issued an urgent appeal for donations in the wake of the pandemic, which is causing stress and concern for many students - your donation will help towards this cause.

fields.title: Download one of these graphics to raise awareness for the #StudentsDeserveBetter campaign social media
fields.what_description: Download one or more of these colourful graphics and plaster them around your social media pages.
fields.why_description: The graphics will raise awareness for the #StudentsDeserveBetter campaign and the fight to secure legal rights for students. Use the original texts or use the templates and create your own slogans.

fields.title: Sign this petition to ensure that student nurses are paid whilst on placement
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to demand pay for student nurses working on placement during the pandemic.
fields.why_description: Student nurses deserve to earn a living for their placement work. Working in hospitals during the COVID-19 pandemic is taxing on mental health and detrimental to the future of the nursing workforce.

fields.title: Join a Student Advisory Group
fields.what_description: Become a member of the Student Advisory Committee and help shape the work they do: everything from advising on important strategic decisions, to feeding back on mental health programmes.
fields.why_description: As a national charity with a vision to improve student mental health, Student Minds believe students are experts and experience. Your contribution as a member of the Student Advisory Committee would be instrumental to forming the charity's work.

fields.title: Become a book donor
fields.what_description: Sign up to Books2All pre-release list.
fields.why_description: Books2All is a registered charity which connects book donors with schools in need to help reduce rising levels of educational inequality in the UK.

fields.title: Bring your own water bottle
fields.what_description: Purchase your own water bottle, instead of purchasing single-use bottles.
fields.why_description: Plastic bottles are one of the most frequently found items on beach cleans globally. The lids commonly end up in seabirds' stomachs.

fields.title: Start a peer support group at your university
fields.what_description: If you're a student, find out how you can volunteer with Student Minds  by joining one of their peer support groups.
fields.why_description: Your involvement in a Student Minds group will play a vital role in spreading the work and message of the organisation in student communities.

fields.title: Download My Little Plastic Footprint
fields.what_description: Download the My Little Plastic Footprint app and put yourself on a plastic diet.
fields.why_description: This will help you to reduce your plastic consumption by learning to choose sustainable alternatives.

fields.title: Protect student tenants’ rights in the Renters' Reform Bill
fields.what_description: The UK Government has introduced the Renters’ Reform Bill, which has the potential to improve the rights of tenants across England. However, the Bill still needs to go through Parliament, and landlords have been lobbying for students to be exempt from parts of the Bill – including the right for tenants to give two-month notice periods in case they need to leave their tenancy early if their circumstances change.
fields.why_description: This petition urges the government not to give into pressure from landlords and ensure that students benefit from the full provisions of the Bill. Sign the petition today to protect student tenants’ rights!

fields.title: Carry a reusable coffee cup
fields.what_description: Carry a reusable coffee cup or flask. You can provide your own cup with most coffee shops when purchasing a hot drink. Or simply take your own cup for a picnic. Most retailers sell them!
fields.why_description: Around 2.5 billion coffee cups are thrown away every year in the UK alone. Less than 1% of these can be recycled, meaning most spent up to 50 years in landfill, after lasting just minutes in your hand.

fields.title: Check the microplastics in your make-up
fields.what_description: Visit Beat the Microbead, look up the names or brands of the products you use, and discover how many contain microplastics.
fields.why_description: Microbeads are a form of microplastic designed for exfoliating and scrubbing purposes. These microbeads flow from our bathrooms into the sewage systems, and then straight into the ocean, where marine mammals then ingest them. By checking for microplastics, you can be more reflective over which products you purchase in the future.

fields.title: Reduce your energy consumption
fields.what_description: Follow these simple tips to reduce your carbon footprint, and reduce the amount of plastic going into the ocean.
fields.why_description: It is not only plastic which is destroying our oceans, but also our energy consumption. By reducing both of these, you are helping protect the ocean and marine wildlife.

fields.title: Buy products from seastainable
fields.what_description: Buy a range of products, including reusable straws, bamboo cutlery set, and tote bags.
fields.why_description: Your money will help this organisation carry on to encourage sustainable and environmentally friendly conservation in Southeast Asia.

fields.title: Give up gum
fields.what_description: Chewing gum (made from plastic itself) can be swapped for plastic free alternatives.
fields.why_description: Gum contains plastic, and Britons are the second biggest consumers of gum in the world. We chew an estimated 130 sticks per person each year.

fields.title: Volunteer with the National Autistic Society
fields.what_description: Sign up for the National Autistic Society's volunteering newsletter to hear about their latest volunteering opportunities in their local branches.
fields.why_description: The NAS has many local branches that provide different types of support for autistic people, and each branch needs volunteers to operate. By giving your time to one of them, you could help provide crucial services for autistic people, whilst meeting new people and learning new skills.

fields.title: Join the National Autistic Society's Transforming Care campaign
fields.what_description: Join the National Autistic Society's Not Enough campaign to demand better support and services for autistic people and their families across the country. There's plenty of ways to get involved!
fields.why_description: By joining the National Autistic Society's campaign you can actively help towards their mission for this campaign, which is to make sure that the government's autism strategy better supports autistic people and their families.

fields.title: Donate to the Young Women's Trust
fields.what_description: Donate to the Young Women's Trust, an organisation working to achieve economic justice for young women.
fields.why_description: Your donations will: help train young women to drive local community change, fund campaigns to build equal and respectful workplaces, and fund vital services that help women recognise their own strengths.

fields.title: Donate to Bus User
fields.what_description: Donate to Bus User, a charity aiming to make transport accessible to everyone.
fields.why_description: Buses reduce isolation, inequality, congestion and pollution. Bus Users plays a crucial role – ensuring that everyone has access to the best possible transport links.

fields.title: Sign up for updates on supporting the NAS
fields.what_description: Stay in touch with the National Autistic Society to find out about their latest campaigns and what you can do to help.
fields.why_description: Research into autism is fundamental to understanding its causes, as well improving diagnosis, increasing interventions, and ultimately making a difference to the lives of autistic people now and in future generations.

fields.title: Buy a product from Sea Shepherd
fields.what_description: Buy merchandise from Sea Shepherds — from t-shirts, to hoodies, and even accessories.
fields.why_description: By purchasing one of their products, you will be helping Sea Shepherds to continue their work protecting ocean wildlife and organising global campaigns.

fields.title: Learn from one of Ambitious about Autism's campaigns
fields.what_description: Explore the range of Ambitious about Autism's campaigns advocating for greater support, care, and inclusion to be granted for children with autism within the education sector.
fields.why_description: The education system is failing too many autistic children and young people — from disproportionate levels of exclusion to a lack of understanding and support. Too many autistic pupils are being let down and are missing out on a full and rewarding education, but by joining one of Ambitious about Autism's campaigns, you can help influence both national policy and individuals' attitudes towards autism, and ultimately help create a world that is more inclusive and supportive of those with autism.

fields.title: Find out how to get an autism diagnosis
fields.what_description: Find information on how to get a diagnosis if you suspect you might be on the autism spectrum.
fields.why_description: After doing research into the condition and identifying with many of the traits, certain people may suspect that they have undiagnosed autism. This NHS resource lays out the steps to take in order to seek an autism diagnosis.

fields.title: Browse AutismLinks, a directory to autism support groups, charities and services
fields.what_description: AutismLinks is an extensive directory of autism support groups, charities and services. Browse the website to find autism support and volunteering opportunities in your local area.
fields.why_description: Local groups offer face to face contact with other people with autism, and support for family and friends. Helping or volunteering with one of these groups could have a big impact on the lives of autistic people in your area.

fields.title: Fundraise for Autism Together
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Autism Together, a charity providing autism services and support around the country. Download their fundraising pack to find out more!
fields.why_description: Autism Together provide a wide range of specialist services for autistic people and their families, including residential and supported living, as well community and family services. Your fundraising efforts will go towards funding these essential services.

fields.title: Join Anna Kennedy Online's Dance Day fundraising event
fields.what_description: Join Anna Kennedy Online's Dance Day to fundraise for the small charity, which is dedicated to promoting inclusion and equality of autistic people.
fields.why_description: Anyone can join in with Dance Day, whether they are touched by autism or would simply like to have fun and raise money for this great cause. Given this is a small charity, the funds you raise will likely have a large impact.

fields.title: Fundraise for the Cambridge Autism Research Trust
fields.what_description: Discover how you can fundraise for the Cambridge National Research Trust to support their cutting-edge research into autism.
fields.why_description: Research into austism is fundamental to understanding the causes of autism, as well improving diagnosis and interventions, to ultimately make a difference to the lives of autistic people now and in future generations.

fields.title: Donate to Ambitious about Autism
fields.what_description: Donate to Ambitious about Autism, a charity working to ensure all autistic children and young people can learn, thrive and achieve and lead fulfilling lives.
fields.why_description: Your donation to Ambitious about Autism will go towards helping autistic children and young adults live fulfilling lives, and support them and their families through the pandemic. Just £3 can make a huge difference.

fields.title: Join one of Ambitious about Autism's fundraising events
fields.what_description: Join one of Ambitious about Autism's fundraising events, for example their Virtual Challenge series to raise money in support of their aim to provide the best start to life for austic children and young adults.
fields.why_description: Your fundraising efforts will go towards helping autistic children and young adults live fulfilling lives through early years interventions, improvements in education, as well as helping them prepare for adulthood through things like work experience.

fields.title: Join a befriending scheme with an autistic adult
fields.what_description: Join the London Autism Group Charity's befriending scheme to provide friendship for autistic people, family, and carers in the London area.
fields.why_description: The London Autism Group Charity hopes this befriending scheme will help support autistic people and their carers' mental health, and reduce feelings of loneliness to those who find themselves feeling isolated.

fields.title: Fundraise for Autism Hampshire, a local autism charity
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Autism Hampshire, a local charity delivering high quality services for the diverse needs of autistic people in the area.
fields.why_description: Local charities such as Autism Hampshire are essential to providing the services and advice that many autistic people and their families rely on for support. Your fundraising efforts can go a long way when supporting local charities.

fields.title: Discover where to get support if you're autistic
fields.what_description: Explore the different support resources available for autistic people that are available through the NHS, as well as external charities and groups.
fields.why_description: Knowing the different sources of support available is important if you are looking to help either yourself or someone in your life affected by autism — or if you would like to volunteer for a charity.

fields.title: Fundraise from home in support of autism
fields.what_description: You don't have to do a big run or be a star baker to take part in a fundraiser. Ambitious about Autism offers tips and tricks for doing it from the comfort of your own home, so that anyone can help to raise money for autistic children and young people.
fields.why_description: Money raised through your fundraising efforts will go towards helping autistic children and young adults live fulfilling lives. This includes early years interventions, improvements in education, as well as helping them prepare for adulthood through things like work experience.

fields.title: Donate to Daisy Chain
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to support Daisy Chain, a UK-based charity providing support to local children with autism and their families.
fields.why_description: By donating, you will be helping Daisy Chain fundraise for their operations as a charity supporting autistic people, including developing their day centre, offering social groups, and organising activity days.

fields.title: Volunteer with Ambitious about Autism
fields.what_description: Browse volunteering opportunities with Ambitious about Autism to discover how you can give your time and skills to help autistic young people and children.
fields.why_description: Sharing your professional skills and knoweldge can be hugely valuable to autistic young people looking to start their adult lives. From becoming a Business Ambassador to taking part in mentoring and CV workshops, there are a variety of ways to get involved.

fields.title: Donate to Autism Initiatives
fields.what_description: Donate to Autism Initiatives, a charity with multiple UK locations working positively with autistic people and their families or carers to provide specialist services tailored to each individual.
fields.why_description: By donating to Autism Initiatives, your money will contribute to funding for the key services and interventions the charity provides for autistic people and their families or carers.

fields.title: Fundraise for Autism Initiatives
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Autism Initiatives, a charity with multiple UK locations working positively with autistic people and their families or carers to provide specialist services tailored to each individual.
fields.why_description: By fundraising for Autism Initiatives, your money you raise will contribute to funding for the key services and interventions the charity provides for autistic people and their families or carers.

fields.title: Walk for Autism with Autism Initiatives
fields.what_description: Join Autism Initiative for Walk for Autism, a fundraising challenge to walk 10,000 steps for 8 days from 26 March to 2 April to raise money for their charity providing support services for autistic people and their families.
fields.why_description: The money you raise by doing the Walk for Autism challenge will help contribute to funding for Autism Initiative's key services that they work to provide for autistic people and their families.

fields.title: Sign up to COVID-19 training and advice for families with the Autism Group
fields.what_description: Sign up to various COVID-19 training and advice sessions, from everything to boredom busting activities, resilience building, and mental health support.
fields.why_description: The coronavirus pandemic has exacerbated a lot of the challenges that autistic people face. Attend this training to learn more about how you can support autistic people through these tough times.

fields.title: Donate to Beyond Autism
fields.what_description: Donate to Beyond Autism to support their mission of empowering autistic people to lead independent lives through positive education.
fields.why_description: Beyond Autism believe that autistic young people should have acceses to education and workplaces that are supportive and empowering. By donating to this charity you can support their efforts in making this a reality.

fields.title: Volunteer for Beyond Autism
fields.what_description: Discover the different ways you can volunteer with Beyond Autism to support their work to empower autistic people.
fields.why_description: There are many ways that you can volunteer with Beyond Autism to support their mission of making education and workplaces more inclusive, for example by sharing your professional skills and offering work experience.

fields.title: Take on a challenge with Beyond Autism
fields.what_description: Sign up to one of Beyond Autism's events and challenges to fundraise money in support of the empowerment of autistic people through inclusive education and workplaces.
fields.why_description: Beyond Autism believe that autistic young people should have acceses to education and workplaces that are supportive and empowering. By fundraising for this charity you can support their efforts in making this a reality.

fields.title: Fundraise for the London Autism Group Charity
fields.what_description: Discover ways you can fundraise for the London Autism Group Charity to provide autism support to those living in London and the surrounding areas.
fields.why_description: Funds you raise for this local charity will go a long way in their efforts to provide support for people living with autism in London, providing advice and services to those who need it.

fields.title: Donate to the London Autism Group Charity
fields.what_description: Donate to the London Autism Group Charity to support their mission to provide autism help, support and advice to anyone needing it in London and the surrounding areas.
fields.why_description: Donating to this local charity will go a long way in their efforts to provide support for people living with autism in London, providing advice and services to those who need it.

fields.title: Download 'good fish guide' app
fields.what_description: Download Free Good Fish Guide app from the app store and Google play store.
fields.why_description: This app tells you which fish are good to eat, alongisde giving you recipes on how to cook them. This ensures fish is purchased from well-managed, sustainable places. Restaurants and cafes are also rated on how sustainably-sourced their products are.

fields.title: Sign up to one of The Autism Group's autism workshops
fields.what_description: Browse the different Zoom workshops on offer to learn more about autism, open to parents and carers in the East Berkshire area.
fields.why_description: If you're interested in learning more about autism and finding out how you can help, signing up to a workshop can be a great way to expand your knowledge and learn support strategies which you can then apply in practice through volunteering.

fields.title: Say no to plastic cutlery
fields.what_description: Carry a spork, reusing plastic cutlery, going for a compostable alternative, or just bringing your own cutlery.
fields.why_description: By doing this, you could personally save 466 items of unnecessary plastic every year. It's thought that we use plastic cutlery for just 3 minutes before throwing it away.

fields.title: Ditch the cling film
fields.what_description: Cling film cannot be recycled. Instead you could use foil, which is recyclable.
fields.why_description: Cling film cannot be recycled, however alternatives such as foil and Beeswax wraps can.

fields.title: Donate to Sea Shepherd UK
fields.what_description: Make a donation, either through cryptocurrency, a bank transfer, or postal cheques.
fields.why_description: Your donations will help this organisation continue in their work defending ocean wildlife by arranging worldwide campaigns.

fields.title: Donate to the ocean cleanups
fields.what_description: Make a one-off or monthly donation to The Ocean Cleanups.
fields.why_description: Your donations will help this organisation continue in their work of cleaning the oceans, by collecting all of the plastic found in the seas. Your money will go towards the maintenance of their vessels, and expand their resources.

fields.title: Fundraise for MARINElife
fields.what_description: Fundraise for MARINElife by arranging collection boxes, recycling ink cartirdges, or holding a fundraising event.
fields.why_description: Your money will help this organisation carry on with the research they conduct on marine wildlife, which contributes to the conservation of these species.

fields.title: Volunteer for MARINElife
fields.what_description: Volunteer for MARINElife as a offshore research surveyor, surveys route co-ordinator or a website editor.
fields.why_description: MARINElife relies on a team of volunteers. They are always eager to welcome new helpers. If you are positive, reliable and passionate about the work they do then MARINElife would love to hear from you.

fields.title: Donate to Friends of the Earth
fields.what_description: Make a monthly donation, or a one-off donation, to Friends of the Earth.
fields.why_description: Your money can help them fund their campaigns to influence the government to deliver an economic plan that helps build a greener, fairer, safer future for everyone.

fields.title: Sign this petition to fight against the government’s anti-refugee legislation in their Borders Bill
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to fight against the government’s anti-refugee legislation in their Borders Bill.
fields.why_description: Help us fight the #AntiRefugeeBill and call for an asylum system that is kind, fair and effective.

fields.title: Sign the petition to stop pay discrimination
fields.what_description: Sign the petition to stop pay discrimination and show your support for giving employees full transparency on their salaries.
fields.why_description: The culture of pay secrecy leads to women often being underpaid and undervalued for the work they do compared to their male colleagues; many women are not even aware that they are suffering from pay discrimination. Signing this petition is a much needed step towards ending gendered economic inequalities.

fields.title: Sign Oxfam's Make Care Count petition
fields.what_description: Sign Oxfam's petition Make Care Count petition to ensure that unpaid care work is valued for all the ways it helps society.
fields.why_description: This petition calls for governments to take action, recognise the value of care work, and invest in policy and infrastructure which would reduce its burden on women.

fields.title: Join the #HeForSheAtHome campaign
fields.what_description: Commit to the #HeForSheAtHome campaign and post a photo of yourself on social media with the hashtag #HeForSheAtHome.
fields.why_description: The #HeForSheAtHome campaign highlights the unfair burden on women and encourages men to do their equal share. By partaking in this campaign, you are committing to change your behaviour and combat gender inequality.

fields.title: How to teach children to challenge gender stereotypes
fields.what_description: Learn how we can teach children to challenge gender stereotypes.
fields.why_description: By drawing attention to behaviour that children may exhibit at each age, this infographic highlights how to teach children to challenge gender stereotypes, providing ways to help them rethink and challenge any preconceptions they may have.

fields.title: Calculate the number of hours you work unpaid
