fields.what_description: Use the UN Women's interactive learning tool to work out how much time you are working without being paid, how it compares to others around the world, and why it matters.
fields.why_description: This exploration of unpaid care work, the trade-offs for women, and what can be done in order to achieve equality succinctly summarises the issues at the heart of this Economic Justice for Women campaign.

fields.title: Listen to a podcast on inclusion in the digital space
fields.what_description: Listen to this podcast with the head of techUK, Jacqueline de Rojas, on diversity, inclusion, and ambition in the world of tech.
fields.why_description: The challenges for diversity and inclusion are pressing in digital companies and technologies. When faced with a team where diversity is absent, we must ensure the future is written by all of us, including women, BAME, and those later in life.

fields.title: Shop to support
fields.what_description: Buy a Trust in women t-shirt today to show that you stand with young women and support our work.
fields.why_description: Your donations will: help train young women to drive local community change, fund campaigns to build equal and respectful workplaces, and fund vital services that help women recognise their own strengths.

fields.title: Listen to the BeyondAutism podcast
fields.what_description: Select an episode from the podcast series from BeyondAutism to explore a different aspect of developments in the field. The podcast covers topics such as best practice in children's education and research advances in the field, as well as general advice on how to help improve the life of someone living with autism.
fields.why_description: BeyondAutism believes that autistic children and young people should have access to education and workplaces that are supportive and empowering. By developing your own knowledge on the subject, you can help to make that a reality.

fields.title: Fundraise for Ambitious about Autism
fields.what_description: Fundraise for Ambitious about Autism to support their aim of making sure autistic children and young people have the opportunity to thrive in life.
fields.why_description: Your fundraising efforts will go towards helping autistic children and young adults live fulfilling lives through early years interventions, improvements in education, as well as helping them prepare for adulthood through things like work experience.

fields.title: Watch 'Marine plastic pollution'
fields.what_description: Watch this 4-minute video by the International Union for Conservation of Nature about marine plastic pollution and the need for a plastic life cycle approach
fields.why_description: At least 8 million tons of plastic end up in our oceans every year. It is crucial that we reduce our use of plastic and protect our oceans, not only for the sake of marine wildlife, but also for humans and all other species reliant on marine ecostystems

fields.title: Take a virtual tour of Equiterra - where gender equality is real
fields.what_description: Virtually visit the UN Women's 'Equiterra' - a land of equal rights and opportunities for all, regardless of their gender
fields.why_description: No country in the world has achieved gender equality. That needs to change

fields.title: Sign up for Easyfundraising donations every time you shop online
fields.what_description: Sign up for regular donations with Easyfundraising which enable you to raise money for Women in Leadership for free every time you shop online.
fields.why_description: Women in Leadership is a grassroots, female-led charity that works with women and girls in Uganda. All funds raised help their community-based projects to support the health, education, and livelihoods of women and girls living in poverty.

fields.title: Share this briefing with your MP on women being left behind
fields.what_description: Download the briefing on how women are being left behind in the wake of the pandemic and the lifting of lockdowns, and share it with your local MP.
fields.why_description: COVID-19 has widened the gender inequality gap, as research by the Fawcett Society shows. Raising this issue with your MP, send them this briefing packet, and help them to see that the issue matters to you. This could lead to them supporting policies which help address the matter in the future.

fields.title: Read this report to find out how the pandemic has impacted young women
fields.what_description: Read the Young Women’s Trust report ‘Picking up the pieces’ to discover how the pandemic has disproportionately affected women compared to men.
fields.why_description: The pandemic and resulting recession has left young women picking up the pieces, increasing the existing inequality they face with catastrophic consequences.

fields.title: Read "Twelve small actions with big impact for Generation Equality"
fields.what_description: Read this article from UN Women and commit to doing the actions to help us arrive to generation equality.
fields.why_description: "Change can happen through collective activism." Generation Equality is UN Women's campaign to promote gender equality, and these 12 small actions can help to change the way we think, speak, and act, and it's those small things that can make a big difference in the long run.

fields.title: Read about Barclays' journey to diverse and inclusive leadership
fields.what_description: Read 'The Journey to Diverse and Inclusive Leadership' in Barclays Bank from CEO Ian Rand.
fields.why_description: Barclays Bank is a prime example of how corporate businesses can create an equal, progressive, and inclusive working environment for both men and women.

fields.title: Discover how a handful of fishing villages sparked a marine conservation revolution
fields.what_description: Watch this 12-minute TED talk by the marine biologist Alasdair Harris about the power of small changes for marine conservation.
fields.why_description: Marine conservation efforts often fail to properly consider the potential impact on local communities dependent of fishing for their livelihood. This talk demonstrates the power of conservation efforts led by local people invested in preserving marine wildlife and helping their communities to thrive

fields.title: Set up your own cycling group
fields.what_description: Read this page on how you can set up your own cycling group.
fields.why_description: Setting up your own cycling group means you can ride whenever and wherever you want. If there aren't many cycling groups in your local area, setting one up may encourage others to join!

fields.title: Use Stonewall's toolkits and resources to create an inclusive workplace
fields.what_description: These resources will help employers and employees to build more inclusive workplaces for LGBTQIA+ people.
fields.why_description: 35% of LGBTQIA+ staff have hidden the fact that their identity for fear of discrimination. It is therefore imperative for employers to builld an inclusive evironment for employees to work in.

fields.title: Tell people about Fill That Hole
fields.what_description: Fill That Hole is an app for people to report potholes on roads within the UK. Tell people about it or share this page on your social media, and raise awareness on how we can address the danger.
fields.why_description: Potholes are a major danger to cyclists in the UK. By informing others on how they can report potholes, it makes cycling in the UK a lot safer, and may encourage more to go out on their bikes.

fields.title: Listen to the podcast on Press freedom and media censorship
fields.what_description: Listen to Rasmus Nielsen discuss what he believes the European Commission and EU member states can do to protect press freedom.
fields.why_description: This podcast will help increase your awareness on the situation surrounding press freedom, and what needs to be done to help it.

fields.title: Watch a TED Talk on the freedom of press
fields.what_description: Watch this TED Talk on how free the press really is in the United States.
fields.why_description: In this concise, informative talk, Freedom of the Press Foundation co-founder and TED Fellow, Trevor Timm, traces the recent history of government action against individuals who expose crime and injustice, and advocates for technology that can help them do it safely and anonymously.

fields.title: Donate to support Free Press Unlimited
fields.what_description: Donate and show your support for Free Press Unlimited. Minimum donations are 10 euros, up to any amount you would.
fields.why_description: With your donations, you are contributing to press freedom and freedom of speech. This money will go towards supporting journalists in need, developing techniques to circumvent censorship, and setting up radio stations in conflict areas.

fields.title: Read the UNESCO Disinformation Guide
fields.what_description: Read one of the modules provided in this handbook on press freedom.
fields.why_description: This handbook seeks to serve as a response to the emerging global problem of disinformation that confronts societies, so that you may increase your awareness of the cases that involve the exploitative manipulation of language.

fields.title: Spot the signs of fake news
fields.what_description: Think you can tell what the signs of fake news are? Test your skills with this BBC quiz. If you don't find all the signs, why not watch the video below the quiz for more tips on how to spot a fake website.
fields.why_description: It is getting harder to tell what's real and what's fake on our social media pages, but this quiz will inform you of the simple things to look out for.

fields.title: Volunteer with Sustrans
fields.what_description: Volunteer for Sustrans, a charity that strives to make it easier for people to cycle and walk within their local area.
fields.why_description: Sustrans has a host of volunteers across the UK who are making a real difference in their local area. Even if you've only got the occasional hour to give, join them in creating happier and healthier lives for everyone.

fields.title: Donate to Campaign for Better Transport
fields.what_description: Campaign for Better Transport is a small charity, making a big difference, helping to make British transport higher quality and more sustainable. Donate what you can to them, either as a one-off or as a monthly regular payment.
fields.why_description: Campaign for Better Transport's vision is for all communities to have access to transport that not only meets their needs, but improves their quality of life and protects the environment.

fields.title: Purchase a product in support of Reporters without Borders
fields.what_description: Buy a range of products from Reporters without Borders, including posters and pin badges.
fields.why_description: Reporters Without Borders (RSF) provides information about the media freedom situation worldwide. Your support will ensure this organisation can continue mobilising public and government support, making campaigns, and protect journalists in danger as well as mobilising opinion.

fields.title: Provide Pro bono legal support to Media Defense
fields.what_description: Donate money to media defence
fields.why_description: Media Defence provide legal support to hundreds of journalists every year. With high quality legal representation, journalists can continue their critical work to keep us informed and hold power to account. £300 helps media defence provide legal advice, £1500 is enough to keep a journalist out of prison, and £25,000 can fund a defence centre.

fields.title: Become a friend of FreePress Unlimited
fields.what_description: Become a friend of the free press and make a donation starting at 5€.
fields.why_description: Your contribution will help provide the support to journalists in need, helping media in conflict areas, and develop techniques to circumvent censorship and protect sources. By becoming a friend, you will also receive priority invitations to debates, workshops, festivals and film evenings, as well as updates how this organisation spends your donation.

fields.title: Sign this petition to permanently increase Universal Credit
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to permanently increase Universal Credit, not just for 6 months, and to increase Carer's Allowance permanently too.
fields.why_description: 1.5 million young women have lost income since the start of the pandemic with many claiming benefits for the first time. The £20 uplift in Universal Credit has been a lifeline, but those receiving Carer’s Allowance and other support didn’t benefit. The Young Women's Trust are calling on the government to permanently increase Universal Credit, not just for 6 months, and to increase Carer's Allowance permanently too.

fields.title: Launch your own community radio station
fields.what_description: Read this guide on how to launch your own low-power FM station.
fields.why_description: Low Power FM stations diversify the programming you find on your radio dial. This handy guide walks you through the process of applying for a license, finding funding, and starting your own station.

fields.title: Read about the increasing fragility of press freedom
fields.what_description: Read this article and learn about how COVID-19 has exacerbated the fragility of press freedom.
fields.why_description: COVID-19 has highlighted many underlying issues in society, one of which is freedom of press. By reading this article, you will learn more about the issue itself, and what needs to be done to improve the current situation.

fields.title: Sign up to factcheck.org
fields.what_description: Sign up to factcheck.org in order to read their posts, identify misinformation, and prevent it from spreading.
fields.why_description: The most important step to stopping the spread of fake news and misinformation is to first identify it so that we can avoid sharing it. Factcheck.org identifies and covers some of the most frequently seen misinformation across trending topics such as COVID-19, pseudoscience, political news, and more.

fields.title: Tell the US Congress to Create an emergency Journalism-Stimulus Fund
fields.what_description: Tell US Congress to create an emergency journalism-stimulus fund, and to spend $5 billion to confront the crisis of press freedom.
fields.why_description: This plan includes proposals to double federal support for public media, fund newsroom jobs to keep local reporters working, and cover communities that mainstream outlets have ignored or misrepresented.

fields.title: Contribute to whistleblower platform SecureDrop
fields.what_description: SecureDrop is an open source whistleblower platform that allows sources to anonymously send documents and messages to journalists, used by more than 60 news organisations. Whatever your skill, support SecureDrop by contributing with code, design, translations, documentation, or research.
fields.why_description: The goal of SecureDrop is to create a significantly more secure environment for sources to share information than exists through normal digital channels. This tool is built on contributions within the community. By supporting them, you will be helping to secure journalist-source communications and keep this free-open source tool available.

fields.title: Fundraise for Young Women's Trust
fields.what_description: You can make a difference in the lives of young women facing poverty. Whether you run, tandem cycle, skydive or have fun hosting your own fundraising event, you’ll join a movement that’s powered by people just like you.
fields.why_description: Young Women's Trust is a feminist organisation working to achieve economic justice for young women. Raising money will help to drive local community change, build equal and respectful workplaces, and support vital services that help women recognise their own strengths.

fields.title: Subscribe to the Young Women's Trust's newsletter for regular updates
fields.what_description: Sign up for regular updates and to find out how to get involved with campaigns, events, and fundraising appeals.
fields.why_description: Young Women's Trust is a feminist organisation working to achieve economic justice for young women. Getting involved will help to drive local community change, build equal and respectful workplaces, and support vital services that help women recognise their own strengths.

fields.title: Read the COVID-19 guidance on cycling
fields.what_description: Read this page on where you can go cycling under COVID-19 regulations.
fields.why_description: Regulations are constantly changing in relation to the pandemic. By keeping up with the changes and keeping informed about where you can cycle, it ensures you can do it in a safe way.

fields.title: Read about the benefits of cycling and get started
fields.what_description: Read  the learning material about health benefits of cycling.
fields.why_description: It is important for us to be aware of the benefits that cycling brings to us in order to form good habits of cycling.

fields.title: Share the news that E-scooter hire hits London on 7th June
fields.what_description: The much-awaited London trial of dockless e-scooter hire kicks-off in early June, with 1000 scooters in five boroughs from three operators. Share the news on your social media platforms or with family and friends.
fields.why_description: London Cycling Campaign welcomes the trial as an important step towards reducing dependency on private cars and so cutting carbon emissions and pollution. While e-scooters don’t offer the full benefits of active travel, they are small, electric-powered, and offer an alternative to car use for shorter trips.

fields.title: Find your local cycling group
fields.what_description: Use this site and enter your postcode to find local cycling groups.
fields.why_description: Joining a local cycling group can be a great way of learning more about your neighbourhood, meeting new people and helping the environment at the same. By being part of a cycling group, it may encourage friends and family to also join!

fields.title: Join "the Way Forward Campaign" by joining their mailing list
fields.what_description: Join "the Way Forward Campaign" by joning their mailing list. By doing this you will receive regular emails on the campaigns they are working on, for you to join them too.
fields.why_description: The Way Forward Campaign is a campaign launched by Campaign for Better Transport to  advocate for better public transportation in the UK.

fields.title: Help Living Streets call for cleaner air
fields.what_description: Donate to Living Streets, a charity commited to campaigning for cleaner air.
fields.why_description: Did you know that over 70% of air pollution is produced by road traffic? By prioritising cleaner air and investing in walking and cycling, our decision makers can start to turn this around.

fields.title: Volunteer for Cycling UK
fields.what_description: Whether you would like to lead rides, organise events, fix bikes, marshal races or even set up and run a new cycling group Cycling UK can support you to volunteer in a role and at a level that works for you.
fields.why_description: Cycling is a environmentally friendly alternative to using cars. Volunteering for Cycling UK will aid the charity's mission in getting as many people to cycle as possible.

fields.title: Read the 10 ways you can get started on your bike
fields.what_description: Read these tips on how you can implement cycling into your day-to-day routine.
fields.why_description: Heading out on your bike can be exciting and nerve-wracking at the same time. By reading these tips on how to cycle safely, it may help ease those anxieties.

fields.title: Share an instagram story of you cycling, and tag @now_u_app
fields.what_description: Share an instagram story of you cycling and tag the @now_u_app
fields.why_description: Engaging in cycling activities makes you both mentally and physically healthier, share your moments with now-u to encourage and inspire more people to do the same!

fields.title: Join your local bus user group
fields.what_description: Find out if you have a Bus User group near you and join them in their goal to improve services for local passengers.
fields.why_description: Buses reduce isolation, inequality, congestion, and pollution. Bus Users strive to promote higher standards, raise awareness of transport inequalities, and resolve passenger complaints.

fields.title: Read these tips on how to make your transportation more sustainable
fields.what_description: Read these tips on how you can make your day-to-day transportation habits more sustainable.
fields.why_description: Sustainable transport can improve your health, save you money and benefit the environment.

fields.title: Pledge to 'stride and ride'
fields.what_description: Join the Possible Movement to promote alternative forms of travel that produce no emissions at all - walking, jogging, cycling, skating, scooting, blading, rolling, wheeling or even skipping!
fields.why_description: By swapping cars and public transport for active journeys, we can keep ourselves and those around us safe and well during the pandemic. It's also a great way to show public support for improved infrastructure for cyclists and pedestrians.

fields.title: Fundraise for Sustrans
fields.what_description: Why not raise some money for Sustrans and have some fun along the way? Browse their challenge events or set up one of your own and inspire your friends and family to donate.
fields.why_description: Sustrans are a charity aiming to make it easier for people to walk and cycle.

fields.title: Read 'Seven steps to help employers communicate with staff about cycling to work'
fields.what_description: This year has seen a huge leap in bike sales and with many people now considering cycling to work due to the global pandemic. Here are seven simple steps an employer can take to communicate with staff to encourage more cycling to work.
fields.why_description: This will not only enable more staff to cycle, but be helpful in building a healthy and environmentally friendly workplace.

fields.title: Fundraise withTeamFelix to help combat child food poverty
fields.what_description: Fundraising ideas for individuals, community, schools - For every £1 you raise, we save £12 worth of nutritious food.
fields.why_description: 1.5 million adults in London struggle to afford to eat every day, 400,000 children are at risk of missing the next meal. Meanwhile, our food industry generates almost 2 million tonnes of good, edible surplus food each year. Fundraising for Team Felix helps support food re-distribution waste. This food goes on to be delivered to some of London’s most vulnerable people.

fields.title: Give a Magic Breakfast
fields.what_description: Donate what you can to Magic Breakfast, either as a one-off payment or a monthly direct debit, to help reach more hungry children, providing a nutritious breakfast and the chance to succeed at school.
fields.why_description: Between March-August 2020, the Food Foundation reported that 2.3 million children were living in households that had experienced food insecurity. A hungry child cannot concentrate, but for 28 pence, Magic Breakfast can give a child a healthy breakfast and expert support to their school, opening up hours of crucial lesson time in the morning.

fields.title: Share the #EndChildFoodPoverty campaign video
fields.what_description: Share this 45-second video in order to raise awareness on child food poverty: what it is, how it exemplifies itself, and why it needs to stop.
fields.why_description: The government has agreed to expand both the Holiday and Activities Funding and the value of Healthy Start vouchers, but they still haven’t accepted the proposal to expand free school meals to all children living in poverty, excluding millions. The campaign is to ensure that this is implemented for the future.

fields.title: Find your nearest food bank to contact and donate
fields.what_description: Enter your postcode to find your nearest food bank. Then get in contact with them to donate any leftover food you may have. Make it a regular occurence too!
fields.why_description: It’s a challenging time for everyone at the moment as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds. Food banks are grassroots, community organisations aimed at supporting people who cannot afford the essentials in life.

fields.title: Write to your MP to reduce the need for food banks
fields.what_description: Download a template letter to your MP calling for measures to reduce the need for food banks.
fields.why_description: People visit food banks because they cannot afford to buy food. However, receiving a temporary emergency supply of food will not resolve the financial crisis they are facing. The distribution of emergency food parcels cannot solve the escalating poverty driving food bank use.

fields.title: Put a stop to idling engines in your neighbourhood
fields.what_description: Read this leaflet on the damage cars cause to our air — specifically when engines are left running unnecessarily. Then, discover the toolkit provided on how you can create your own anti-idling campaign.
fields.why_description: Air pollution is bad for our health and the environment, and we need to take steps to alleviate it. In the UK, it’s estimated that 36,000 early deaths a year can be linked to air pollution exposure. Idling vehicles —when an engine is left running while parked, stationary, or when waiting at junctions or traffic lights— contribute to our toxic air in a very real way, but can in fact be solved with a little more awareness of the issue..

fields.title: Take part in WaterAids 'Tap Challenge'
fields.what_description: Walk where you can, when you can – and help make clean water normal for everyone, everywhere.
fields.why_description: WaterAid provides clean water, decent toilets and hygiene knowledge to people who don’t yet have access to them.

fields.title: Support the WIL My Body My Rights programme
fields.what_description: You can donate to Women In Leadership (WIL) directly, or by signing up to Easy Fundraising so your shopping can raise money for WIL at no cost to you!
fields.why_description: Women In Leadership is a grassroots, female-led charity that works with women and girls living in poverty. They focus on health, education and economic empowerment. Their current My Body My Rights programme gives women in rural Uganda access to vital information about protecting themselves and others from coronavirus, and family planning information through village health teams and a mobile app service.

fields.title: Join the #FelixFoodHeroes list
fields.what_description: Sign up to show your agreement that no child should go to school hungry, and want to learn how to help.
fields.why_description: 400,000 children in London live in households short of regular, healthy food. Meanwhile the food industry generates almost 2 million tonnes of good, surplus food every year that could be rescued to feed local communities.

fields.title: Host an Afghan refugee in your home
fields.what_description: Refugees at Home is a UK charity which connects those with a spare room in their home to refugees and asylum seekers in need of somewhere to stay. Over the coming months or years, Afghan people seeking safety in the UK will need our help. If you have room to spare in your home, why not consider hosting who are seeking safety in the UK?
fields.why_description: So far Refugees at home has been responsible for placing 2,453 guests with a total of 189,209 placement nights. Many hosts report that it is a fantastic, satisfying experience, and that many have made lifetime friends.

fields.title: Learn more about what is happening in Afghanistan
fields.what_description: Read this article to learn more about the situation in Afghanistan.
fields.why_description: It is only by learning about the experiences of people who’ve been forced to flee that we can change minds, and spur people into taking supportive action.

fields.title: Share this Twitter thread gathering resources helping people in Afghanistan get out of the country.
fields.what_description: Share this Twitter thread gathering resources helping people in Afghanistan get out of the country.
fields.why_description: This could help people in Afghanistan get out of the country.

fields.title: Learn about the events that have led to the 2020 'Fed Up' rising
fields.what_description: Read this  timeline that documents the historical events that led to the protests in the wake of George Floyd's murder.
fields.why_description: Acknowledging the length and depth of the struggle against racial inequality shows the importance of today's action.

fields.title: Protect children from the climate crisis
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to protect every child from the climate crisis.
fields.why_description: The climate crisis is a child rights crisis, and we’re at a pivotal moment in the fight against climate change. As countries begin to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic, it’s time for the UK government to lead the way and put children at the heart of their global response.

fields.title: Teach someone how to ride a bike to increase their social inclusion
fields.what_description: Mama Agatha is a 59-year-old Ghanaian woman who runs a bicycle training program for migrant and refugee women in the south of Amsterdam. A 'community mother' with a larger-than-life personality, she teaches a group of women from Pakistan, Morocco, Somalia, China and elsewhere the most basic Dutch skill: cycling. Get inspired by Mama Agatha and teach someone to ride a bike too!
fields.why_description: Mama Agatha's initiative proves how a simple idea such as a cycling course can have a massive impact and radically improve the lives of marginalized social groups. She and her students are living proof that physical mobility = social mobility.

fields.title: Share 'Could you live without running water?'
fields.what_description:
Watch this interactive tgb video to imagine what it's like to live on only one bucket of water a day. Then share the video with your friends to see how they find it.

If the link isn't working, try copying this link into your browser instead: https://waterapocalypse.tgbcharity.com/en/#WaterApocalypse
fields.why_description: Putting ourselves in the position of the millions of people who don't have access to clean water helps us to understand their everyday challenges and become better advocates for global access to water, sanitation and hygiene.

fields.title: Send a powerful message at #COP26
fields.what_description: Help us amplify the message that #ThisMachineFightsClimateChange by using this action to tweet directly at your local MP, MSP, MS or MLA.
fields.why_description: Investment in cycling can help save our planet: but time is running out. We urgently need to create safe networks of cycle lanes to help reduce emissions from the UK's biggest polluting sector: domestic transport.

fields.title: Write to your MP to urge the government to help Afghan refugees
fields.what_description: The Goverment must do all it can to support all Afghan refugees fleeing the Taliban. Email your MP now asking they support Afghan refugees.
fields.why_description: Our government has said that it will take 20,000 Afghan refugees over the next five years. While this is good news, people in Afghanistan are fearing for their lives now. Additionally, our government intends to continue with legislation that will discriminate against people forced to flee danger without legal documentation. No doubt, it will include many people who will be unable to obtain visas or passports. This bill will face its third reading in the House of Commons this autumn, before moving to the House of Lords.

fields.title: Sign this petition calling for our government to commit to do more and help Afghan refugees
fields.what_description: Call on the UK government to resettle 20,000 Afghan refugees.
fields.why_description: While it is good that the UK government will accept 20,000 refugees, it will be implemented over five years. People’s lives are in immediate danger, and they need saving now – not in five years. Continue to sign petitions urging our government to do more.

fields.title: Act now to protect refugees from Priti Patel's anti-refugee bill.
fields.what_description: Sign this petition to protect refugees from Priti Patel's anti-refugee bill.
fields.why_description: What's happening in Afghanistan is a tragedy unfolding on the world stage. Nobody chooses to be a refugee. No Afghan or anyone else seeking safety today has chosen to flee from their homes. The UK government wants to turn away as many people seeking safety as possible by passing Patel's anti-refugee bill. We must say no to these plans. We must say no to racism and cruelty.

fields.title: Read this report to find out more about the asylum system in the UK
fields.what_description: Read this report to find out how the UK asylum system dehumanises, disempower and damages people trying to claim asylum.
fields.why_description: Regardless of the Government’s plans, the current asylum system already too often fails those desperately seeking safety. Instead of safety and shelter, they can be left hungry and homeless on our streets while they wait, sometimes years, to get a decision that in many cases is wrong. It’s unfair and ineffective. Read to find out more.

fields.title: Read this article about an Afghan woman's experience in Afghanistan
fields.what_description: Learn and spread the experiences and voices of Afghan people and the diaspora to your friends, family and co-workers.
fields.why_description: It is only by learning about the experiences of people who’ve been forced to flee that we can change minds, and spur people into taking supportive action.

fields.title: Donate to the IRC to help families in Afghanistan
fields.what_description: Donate to the International Rescue Committee to help families in Afghanistan.
fields.why_description: Many NGO workers in Afghanistan have been evacuated due to fears for their lives. So, it is all the more important to support ongoing rescue efforts on the ground. In Afghanistan, more than 18 million people are in urgent need of humanitarian assistance. It is quickly becoming one of the world's most dangerous places for civilians, with thousands of families at risk amid growing uncertainty. Your gift will go directly to our work supporting children and families in crisis from Afghanistan.

fields.title: Donate to Afghan Aid to provide urgent, life-saving assistance to men, women and children in Afghanistan who have been affected by conflict.
fields.what_description: Donate to Afghan Aid to provide urgent, life-saving assistance to men, women and children in Afghanistan who have been affected by conflict.
fields.why_description: In August 2021, the Afghan Taliban took control of Afghanistan. There is now tremendous uncertainty as to what the future holds for the Afghan people. However one thing which is clear is that the current insecurity is continuing to fuel a wave of internal displacement as people seek safety for themselves and their families.

fields.title: Send this letter template to your local newspaper, councillors, MPs, organisations, and anyone else that you can think of!
fields.what_description: Send this letter template to as many locally influential people and organisations that you can think of, and ask them to sign to urge the government to do more to help Afghan refugees.
fields.why_description: Local voices matter. A build up of political and media pressure can affect change in national policy.

fields.title: Download the guide and build an anti-racist workplace
fields.what_description: Read this guide on how to build an anti-racist workplace, and use the actions to create a more inclusive space for all people.
fields.why_description: Over 70% of ethnic minority workers feel they have been racially harassed in the workplace in the past 5 years. It's essential that each leader, manager, and employee seeks to create a working environment that is supportive and inclusive of everyone.

fields.title: Start a petition to campaign for LGBTQ+ rights
fields.what_description: Start a petition on a cause for LGBTQ+ rights that is close to your heart, and help those who you believe need it most.
fields.why_description: Whilst there is much work being done, it is important to incorporate all perspectives when championing LGBTQ+ rights. By starting your own petition, you may be able to help in a way that hasn't been done so far.

fields.title: Tell 'The truth about trans'
fields.what_description: Inform yourself of what the truth is about transgender people, and commit yourself to sharing this information with others.
fields.why_description: Two in five trans people have experienced a hate crime or incident because of their gender identity in the last 12 months. Help to share the truth about trans people to inform people, and to stop them being on the receiving end of these hate crimes.

fields.title: Become an active bystander
fields.what_description: Complete this training on how to become an active bystander and how you as an individual are able to challenge acts of racism and call out people for being racist.
fields.why_description: Research shows that even a knowing glance can significantly reduce trauma for the person who is being targeted. One of the most important things we can do is to let the person who is targeted know that they are not alone.

fields.title: Donate to LGBT Foundation
fields.what_description: Donate to LGBT Foundation to ensure they can continue providing services.
fields.why_description: Donations ensure that LGBT Foundation continue to be there for every LGBT person, and can provide them with lifesaving support and services.

fields.title: Learn to challenge the ones you love if they're being racist
fields.what_description: Stop allowing 'casual' racism and read this guide from Amnesty International on challenging racism from those you love, and implement it into your everyday life.
fields.why_description: Knowing how to respond to racist remarks from friends and relatives can be a minefield, but challenging racism in difficult circumstances is crucial if we're to stop everyday racism. By making them think about what they're saying, you're forcing them to consider what is acceptable, and about the consequences of their words.

fields.title: Donate to United Help Ukraine
fields.what_description: Donate to United Help Ukraine, a charity aiming to provide humanitarian aid and medical relief to victims of the conflict.
fields.why_description: The human toll of this conflict is devastating, by donating to United Help Ukraine we can help some of the people most affected.

fields.title: Support a more inclusive school curriculum
fields.what_description: Explore what is lacking for Black people in the national curriculum within schools, and find out what can be done to help using their suggested learning materials.
fields.why_description: Beyond the issue of slavery, the history of Black people in Britain is largely excluded from the national curriculum. It is essential that we extend and adapt the current curriculum to reflect our society and acknowledge the history of past mistakes made in order to grow from them in the future.

fields.title: Donate to support LGBTIQ+ people in Ukraine
fields.what_description: Donate to Outright International to support LGBTIQ+ people from further harm in Ukraine.
fields.why_description: In times of war, LGBTIQ+ people are further marginalised, and with the precedent set of discrimination in Putin's Russia, it is necessary to protect these people from coming to further harm.

fields.title: Donate clothes to people in Ukraine
fields.what_description: This is a list of drop-off centres across the UK where people can donate clothes and other items to the people of Ukraine. This list is not exhaustive.
fields.why_description: As homes are destroyed, people's belongings and clothes are lost, and people have nowhere to stay. Ensure they have warm clothes by donating to a local drop-off centre.

fields.title: Donate to Kyiv Independent
fields.what_description: Donate to this Ukranian news outlet to ensure they are able to keep reporting on the ground.
fields.why_description: As Russia advances into Ukraine, it is key to ensure Ukranian voices are still heard to ensure that we are able to hear the stories of all people involved in this conflict.

fields.title: Use this infographic to ensure you fact check information about Ukraine
fields.what_description: Read this resource, and apply it when you learn new information about the ongoing situation in Ukraine.
fields.why_description: As a modern conflict, there is a wave of disinformation spreading around. Ensure that you are able to tell what is real from what is fake, to prevent the further spread of disinformation.

fields.title: Take part in the Steps to Water challenge to raise money for Just a Drop
fields.what_description: Raise money for Just a Drop money by walking 6km and donating £1 per km, or alterntaively just donate £6.
fields.why_description: 6km is the average distance women and girls in developing countries walk to collect water. Take part in this to raise £6, which is the equivalent to support an entire family in Cambodia with safe water and sanitation,

fields.title: Send a postcard to your MP (or MSP) to let them know about eating disorders and current gaps in treatment
fields.what_description: Send a postcard to your MP or MSP letting them know about the issue of eating disorders among students and current gaps in treatment.
fields.why_description: Students are especially vulnerable to eating disorders, yet 69% of students with eating disorders report difficulty accessing support and treatment. More needs to be done to ensure that every person with an eating disorder gets the care they require at the earliest opportunity.

fields.title: Learn about what laws are already inplace and what has been done
fields.what_description: Explore various infographics,statistics and government resources on current laws inplace to improve marine wildlife conservation
fields.why_description: Knowing existing laws allow us to make sure we comply to these laws as well as think about ways in which we can take further steps and advocate for more regulations

fields.title: How has COVID-19 affected climate change?
fields.what_description: How has COVID-19 affected climate change? What do the numbers say? And what is the environment trying to tell us? Watch this short video by VOA to learn more.
fields.why_description: COVID-19 has seriously negatively impacted the global economy, bringing industries all over the world to a standstill. However, thanks to the reduced activity, decreased energy consumption, and lower oil demand, the crisis resulted in significant pollution reduction. As the world starts to reopen, we cannot return to the way we lived before COVID-19. We must invest in green development coupled with economic growth.

fields.title: Learn about the current challenges in marine wildlife conservation
fields.what_description: Go through relevant learning materials to gain an understanding of various challenges including overfishing, unsustainable consumption habts, single used plastc etc.
fields.why_description: Gaining understanding of the current challenges allows us to reflect on ways we could reduce our impact or resolve the challenges

fields.title: Join SANE's mental health community
fields.what_description: Join over 25,000 members on SANE – including carers, families, friends, and donors - and show support for mental health. It’s simple, free, and provides a platform to contribute anonymously to the community, either online or in real life.
fields.why_description: The SANE community allows everyone to stay connected on issues about mental health. It provides a safe, welcoming place for people to share their experiences, feelings, opinions, and expertise, an experience that can be both comforting and therapeutic. This thriving community sends messages of hope and compassion to anyone struggling with mental health.

fields.title: Sign a petition to improve mental health services for young people
fields.what_description: Sign a petition calling on the government to improve funding for CAMHS so that mental health services for young people can be improved.
fields.why_description: 10% of children and adolescents have a clinically diagnosable mental health problem, yet 70% of these do not receive appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. CAMHS struggle to provide this essential treatment largely due to underfunding. Better funding is desperately required to improve mental health services for young people.

fields.title: Sign Mind's petition asking to make mental health core business for every UK Government Department
fields.what_description: Ask the Prime Minister to commit to making mental health a national priority. This would mean having every Government Department working together to provide better funding for social care, to focus on public mental health, and address mental health inequalities.
fields.why_description: By signing this petition, you’re showing that there is public support for making mental health a priority. MPs are more likely to support an issue if they know that constituents back it up! This will be essential to overcome the current blocks towards better mental health in the UK- such as underfunding or understaffing.

fields.title: Read Mind's Blue Light Programme Blueprint Pack
fields.what_description: If you are an employee or volunteer in the emergency services, read Mind's Blue Light Programme Blueprint Pack for step-by-step guidance on how to become a champion for better mental health.
fields.why_description: Those who work and volunteer in the emergency services are even more at risk of experiencing a mental health problem than the general population, but are less likely to get support. Blue Light Champions play an essential role in challenging stigma and increasing understanding of mental health in the emergency services.

fields.title: Ask the Government to suspend the No Recourse to Public Funds condition to provide #ALifelineForAll
fields.what_description: No recourse to public funds (NRPF) is part of the Government’s immigration rules and is applied in a range of contexts to people who want to remain in the UK. If someone has NRPF applied to their immigration status, they will not be able to access most benefits or get support with housing, even in a time of national or personal crisis that leads to them losing some or all of their income. Join us in demanding the Government suspends this rule to ensure no child, young person or family is left with nothing to fall back on.
fields.why_description: At a time of national emergency, the Government must step in and provide a lifeline for all. Children and families from all backgrounds should be able to access the vital support they desperately need at this time. This campaign to suspend these rules and provide a lifeline to these families is moving in the right direction. Please ask your MP to act so every child has the support they need to get through this crisis.

fields.title: Link easyfundraising to donate to RAiISE
fields.what_description: Join easyfundraising and link it to RAiISE in order to support them.
fields.why_description: By joining easyfundraising and connecting to RAiISE, anytime you shop online at an easyfundraising target partner, including places like Amazon, Sainsbury's, and Argos, you also raise money to help support RAiISE! RAiISE works to support and advocate for youth living with non-visible illnesses.

fields.title: Download the 'My Little Plastic Footprint' app
fields.what_description: Download the 'My Little Plastic Footprint' app on the appstore or for android.
fields.why_description: This is an app that helps reduce your plastic consumption, by placing you on a plastic diet. It will help you to choose sustainable alternatives.

fields.title: Volunteer with Race Equality First
fields.what_description: Race Equality First are experts in the field of race equality and focus on tackling discrimination, addressing hate crime and promoting the message that race equality is a human right. As a Volunteer Champion, you can help to educate others, participate in local community events, or lead a local support group.
fields.why_description: By becoming a Volunteer Champion, you can help to promote Race Equality First's message and become an equality advocate. You'll also have access to resources, REF events, and you'll be part of a wider network of REF volunteers and staff.

fields.title: Donate to the National Autistic Society
fields.what_description: Set up a regular or one off donation to the National Autistic Society to help support their numerous campaigns and services in support of autistic people's wellbeing.
fields.why_description: Your donation to the NAS will help autistic people and their families access crucial advice and services. For example, donating £15 monthly could continue to support autistic people and their families through helpline advice.

fields.title: Add your name to the WWF campaign for higher environmental standards
fields.what_description: Sign the WWF letter to the Secretary of State for International Trade and the Secretary of State for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs, asking them to put into law their commitment to keep high environmental protection, animal welfare and food standards in trade deals.
fields.why_description: Environmental protection is essential to protect the wellbeing of the planet. As the UK decides on trade deals that will shape our climate and our health for generations to come, this is a critical time to enshrine high environmental standards in law.

fields.title: Ask your council for the cycle space your area needs
fields.what_description: Use Cycling UK's tool to show your council where you need safe space for social distancing while cycling. Just mark your suggestion on the map and "agree" with other suggestions you think are good; then ask your council to follow up.
fields.why_description: More of us have been cycling during lockdown, but improvements to infrastructure are vital to ensure cyclists can pass each other safely.

fields.title: Ask Parliament to rebuild the economy with a Green New Deal
fields.what_description: Sign a petition to ask Parliament to introduce a 10-year strategy for public investment to support a green recovery from coronavirus. If the petition reaches 100,000 signatures, Parliament must debate the issue.
fields.why_description: This action will increase our chances of building back better by the Government investing in decarbonisation of the economy and eradicating inequality.

fields.title: Join the Two Point Four Million Metres Challenge with Student Minds
fields.what_description: Pledge to travel 2.4 million metres using any method – walking, cycling, running, travelling by wheelchair or whatever works for you - to raise money for Student Minds. Complete your pledge, as a group or individual, any time between 1st August and 15th September.
fields.why_description: Students face social, academic and financial pressures at university that can have a negative impact on their wellbeing- up to a third of students experience clinical levels of psychological distress - and the pandemic has brought additional pressures. By raising funds, you will help Student Minds to get these students the support they need.

fields.title: Do the Just a Drop Dash
fields.what_description: Get involved! Run, trek, swim, cycle... take on a challenge to raise funds for some of the poorest communities around the world to gain access to clean water.
fields.why_description: The money donated will ensure that Just a Drop is able to reach vulnerable communities across the world and prepare them with the defences that they need to protect themselves against coronavirus.

fields.title: Tackling modern slavery across the globe
fields.description:
An estimated 40.3 million people worldwide live in modern slavery, 70% of whom are women and girls. This equates to 1 in every 200 people in the world. Modern slavery can take the form of human trafficking - the movement of people with the aim of exploiting them -  forced labour, domestic servitude and criminal, sexual and child exploitation. This dire situation has only been exacerbated further by the current pandemic, causing an increase in exploitation and a disruption to response efforts.

By joining this campaign, you can learn more about the struggles faced by survivors, support charities in their efforts to eliminate modern slavery, and facilitate advocacy to reduce the harm inflicted on those most vulnerable.

fields.title: Progressing understanding of autism in the UK
fields.description: In the UK around 1.1% of people are believed to be on the autism spectrum. Autistic people may have a range of behaviours and traits that could mean they need support with certain things. These include social communication and interaction challenges, repetitive and restrictive behaviour, sensory differences, special interests or hobbies, extreme anxiety, and experiencing regular meltdowns or shutdowns.\nFor many autistic people and their families, the challenges they face have been exacerbated by the COVID-19 lockdowns. By joining this campaign you can learn more about what life is like when you are autistic, help breakdown stereotypes and misconceptions surrounding autism, and ultimately support organisations working to help autistic people and their families, particularly during the pandemic.

fields.title: Improving global access to menstrual health and hygiene
fields.description: Menstruation is a normal biological process for the 1.8 billion girls, women, transgender men and non-binary persons of reproductive age across the world, yet at least 500 million of those who menstruate worldwide lack proper access to menstrual hygiene facilities. This forces them to find alternative, often unhygienic, means to manage their period, placing them at increased risk of harmful infections. Furthermore, the current pandemic further exacerbates these challenges as those who menstruate are forced to prioritise other basic needs over safe menstrual products. \nBy joining the campaign, you can learn more about these menstrual-related challenges, help to break down the harmful stigmas surrounding menstruation and facilitate advocacy to reduce period poverty.\nWe have co-created this campaign with You Humanity, whose mission is to share stories of kindness and curate campaigns with a purpose and for the greater good. It is through one of these stories that they met Sylvia Khasoa Maina, founder of Simama na DADA Initiative, a period poverty charity in Kenya, who is currently facing difficulties with funding and the schools being closed till next year. This campaign is an opportunity for You Humanity to support Sylvia and her community, and amplify their story of positive change.

fields.title: Promoting sustainable transport in the UK
fields.description: The transport sector currently contributes 22% of total global carbon dioxide emissions and 15% of total greenhouse gases. With a growing global population and incomes expected to rise, there is an urgent need to move towards more sustainable forms of transportation.\nSustainable Transportation refers to any means of transportation that is 'green' and has low impact on the environment so that it does not compromise the ability of future generations to meet their own needs. Covid-19 has presented an opportunity for the world to ‘build back greener’. This campaign hopes to raise awareness of the promise of sustainable transportation and suggest ways for you to get involved!

fields.title: Promoting global zero waste
fields.description: Wastefulness is contributing heavily to the burden on our planet’s ecosystem. Each year, the world produces more than 2 billion tonnes of waste. The amount of waste generated impacts the environment in multiple ways: it contributes to climate change, it impacts wildlife, and it is detrimental to our health. We need to work towards ‘Zero Waste’ where we only buy what we need and never throw anything away.  Instead we repurpose and reuse it until it eventually gets recycled. The time for change is now and we all have a part to play.\nOur campaign raises awareness of the impact of waste, especially plastic pollution, on the environment and on us.  We will focus on actions to reduce waste and improve its management.  Together let’s make a difference that will last by working towards a reduced waste footprint.

fields.title: Refugee welfare & resettlement in Europe
fields.description: Nearly 80 million people worldwide have been forced to flee their homes (UNHCR, 2019). Whilst the vast majority remain in their own or neighbouring countries, tens of thousands of people have died trying to reach safety in Europe. Those who do make it are rarely welcomed with support and compassion. Now, resettlement schemes, one of the few safe and legal routes to gain refuge in the UK, are at risk.\nThis campaign raises awareness about refugees and asylum seekers in Europe, with a special focus on the current situation in the UK. We connect you with actions to help improve the welfare of refugees and fight for the resettlement of people who are displaced, at-risk and without a place to call home.

fields.title: Global access to water, sanitation & hygiene
fields.description: 1 in every 10 people still do not have access to clean water (WHO, 2019), and every minute a newborn child dies from an infection caused by a lack of this basic human right (WHO, 2015). Without clean water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH), every aspect of human welfare suffers and diseases thrive. Right now, in the midst of COVID-19, this issue is more pressing than ever; without WASH we lose our first line of defence against the spread of the virus.\nThis campaign promotes awareness about the importance of WASH systems in low- and middle-income countries. We give you easy actions to advocate for WASH for all, and to support amazing WASH charities who are transforming the lives of millions.

fields.title: Advancing Economic Justice for Women
fields.description:
The gender gap in annual earnings for young women in the UK aged 18-21 is currently 32.8% and for young women aged 22-29 is 19%. This is the result of factors including discrimination in the workplace, career gender stereotypes and disproportionate caring responsibilities. The outbreak of Covid-19 has exacerbated this issue, with many women disproportionately impacted by the pandemic.
 
Not only do women face unequal treatment in the workplace, but they also carry the brunt of domestic/care work at home. This campaign aims to raise awareness about economic injustice for women by driving institutional change and breaking down gender stereotypes regarding domestic/care work.

fields.title: Learn more about zero waste
fields.description: This sits with our Environment cause

fields.title: Improving mental health in the UK
fields.description: One in four people experiences mental health problems each year (Mind). In the wake of COVID-19, it is more important than ever to speak up when we need help.\nFear and stress are normal responses to the pressures of daily life, particularly in the uncertain context of the pandemic. We should all be comfortable talking about these issues, and well-equipped to support others who may be struggling.\nThis campaign aims to contribute to a mentally healthier society, encouraging organisations and the UK government to work towards better mental health support for everyone, especially those in marginalised communities.

fields.title: Supporting people facing homelessness in the UK
fields.description: People facing homelessness have been hit especially hard by the pandemic. Despite efforts by the UK government, many still remain with little access to food and shelter. Official figures estimate that, as of 2018, there are around 320,000 homeless people in the UK (Shelter). However, these numbers often exclude the ‘hidden homeless’, who account for more than half of those affected (Crisis). Homelessness is a national crisis.\nBy joining this campaign, you can help us shed light on homelessness, decrease the stigma surrounding it, and raise awareness of the many ways in which we can all help.

fields.title: Improving disability equality in the UK
fields.description: As of 2019, there are 14.1 million disabled people in the UK (Scope) but, according to the Huffington Post, nearly half the population does not know a disabled person. This means, for most people, a lot is not understood about what living life with a disability is like. Disabled people have been disproportionately affected by COVID-19, on top of pre-existing barriers of accessibility. While disability can seem like an intimidating and sensitive topic, these issues need to be discussed. Though this campaign focuses on the experience of people with different types of physical impairments, including deafness and blindness, by joining you can learn about the range of experiences from resources largely created by disabled people, understand the conversations around disability, and what we can do to help create a more inclusive society.

fields.title: Get involved and reduce your waste output
fields.description: This sits within our Environment cause.

fields.title: Promoting sustainable eating habits in the UK
fields.description: People are waking up to the impact that their lifestyle choices have on the environment. Food production accounts for over a quarter of the world’s global greenhouse emissions, and uses up over 70% of the world’s fresh water (FAO). What we eat, where it comes from and how it was produced has a huge impact on the natural world. Our sustainable eating campaign will help you understand how you can make more ethical, environmentally-conscious eating choices, and why making this switch is so important for the future of our planet.

fields.title: Supporting LGBTQ+ rights around the world
fields.description: LGBTQ+ rights are human rights, so why are we still fighting discrimination against the community? For many around the world, the battle against LGBTQ+ discrimination may seem never-ending: a quarter of the world’s population believes that being LGBTQ+ should be a crime, 72 countries criminalise same-sex relationships, and one in five LGBTQ+ people in the UK have experienced a hate crime or incident because of their sexual orientation and/or gender identity in the last year. LGBTQ+ people not only face daily name-calling and bullying, but are also denied access to the appropriate healthcare simply due to their sexual orientation and gender expression, proving the battle is still far from over.\nOur LGBTQ+ rights campaign will help you to understand how you can help to fight for a better future for all. With educational materials to petitions against recent legislation, we hope to help make a positive change for the community around the world.

fields.title: Raising Awareness for Non-Visible Disabilities
fields.description: A ‘non-visible disability’ is an umbrella term for any impairment that isn’t easily visible to others. Some examples of these non-visible disabilities include chronic fatigue syndrome, cystic fibrosis, and diabetes, as well as various mental health conditions. Despite an estimated 70% of all disabilities in the UK being non-visible, one of the main barriers facing those with non-visible disabilities is lack of general awareness. The lack of public knowledge about non-visible disabilities means that people can be skeptical of their existence, often resulting in disabled people not being able to access the support they need. By joining this campaign you can learn about the range of non-visible disabilities, the effects they have on people living with them, and support charities that work towards improving life for people with non-visible disabilities.

fields.title: Supporting victims of the Ukraine Crisis
fields.description: On the 24th of February, Russia invaded Ukraine, creating a mass humanitarian crisis as the country plunged into warfare. Since Russia annexed Crimea in 2014, over 14,000 people have lost their lives in the conflict, and this number is rising rapidly (The Independent). As of the 5th day of the invasion, there are an estimated 1.5 million internally displaced people (Global Conflict Tracker). The actions in this campaign will help to support the people affected by this crisis.

fields.title: Green recovery in the UK
fields.description:
We are at a critical juncture. Experts have said that the world has just six months to avert a climate crisis (IEA, 2020). During the pandemic, we have seen how collective action can bring about change - carbon emissions have dropped, air quality has improved, and people have swapped cars for bicycles. 

In the wake of COVID-19, the challenge is to seek solutions which ensure we don’t return to the environmental destruction of the past. The government has promised to “build back better” - now we need to make sure that this commitment is followed by action.

This campaign raises awareness of the importance of a green recovery and offers steps that each of us can take today to contribute to a better tomorrow. We will focus on actions to drive structural change, as well as suggesting ways we can all reduce our own environmental footprint.

fields.title: Discover actions you can take to combat racism
fields.description: This campaign sits within our Equality & Human Rights cause.

fields.title: Fighting education inequality
fields.description:
The engrained foundations of inequality in the UK are no better shown than through the country’s higher education system. Despite only 6% of young people being educated privately in the UK, they make up 55% of students at Russell Group universities. Socio-economic disadvantages contribute to a number of difficulties in some student’s lives, including access to higher education and limited resources and support at university, which can contribute to a lack of development after their undergraduate studies. The Covid-19 pandemic has only exacerbated these problems further. As a society, it’s time to raise our game.

By joining this campaign you can learn more about the struggles some students face at university and what can be done to combat them, support organisations in their efforts to reduce education inequality, and drive institutional change by engaging with the policies and university practises centred around these issues.

fields.title: Promoting marine wildlife conservation
fields.description: Despite increasing global awareness of climate change and new policies committing to net zero emissions by 2050, problems regarding marine wildlife and ocean conservation have been given little attention. According to UNESCO, if no immediate actions are taken to ensure marine wildlife protection, more than half of the world’s marine species could be on the brink of extinction. This campaign raises awareness of marine wildlife conservation efforts and challenges, and provides guidance on how we can all change our consumption habits and lifestyle to help conserve marine wildlife and the ecosystems around us.

fields.title: How are children affected by child food poverty?
fields.description: This campaign falls under our Poverty & Economic Opportunity cause.

fields.title: Supporting media freedom globally
fields.description:
Throughout the last century, with the rise of social media platforms, traditional press and media have gone through various stages of revolution. The status of media nowadays has completely transformed from what we were used to 20 years in prior. 
However, what remains as one of the most challenging aspects of media is the topic of media freedom. According to the National Union of Journalists, in 2020, 42 media workers were killed, and 87% of crimes against journalism are still not resolved. 
Despite the fact that social media have made information flow more accessible to the general public, freedom in press is worsening. According to UNESCO, almost  500  journalists were  killed  between  2014  and  2018,  an  18%  increase  on  the  preceding  five year  period. With the unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic, even more challenges are imposed, 23.92% of journalists reported that they have difficulties finding independent sources since the covid-19 pandemic and to bring freedom of speech back. 
We need to understand its value, the current status of the issue, what has been done and what actions we could take against it.

fields.title: Supporting the people of Afghanistan
fields.description: Almost immediately after the United States departure from Afghanistan after a 20 year-long presence, Taliban forces swept across the country and took control of most major regions. It took them 10 days to take control of the capital, Kabul. Videos show desperate and terrified Afghan civilians clinging to the wings of US military aircraft as they take off from Kabul and tens of thousands of others have fled the country. This campaign hopes to raise awareness about the situation and offer small actions you can take to support the people of Afghanistan.

fields.title: Prevention of domestic abuse in the UK
fields.description: 14 women and 2 children were killed through domestic violence in the UK in the first three weeks of lockdown (Counting Dead Women Project, 2020).\n The coronavirus crisis isn't just damaging our economy, it's endangering our welfare, as domestic abuse rates have soared.\nThis campaign focuses on raising awareness, supporting amazing domestic abuse charities, and advocating for better prevention and support services across the UK.
